original: iḍaspade namasā rātahavyaṃ saparyatā yajataṃ pastyānām / /🔽citra icchiśostaruṇasya vakṣatho na yo mātarāvanveti dhātave /

original: śikṣā ṇo asminpuruhūta yāmani jīvā jyotiraśīmahi / /🔽mā na indra parā vṛṇagbhavā naḥ sadhamādye /🔽tvaṃ na ūtī tvaminna āpyam mā na indra parā vṛṇak / /
analyzed: śikṣa naḥ asmin puruhūta yāmani jīvāḥ jyotiḥ aśīmahi  / mā naḥ indra parā vṛṇak bhava naḥ sadhamādye  tvam naḥ ūtī tvam id naḥ āpyam mā naḥ indra parā vṛṇak
translated: Teach us in this task, O much-invoked one, that we may live and attain the light.🔽Do not forsake us, O Indra, be with us in the assembly of the good.🔽You are our helper, O Indra, you are our refuge. Do not forsake us, O Indra.

original: vayaṃ gha tvā sutāvanta āpo na vṛktabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: vayam gha tvā sutāvantaḥ āpaḥ na vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: We, O Indra, with Soma pressed, like waters on strewn grass,

analyzed: pavitrasya prasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāraḥ āsate
translated: Sit around you, O Vrtra-slayer, at the outpourings of the purifying (Soma).

original: yadindra nāhuṣīṣvā ojo nṛmṇaṃ ca kṛṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: yat indra ojaḥ nṛmṇam ca kṛṣṭiṣu
translated: If, O Indra, in the battles of the sons of Nahusha, or in the battles of men,

original: yadvā pañca kṣitīnāṃ dyumnamā bhara satrā viśvāni pauṃsyā / /
analyzed: yat vā pañca kṣitīnām dyumnam ā bhara satrā viśvāni pauṃsyā
translated: Or if in the five peoples, bring thou the glory of all manly powers for ever.

analyzed: satyam itthā vṛṣā idasi vṛṣa jūtiḥ naḥ vitā
translated: Thou art verily a bull in this, O bull-swift one, our protector.

original: vṛṣā hyugra śṛṇviṣe parāvati vṛṣo arvāvati śrutaḥ / /
analyzed: vṛṣā hi ugra śṛṇviṣe parāvati vṛṣaḥ arvāvati śrutaḥ  /
translated: For thou, O mighty one, art heard afar, and thou, O strong one, art heard near at hand.

original: yacchakrāsi parāvati yadarvāvati vṛtrahan /🔽atastvā gīrbhirdyugadindra keśibhiḥ sutāvāṃ ā vivāsati / /🔽abhi vo vīramandhaso madeṣu gāya girā mahā vicetasam /🔽indraṃ nāma śrutyaṃ śākinaṃ vaco yathā / /🔽indra tridhātu śaraṇaṃ trivarūthaṃ svastaye /
analyzed: yat śakra asi parāvati yat arvāvati vṛtrahan  atas tvā gīrbhiḥ dyugat indra keśibhiḥ sutāvān ā vivāsati  abhi vaḥ vīram andhasaḥ madeṣu gāya girā mahā vicetasam  indram nāma śrutyam śākinam vacaḥ yathā  indra tri dhātu śaraṇam tri varūtham svastaye
translated: When thou art far away, O Indra, and when thou art near, O Vrtra-slayer,

original: chardiryaccha maghavadbhyaśca mahyaṃ ca yāvayā didyumebhyaḥ / /🔽śrāyanta iva sūryaṃ viśvedindrasya bhakṣata /🔽vasūni jāto janimānyojasā prati bhāgaṃ na dīdhimaḥ / /🔽na sīmadeva āpa tadiṣaṃ dīrghāyo martyaḥ /🔽etagvā cidyā etaśo yuyojata indro harī yuyojate / /🔽ā no viśvāsu havyamindraṃ samatsu bhūṣata /🔽upa brahmāṇi savanāni vṛtrahanparamajyā ṛcīṣama / /🔽tavedindrāvamaṃ vasu tvaṃ puṣyasi madhyamam /
analyzed: chardiḥ yaccha maghavadbhyaḥ ca mahyam ca yāvaya didyumebhyaḥ 🔽  śrāyantaḥ iva sūryam viśve dindrasya 🔽vasūni jātaḥ janimāni ojasā prati bhāgam na dīdhimaḥ 🔽na sīmadevaḥ āpa tad iṣam dīrgha āyo martyaḥ 🔽  etagvā cit yau etaśaḥ yuyojate indraḥ harī yuyojate  /🔽ā naḥ viśvāsu havyam indram samatsu bhūṣata 🔽upa brahmāṇi savanāni vṛtrahan paramajyāḥ ṛcīṣama 🔽tava id indra avamam vasu tvam puṣyasi madhyamam
translated: From that place, O Indra, the singers invite thee with their songs, with their voices, with their praises, with their hymns, with their eulogies, with their prayers, with their chants, original: satrā viśvasya paramasya rājasi na kiṣṭvā goṣu vṛṇvate / /
analyzed: satrā viśvasya paramasya rājasi na kim tvā goṣu vṛṇvate  /
translated: Thou always rulest over all that is most high; none chooseth thee for his own among the cows.

original: kveyatha kvedasi purutrā ciddhi te manaḥ /
analyzed: kva iyatha kva idasi purutrā cit hi te manaḥ
translated: Whither art thou gone? Whither art thou gone? For in many places is thy mind.

original: alarṣi yudhma khajakṛtpurandara pra gāyatrā agāsiṣuḥ / /
analyzed: alarṣi yudhma khaja kṛt purandara pra gāyatrāḥ agāsiṣuḥ
translated: Thou hast stirred thyself, O warrior, O performer of sacrifices, O Purandara; the Gāyatrī verses have sung forth.

analyzed: vayam enam idā hya upīpema iha vajriṇam
translated: We have served this very one, the wielder of the thunderbolt, here.

original: tasmā u adya savane sutaṃ bharā nūnaṃ bhūṣata śrute / /
analyzed: tasmai u adya savane sutam bhara nūnam bhūṣata śrute  /
translated: To him bring the pressed Soma at this libation; now be ready for the famous one.

analyzed: yaḥ rājā carṣaṇīnām yātā rathebhiḥ adhriguḥ
translated: He who is the king of men, who moves on his chariots, the irresistible one,

original: viśvāsāṃ tarutā pṛtanānāṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ yo vṛtrahā gṛṇe / /
analyzed: viśvāsām tarutā pṛtanānām jyeṣṭham yaḥ vṛtrahā gṛṇe  /
translated: the conqueror of all battles, whom I praise as the greatest slayer of Vrtra.

original: yata indra bhayāmahe tato no abhayaṃ kṛdhi /
analyzed: yatas indra bhayāmahe tatas naḥ abhayam kṛdhi
translated: From whatever, O Indra, we are afraid, from that make us free from fear.

original: maghavañchagdhi tava tanna ūtaye vi dviṣo vi mṛdho jahi / /
analyzed: maghavan śagdhi tava tat naḥ ūtaye vi dviṣaḥ vi mṛdhaḥ jahi  /
translated: O Maghavan, be gracious to us for that help; destroy the haters, destroy the enemies.

analyzed: vāstoṣpate dhruvā sthūṇām satram somyānām
translated: O Vāstospati, the pillar of the homestead is firm for the Soma-drinkers.

original: drapsaḥ purāṃ bhettā śaśvatīnāmindro munīnāṃ sakhā / /
translated: The drop, the breaker of the strongholds of the eternal ones, is Indra, the friend of the sages.

original: baṇmahāṃ asi sūrya baḍāditya mahāṃ asi /
analyzed: baṭ mahān asi sūrya baṭ āditya mahān asi
translated: O Sūrya, thou art great; O Āditya, thou art great.

original: mahaste sato mahimā paniṣṭama mahnā deva mahāṃ asi / /
analyzed: mahaḥ te sataḥ mahimā paniṣṭama mahnā deva mahān asi  /
translated: The greatness of thy greatness is to be desired. By greatness, O god, thou art great.

original: aśvī rathī surūpa idgomāṃ yadindra te sakhā /
analyzed: aśvī rathī surūpaḥ id gomān yat indra te sakhā
translated: O Indra, if thou art the friend of one who has horses, a chariot, and beautiful cows,

original: śvātrabhājā vayasā sacate sadā candrairyāti sabhāmupa / /
analyzed: śvātra bhājā vayasā sacate sadā candraiḥ yāti sabhām upa
translated: He goes with the bird-like life, he always goes with the moon-like ones to the assembly.

original: yaddyāva indra te śataṃ śataṃ bhūmīruta syuḥ /
analyzed: yat dyāvaḥ indra te śatam śatam bhūmīḥ uta syuḥ
translated: If, O Indra, your heavens were a hundred times a hundred, and the earths were so,

original: na tvā vajrintsahasraṃ sūryā anu na jātamaṣṭa rodasī / /
analyzed: na tvā vajrin sahasram sūryāḥ anu na jātam aṣṭa rodasī  /
translated: Not even a thousand suns, O wielder of the thunderbolt, could equal you, O unborn one, in the two worlds.

analyzed: yat indra prāñc apāñc udagnyagvā hūyase nṛbhiḥ
translated: If, O Indra, you are invoked by men to the east, west, north, or south,

original: simā purū nṛṣūto asyānave 'si praśardha turvaśe / /
analyzed: sima purū asya anave si praśardha turvaśe  /
translated: You are the leader of many men in this battle, you are the one who spreads out, you are the one who conquers the Turvaga people.

analyzed: kaḥ tam indra tvā vasavā martyaḥ dadharṣati
translated: O Indra, what mortal, what Vasu, would dare to offend you?

original: śraddhā hi te maghavanpārye divi vājī vājaṃ siṣāsati / /
analyzed: śraddhā hi te maghavan pārye divi vājī vājam siṣāsati
translated: For, O Maghavan, your faith is in the farthest heaven, the strong one thirsts for strength.

analyzed: indra agnī apāt iyam pūrvā āgāt padvatībhyaḥ
translated: O Indra and Agni, this earth has come first from the two with the Padas.

analyzed: hitvā śiraḥ jihvayā rārapat carat triṃśat padā nyakramīt  /
translated: Leaving the head, crawling with the tongue, it has stepped on the thirty steps.

analyzed: indra nedīyaḥ edihi mita medhābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: O Indra, come hither with the most measured thoughts and aids,

original: ā śaṃ tama śaṃ tamābhirabhiṣṭibhirā svāpe svāpibhiḥ / /
analyzed: ā śam tama śam tama ābhiḥ abhiṣṭibhiḥ ā su āpe su āpibhiḥ
translated: With the most beneficial, most beneficial aids, with the most restful, most restful ones.

analyzed: itas ūtī vaḥ ajaram prahetāram a prahitam
translated: From here we invoke for you the ageless one, the leader, the unled,

analyzed: āśum jetāram hetāram rathītamam atūrtam tugriyāvṛdham  /
translated: The swift one, the conqueror, the leader, the best charioteer, the unerring one, the one who strengthens the Tugra people.

original: mo ṣu tvā vāghataśca nāre asmanni rīraman /
analyzed: mā u su tvā vāghataḥ ca na are asmat ni rīraman
translated: May the priests, O Nārā, not delight in us.

original: ārāttādvā sadhamādaṃ na ā gahīha vā sannupa śrudhi / /
analyzed: ārāttāt vā sadhamādam naḥ ā gahi iha vā san upa śrudhi
translated: Come from afar or sit here near us, listen to us, O bountiful one.

analyzed: sunota soma pāvne somam indrāya vajriṇe
translated: Press out the Soma for the Soma-drinker, for Indra the wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: pacatā paktīravase kṛṇudhvamitpṛṇannitpṛṇate mayaḥ / /🔽yaḥ satrāhā vicarṣaṇirindraṃ taṃ hūmahe vayam /
analyzed: pacata paktīḥ avase kṛṇudhvam id pṛṇan id pṛṇate mayaḥ  / yaḥ satrāhā vicarṣaṇiḥ indram tam hūmahe vayam
translated: Cook the cooked food for his help, make him swell who swells himself with food.🔽We invoke that Indra who is ever victorious, who is most active.

original: sahasramanyo tuvinṛmṇa satpate bhavā samatsu no vṛdhe / /🔽śacībhirnaḥ śacīvasū divānaktaṃ diśasyatam /
analyzed: sahasramanyo tuvi nṛmṇa satpate bhava samatsu naḥ vṛdhe  /   śacībhiḥ naḥ śacī vasū divānaktam diśasyatam
translated: Be thou, O thou of thousand gifts, O lord of the brave, for our prosperity in the battles.🔽Ye two, O ye rich in strength, grant us strength by day and by night.

original: mā vāṃ rātirupa dasatkadā ca nāsmadrātiḥ kadā ca na / /
analyzed: mā vām rātiḥ upa dasat kadā ca na asmad rātiḥ kadā ca na
translated: Let not your bounty ever fail us, nor our bounty ever fail you.

original: yadā kadā ca mīḍhuṣe stotā jareta martyaḥ /
analyzed: yadā kadā ca mīḍhuṣe stotā jareta martyaḥ
translated: Whenever the mortal singer may sing to the bountiful one,

original: ādidvandeta varuṇaṃ vipā girā dharttāraṃ vivratānām / /
analyzed: ādidvandeta varuṇam vipā girā dharttāram vivratānām
translated: Then let him first address Varuna with a hymn, the supporter of the ordinances.

original: pāhi gā andhaso mada indrāya medhyātithe /
analyzed: pāhi gāḥ andhasaḥ made indrāya medhyātithe
translated: Protect the cows, O son of Medhyâtithi, from the intoxicating drink, for Indra.

original: yaḥ sammiślo haryoryo hiraṇyaya indro vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ / /
translated: He who is yoked to the two bays, who is golden, Indra the wielder of the thunderbolt, is golden.

original: ubhayaṃ śṛṇavacca na indro arvāgidaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: ubhayam śṛṇavat ca naḥ indraḥ arvāk idam vacaḥ
translated: Let him hear both these words of ours, Indra.

original: satrācyā maghavāntsomapītaye dhiyā śaviṣṭha ā gamat / /
analyzed: satrācyā maghavān soma pītaye dhiyā śaviṣṭhaḥ ā gamat  /
translated: Let the mighty one come hither by his thought to drink the Soma, to the feast.

original: mahe ca na tvādrivaḥ parā śulkāya dīyase /
analyzed: mahe ca na tvā adrivas parā śulkāya dīyase
translated: And for the great price, O breaker of forts, thou art not given away.

original: na sahasrāya nāyutāye vajrivo na śatāya śatāmagha / /
analyzed: na sahasrāya vajrivas na śatāya śatāmagha
translated: Not for a thousand, O wielder of the thunderbolt, not for ten thousand, O you who have a hundred treasures,

analyzed: indra asi mama pituḥ uta bhrātuḥ abhuñjataḥ
translated: You are dearer to me, O Indra, than a father or a brother who does not provide.

original: mātā ca me chadayathaḥ samā vaso vasutvanāya rādhase / /
analyzed: mātā ca me chadayathaḥ samā vaso vasutvanāya rādhase  /
translated: And my mother has favored me, O good one, for the sake of wealth and prosperity.

analyzed: caturtha prapāṭhakaḥ prathamaḥ ṛdhaḥ
translated: Fourth Prapaṭhaka. First Ardha.

analyzed: ime indrāya sunvire somāsaḥ dadhi āśiraḥ
translated: These Soma juices are being pressed for Indra, mixed with curds.

original: tāṃ ā madāya vajrahasta pītaye haribhyāṃ yāhyoka ā / /
analyzed: tām ā madāya vajrahasta pītaye haribhyām yāhi oke ā
translated: For his intoxication, O you with the thunderbolt in your hand, come with your two bay horses to drink them.

original: ima indra madāya te somāścikitra ukithanaḥ /
analyzed: ime indra madāya te somāḥ cikitre ukithanaḥ
translated: These Soma juices, O Indra, are thought of for your intoxication.

original: madhoḥ papāna upa no giraḥ śṛṇu rāsva stotrāya girvaṇaḥ / /
analyzed: madhoḥ papānaḥ upa naḥ giraḥ śṛṇu rāsva stotrāya girvaṇaḥ
translated: Having drunk the sweet drink, listen to our songs and be generous to the one who praises you, O you who love songs.

original: ā sabardughāṃ huve gāyatravepasam /🔽indraṃ dhenuṃ sudughāmanyāmiṣamurudhārāmaraṅkṛtam / /🔽na tvā bṛhanto adrayo varanta indra vīḍavaḥ /
analyzed: ā sabardughām huve gāyatra vepasam  indram dhenum sudughām anya āmiṣam uru dhārām araṃkṛtam  /   na tvā bṛhantaḥ adrayaḥ varante indra vīḍavaḥ
translated: I invoke the one who yields abundant milk, who is praised in the Gayatri meter,🔽Indra, the cow who yields milk well, another food, with a wide stream, which is never exhausted.🔽The great pressing stones do not hold you back, O Indra, the strong ones.

original: yacchikṣasi stuvate māvate vasu na kiṣṭadā mināti te / /
analyzed: yat śikṣasi stuvate māvate vasu na kiṣṭadā mināti te  /
translated: What you wish to give to the one who praises you, the wealth, is not diminished by the one who is most in need.

original: ka īṃ veda sute sacā pibantaṃ kadvayo dadhe /
analyzed: kaḥ īm veda sute sacā pibantam ka dvayaḥ dadhe
translated: Who knows him when he drinks together with the pressed (Soma), who has placed him in two places?

original: ayaṃ yaḥ puro vibhinatyojasā mandānaḥ śipryandhasaḥ / /
analyzed: ayam yaḥ puras vibhinati ojasā mandānaḥ śipri andhasaḥ  /
translated: This one who breaks open the stronghold with his might, rejoicing, with tawny hair.

analyzed: yat indra śāsaḥ avratam cyāvaya sadasaḥ pari
translated: If, O Indra, thou wouldst drive away the lawless one from the assembly,

analyzed: asmākam aṃśum maghavan puruspṛham vasavye adhi barhaya  /
translated: O Maghavan, increase our portion, much-desired, in the possession of good things.

original: tvaṣṭā no daivyaṃ vacaḥ parjanyo brahmaṇaspatiḥ /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā naḥ daivyam vacaḥ parjanyaḥ brahmaṇaspatiḥ
translated: Tvashtar, the divine speech, Parjanya, Brahmanaspati,

original: putrairbhrātṛbhiraditirnu pātu no duṣṭaraṃ trāmaṇaṃ vacaḥ / /
analyzed: putraiḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ aditiḥ nu pātu naḥ duṣṭaram trāmaṇam vacaḥ  /
translated: May Aditi with her sons and brothers protect our difficult-to-cross, desirable speech.

original: kadā ca na starīrasi nendra saścasi dāśuṣe /
analyzed: kadā ca na starīrasi na indra saścasi dāśuṣe
translated: When, O Indra, do you not become the protector of the sacrificer? You do not forsake him.

original: upopennu maghavanbhūya innu te dānaṃ devasya pṛcyate / /
analyzed: upa upa id nu maghavan bhūyaḥ id nu te dānam devasya pṛcyate  /
translated: Again and again, O Maghavan, your gift, O god, is increased.

original: yuṅkṣvā hi vṛtrahantama harī indra parāvataḥ /
analyzed: yuṅkṣva hi vṛtra hantama harī indra parāvataḥ
translated: Yoke, O Vritra-slayer, your two bay horses, O Indra, from afar.

analyzed: arvācīnaḥ maghavan soma pītaye ugraḥ ṛṣvebhiḥ ā gahi  /
translated: Come hither, O Maghavan, with the mighty ones, for the drinking of Soma.

analyzed: tvām idā hyas pīpyan vajrin bhūrṇayaḥ
translated: You, O wielder of the thunderbolt, have been pressed by the men, the impetuous ones.

original: sa indra stomavāhasa iha śrudhyupa svasaramā gahi / /
analyzed: saḥ indra stoma vāhasaḥ iha śrudhi upa svasaramā gahi  /
translated: O Indra, who carries the praise, listen here, come to your own abode.
The daughter of the sky.

original: apo mahī vṛṇute cakṣuṣā tamo jyotiṣkṛṇoti sūnari / /🔽imā u vāṃ diviṣṭaya usrā havante aśvinā /
analyzed: apaḥ mahī vṛṇute cakṣuṣā tamaḥ jyotiṣkṛṇoti sūnare  imāḥ u vām diviṣṭayaḥ usrā havante aśvinā
translated: The great one chooses the waters with her eye, she makes the light shine forth, the good one.🔽These two, the worshippers of heaven, the two Asvins, are invoked by you.

original: ayaṃ vāmahve 'vase śacīvasū viśaṃviśaṃ hi gacchathaḥ / /
analyzed: ayam vām ahve vase śacī vasū viśam viśam hi gacchathaḥ  /
translated: I call you for help, O you two rich in strength, for you go to every clan.

original: ku ṣṭhaḥ ko vāmaśvinā tapāno devā martyaḥ /
analyzed: ku kaḥ vām aśvinā tapānaḥ devāḥ martyaḥ
translated: Who, O Aśvins, is the leper, who the mortal man who burns with fever?

analyzed: ghnatā vām aśmayā
translated: Slay him with the stone, O ye Gods, with the dart, even as he is, this very day.

original: ayaṃ vāṃ madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ somo diviṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: ayam vām madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ somaḥ diviṣṭiṣu
translated: This is the sweetest meath for you, the Soma pressed at the feasts in heaven.

original: tamaśvinā pibataṃ tiro ahnyaṃ dhattaṃ ratnāni dāśuṣe / /
analyzed: tam aśvinā pibatam tiras ahnyam dhattam ratnāni dāśuṣe
translated: Drink ye thereof, O Aśvins, through a hundred winters, and bestow on him who offers treasures.

original: ā tvā somasya galdayā sadā yācannahaṃ jyā /
analyzed: ā tvā somasya galdayā sadā yācan aham jyā
translated: With the Soma's flowing I have ever sought thee, O thou who art to be won by the worshipper.

original: bhūrṇiṃ mṛgaṃ na savaneṣu cukrudhaṃ ka īśānaṃ na yāciṣat / /
analyzed: bhūrṇim mṛgam na savaneṣu cukrudham kaḥ īśānam na yāciṣat  /
translated: Who would not seek thee, the impetuous one, as one who is to be won at the libations?

analyzed: adhvaryo drāvaya tvam somam indraḥ pipāsati
translated: O Adhvaryu, drive thou forward the Soma: Indra is thirsty.

original: upo nūnaṃ yuyuje vṛṣṇā harī ā ca jagāma vṛtrahā / /🔽abhī ṣatastadā bharendra jyāyaḥ kanīyasaḥ /
analyzed: upa u nūnam yuyuje vṛṣṇā harī ā ca jagāma vṛtrahā  / abhi sataḥ tadā bhara indra jyāyaḥ kanīyasaḥ
translated: He hath now yoked his two strong Bay Horses, and the Vr̥itra-slayer hath come nigh to us.🔽I bring thee hitherward, O Indra, the greater from the less,

analyzed: purūvasuḥ hi maghavan babhūvitha bharebhare ca havyaḥ
translated: For thou, O Maghavan, art rich in many treasures, and art to be invoked in every fight.

original: yadindra yāvatastvametāvadahamīśīya /🔽stotāramiddadhiṣe radāvaso na pāpatvāya raṃsiṣam / /🔽tvamindra pratūrtiṣvabhi viśvā asi spṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: yat indra yāvataḥ tvam etāvat aham īśīya    stotāram id dadhiṣe radāvaso na pāpatvāya raṃsiṣam  /    tvam indra pratūrtiṣu abhi viśvāḥ asi spṛdhaḥ
translated: If, O Indra, I were possessed of as much wealth as thou,🔽Then, O Bounteous Lord, I should be thy praiser, and should not be despised.🔽Thou, O Indra, in all battles, art the conqueror of all foes.

original: aśastihā janitā vṛtratūrasi tvaṃ tūrya taruṣyataḥ / /
analyzed: aśasti hā janitā vṛtratūrasi tvam tūrya taruṣyataḥ
translated: Thou art the slayer of the Vr̥itra, the queller of the curse: thou art the victor over those who merit not oblations.

original: pra yo ririkṣa ojasā divaḥ sadobhyaspari /
analyzed: pra yaḥ ririkṣe ojasā divaḥ sadobhyaḥ pari
translated: He who, with might, would fain rise up to the seats of heaven,

original: na tvā vivyāca raja indra pārthivamati viśvaṃ vavakṣitha / /
analyzed: na tvā vivyāca rajaḥ indra pārthivam ati viśvam vavakṣitha  /
translated: Not the sky, O Indra, can resist thee: thou hast filled all the earth.

analyzed: asāvi devam goṛjīkam andhaḥ ni asmin indraḥ
translated: The brown one has pressed the God who delights in the cow: in his birth he has called Indra.

original: bodhāmasi tvā haryaśva yajñairbodhā na stomamandhaso madeṣu / /
analyzed: bodhāmasi tvā haryaśva yajñaiḥ bodha naḥ stomam andhasaḥ madeṣu
translated: We awaken thee, O thou of the bay steeds, with sacrifices: awaken to the praise of the juice in the wild joys.

original: yoniṣṭa indra sadane akāri tamā nṛbhiḥ purūhūta pra yāhi /
analyzed: indra sadane akāri tamā nṛbhiḥ purūhūta pra yāhi
translated: The seat has been made for thee, O Indra, in the house: come thither, O much-invoked, with men.

original: aso yathā no 'vitā vṛdhaściddado vasūni mamadaśca somaiḥ / /🔽adardarutsamasṛjo vi khāni tvamarṇavānbadbadhānāṃ aramṇāḥ /
analyzed: asaḥ yathā naḥ vitā vṛdhaḥ cit dadaḥ vasūni mamadaḥ ca somaiḥ  adardar utsamasṛjaḥ vi khāni tvam arṇavān badbadhānām aramṇāḥ
translated: Be thou as a protector and increaser to us: give us treasures, and rejoice in the Soma libations.🔽Thou hast cleft the mountain, thou hast opened the firmaments: thou hast made the oceans easy to cross.

original: mahāntamindra parvataṃ vi yadvaḥ sṛjaddhārā ava yaddānavānhan / /
analyzed: mahantam indra parvatam vi yat vaḥ sṛjat hārāḥ ava yat dānavān han  /
translated: When thou, O great Indra, hast thrown open the great mountain, and hast slain the Dânavas with the streams.

original: suṣvāṇāsa indra stumasi tvā saniṣyantaścittuvinṛmṇa vājam /
analyzed: suṣvāṇāsaḥ indra stumasi tvā saniṣyantaḥ cittu vinṛmṇa vājam
translated: We, O Indra, are fain to praise thee, O thou who art to be praised, to win the booty, O thou who art irresistible.

original: ā no bhara suvitaṃ yasya konā tanā tmanā sahyāmā tvotāḥ / /
analyzed: ā naḥ bhara suvitam yasya konā tanā tmanā sahyāma tvotāḥ  /
translated: Bring us the prosperity which none may overcome, which may be easily overcome by ourselves, and which is to be aided by thee.

original: jagṛhmā te dakṣiṇamindra hastaṃ vasūyavo vasupate vasūnām /
analyzed: jagṛhma te dakṣiṇam indra hastam vasūyavaḥ vasu pate vasūnām
translated: We have taken thy right hand, O Indra, O thou who art to be won by goods, O lord of goods, O thou who hast goods.

original: vidmā hi tvā gopatiṃ śūra gonāmasmabhyaṃ citraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayindāḥ / /
analyzed: vidma hi tvā gopatim śūra gonām asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayindāḥ
translated: For we know thee as the lord of cattle, O hero, as the giver of wondrous and mighty wealth to us.

original: indraṃ naro nemadhitā havanti yatpāryā yunajate dhiyastāḥ /🔽śūro nṛṣātā śravasaśca kāma ā gomati vraje bhajā tvaṃ naḥ / /🔽vayaḥ suparṇā upa sedurindraṃ priyamedhā ṛṣayo nādhamānāḥ /
analyzed: indram naraḥ nemadhitā havanti yat pāryāḥ yunajate dhiyaḥ tāḥ  śūraḥ nṛṣātā śravasaḥ ca kāmaḥ ā gomati vraje bhaja tvam naḥ  /   vayaḥ suparṇāḥ upa seduḥ indram priyamedhāḥ ṛṣayaḥ nādhamānāḥ
translated: Men, O Indra, who are skilled in sacrifice, call thee, when they yoke their thoughts for the prize.🔽Be thou, O hero, who lovest fame among men, a helper to us in the dwelling of the rich in cattle.🔽The birds of fair flight have approached Indra, the Rṣis, the singers of dear hymns, with their thoughts.

analyzed: apa dhvāntam ūrṇuhi pūrdhi baddhān
translated: Drive away the darkness, free those who are bound.

original: nāke suparṇamupa yatpatantaṃ hṛdā venanto abhyacakṣata tvā /🔽hiraṇyapakṣaṃ varuṇasya dūtaṃ yamasya yonau śakunaṃ bhuraṇyum / /
analyzed: nāke suparṇam upa yat patantam hṛdā venantaḥ abhyacakṣata tvā  hiraṇya pakṣam varuṇasya dūtam yamasya yonau śakunam bhuraṇyum
translated: When, with longing hearts, they beheld thee, the bird of fair feathers, flying up to the vault of the sky,🔽The bird of Varuna, the swift messenger, in the abode of Yama.

original: brahma jajñānaṃ prathamaṃ purastādvi sīmataḥ suruco vena āvaḥ /
analyzed: brahma jajñānam prathamam purastāt vi sīmataḥ su rucaḥ venaḥ āvaḥ
translated: The Brahman, born first, in the beginning, thou hast brought forth from the boundary, O Vena, the well-shining ones.

original: sa budhnyā upamā asya viṣṭhāḥ sataśca yonimasataśca vivaḥ / /🔽apūrvyā purutamānyasmai mahe vīrāya tavase turāya /
analyzed: sa budhnyāḥ upamāḥ asya viṣṭhāḥ sataḥ ca yonim asataḥ ca vivar  apūrvyā purutamā anyasmai mahe vīrāya tavase turāya
translated: His are the deep, the high, the low, the near, the distant dwellings.🔽To him, the most ancient, the most mighty, the hero, the strong, the swift,

original: virapśine vajriṇe śantamāni vacāṃsyāsmai sthavirāya takṣuḥ / /
analyzed: virapśine vajriṇe śantamāni vacāṃsi ā asmai sthavirāya takṣuḥ  /
translated: The most excellent words, O ye wise ones, to him, the mighty, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the possessor of the fair belly.

original: ava drapso aṃśumatīmatiṣṭhadīyānaḥ kṛṣṇo daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ /
analyzed: ava drapsaḥ aṃśumatīm atiṣṭhat īyānaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ
translated: The drop hath settled in the stalk that holds it, the dark-hued one, with ten thousand others.

original: āvattamindraḥ śacyā dhamantamapa snīhitiṃ nṛmaṇā adhadrāḥ / /
analyzed: āvattam indraḥ śacyā dhamantam apa snīhitim nṛmaṇāḥ adhadrāḥ  /
translated: Indra hath drawn away the water-drinking, the water-loving, from the man who worships.

original: vṛtrasya tvā śvasathādīṣamāṇā viśve devā ajahurye sakhāyaḥ /
analyzed: vṛtrasya tvā śvasathāt īṣamāṇāḥ viśve devāḥ ajahuḥ ye sakhāyaḥ
translated: The All-Gods, thy friends, O Indra, have delivered thee from Vritra's mouth, when thou wast fain to breathe.

original: marudbhirindra sakhyaṃ te astvathemā viśvāḥ pṛtanā jayāsi / /
analyzed: marudbhiḥ indra sakhyam te astu atha imāḥ viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ jayāsi  /
translated: With the Maruts let thy friendship be, O Indra: then shalt thou conquer all these gathered armies.

original: vidhuṃ dadrāṇaṃ samane bahūnāṃ yuvānaṃ santaṃ palito jagāra /
analyzed: vidhum dadrāṇam samane bahūnām yuvānam santam palitaḥ jagāra
translated: The young, who was fain to breathe in the mouth of many, the bright one, the Maruts have delivered.

original: devasya paśya kāvyaṃ mahitvādyā mamāra sa hyaḥ samāna / /
analyzed: devasya paśya kāvyam mahi tvāt yā mamāra sa hyas samāna
translated: Behold the greatness of the God's high wisdom: he hath been born, the living, in the living.

original: tvaṃ ha tyatsaptabhyo jāyamāno 'śatrubhyo abhavaḥ śatrurindra /
analyzed: tvam ha tyad saptabhyaḥ jāyamānaḥ śatrubhyaḥ abhavaḥ śatruḥ indra
translated: Thou, even thou, O Indra, being born from seven, hast become the foe of those who were no enemies.

original: gūḍhe dyāvāpṛthivī anvavindo vibhumadbhyo bhuvanebhyo raṇaṃ dhāḥ / /🔽meḍiṃ na tvā vajriṇaṃ bhṛṣṭimantaṃ purudhasmānaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ sthirapsnum /
analyzed: gūḍhe dyāvāpṛthivī anvavindaḥ vibhumadbhyaḥ bhuvanebhyaḥ raṇam dhāḥ  /   meḍim na tvā vajriṇam bhṛṣṭimantam puru dhasmānam vṛṣabham sthirapsnum
translated: In the concealed Dyaus and Prithivī thou hast discovered: give us room in the wide-spreading worlds.🔽I praise thee, O Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the terrible, the very bountiful, the strong, the firm-handed,

analyzed: karoṣi aryaḥ taruṣīḥ duvasyuḥ indra dyukṣam vṛtra haṇam gṛṇīṣe  /
translated: The noble, the impetuous, the faithful, the bountiful, the heaven-like, the Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: pra vo mahe mahevṛdhe bharadhvaṃ pracetase pra sumatiṃ kṛṇudhvam /
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahe mahevṛdhe bharadhvam pracetase pra sumatim kṛṇudhvam
translated: Bring to the great, the very mighty, your gift: to the far-seeing one make ye your prayer.

original: viśaḥ pūrvīḥ pra cara carṣaṇiprāḥ / /🔽śunaṃ huvema maghavānamindramasminbhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /🔽śṛṇvantamugramūtaye samatsu dhnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi sañjitaṃ dhanāni / /
analyzed: viśaḥ pūrvīḥ pra cara carṣaṇi prāḥ  śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau  śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu dhnantam vṛtrāṇi sañjitam dhanāni  /
translated: The many people, the lord of men, move forward.🔽We will invoke the prosperous Indra, the best of men, in this task, in the battle for booty.🔽The mighty one who listens for protection in battles, who destroys the Vr̥itras, who wins the prizes.

original: udu brahmāṇyairata śravasyendraṃ samarye mahayā vasiṣṭha /
analyzed: udu brahmāṇi airata śravasyā indram samarye mahaya vasiṣṭha
translated: Utter your prayers, O Vasisṭha, for glory, exalt Indra in the battle.

original: ā yo viśvāni śravasā tatānopaśrotā ma īvato vacāṃsi / /
analyzed: ā yaḥ viśvāni śravasā tatāna upaśrotā me īvataḥ vacāṃsi
translated: He who has extended all things by his fame, who listens to my words of praise.

analyzed: cakram yat asya apsvā niṣattam uta u tat asmai madhu id cacchadyāt
translated: The wheel which is set in the waters, may that sweet-voiced one grant to him.

analyzed: pṛthivyām atiṣitam yat ūdhar payaḥ goṣu adadhāḥ oṣadhīṣu
translated: The milk which is well-placed on the earth, the milk which is in the cows and the plants.

original: tyamū ṣu vājinaṃ devajūtaṃ sahovānaṃ tarutāraṃ rathānām /
analyzed: tyamū su vājinam deva jūtam sahovānam tarutāram rathānām
translated: That strong one who is urged by the gods, who possesses strength, who is a swift conqueror of chariots,

original: ariṣṭanemiṃ pṛtanājamāśuṃ svastaye tārkṣyamihā huvema / /🔽trātāramindramavitāramindraṃ havehave suhavaṃ śūramindram /🔽huve nu śakraṃ puruhūtamindramidaṃ havirmaghavā vetvindraḥ / /
analyzed: ariṣṭa nemim pṛtanājam āśum svastaye tārkṣyam iha ā huvema  /   trātāram indram avitāram indram havehave su havam śūram indram    huve nu śakram puru hūtam indram idam haviḥ maghavā vetu indraḥ
translated: Whose wheel is unbroken, who is swift in battle, we will invoke Tarkshya for our well-being.🔽Indra the protector, Indra the deliverer, the mighty Indra who is to be invoked in every battle,🔽I invoke Indra the powerful, the much-invoked, may the bountiful Indra enjoy this oblation.

analyzed: yajāmahe indram vajra dakṣiṇam harīṇām vivratānām
translated: We worship Indra, whose right hand wields the thunderbolt, the one who yokes the two bays,

original: pra śmaśrubhirdodhuvadūrdhvadhā bhuvadvi senābhirbhayamāno vi rādhasā / /🔽satrāhaṇaṃ dādhṛṣiṃ tumramindraṃ mahāmapāraṃ vṛśabhaṃ suvajram /
analyzed: pra śmaśrubhiḥ dodhuvat ūrdhvadhā bhuvat vi senābhiḥ bhayamānaḥ vi rādhasā  satrāhaṇam dādhṛṣim tumram indram mahām apāram vṛśabham su vajram
translated: He has shaken his beard upwards and sideways, he has gone forth with his armies, fearing (us), with his bounty.🔽Indra, the smiter of forts, the daring, the mighty, the boundless, the bull, the good wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: hantā yo vṛtraṃ sanitota vājaṃ dātā maghāni maghavā surādhāḥ / /
analyzed: hantā yaḥ vṛtram sanitā uta vājam dātā maghāni maghavā su rādhāḥ
translated: The slayer of Vrtra, the winner of booty, the giver of great gifts, the bountiful one, the bestower of abundant wealth.

original: yo no vanuṣyannabhidāti marta ugaṇā vā manyamānasturo vā /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ vanuṣyan abhidāti martaḥ ugaṇā vā manyamānaḥ turaḥ vā
translated: The mortal who, despising us, attacks us, whether he is a gatherer or one who thinks himself strong,

original: kṣidhī yudhā śavasā vā tamindrābhī ṣyāma vṛṣamaṇastvotāḥ / /
analyzed: kṣidhī yudhā śavasā vā tam indra abhī syāma vṛṣamaṇastva ūtāḥ
translated: Slay him in battle with thy strength, O Indra; may we be his who is to be aided by thee.

original: yaṃ vṛtreṣu kṣitaya spardhamānā yaṃ yukteṣu turayanto havante /
analyzed: yam vṛtreṣu kṣitayaḥ spardhamānāḥ yam yukteṣu turayantaḥ havante
translated: Him whom they invoke in battles with Vrtra, whom they invoke in contests with yoked (chariots),

original: yaṃ śūrasātau yamapāmupajmanyaṃ viprāso vājayante sa indraḥ / /
analyzed: yam śūrasātau yam apām upajmanyam viprāsaḥ vājayante saḥ indraḥ
translated: Him whom the poets invoke in the winning of heroes, in the winning of cattle, he is Indra.

original: indrāparvatā bṛhatā rathena vāmīriṣa ā vahataṃ suvīrāḥ /
analyzed: indrāparvatā bṛhatā rathena vāmīriṣaḥ ā vahatam su vīrāḥ
translated: O Indra and Parvata, bring with your great chariot rich gifts with good heroes.

original: vītaṃ havyānyadhvareṣu devā vardhethāṃ gīrbhīriḍayā madantā / /
analyzed: vītam havyāni adhvareṣu devā vardhethām gīrbhīriḍayā madantā  /
translated: Accept the oblations at the sacrifices, O Gods; increase with the hymns, rejoicing in the laud.

original: indrāya giro aniśitasargā apaḥ prairayatsagarasya budhnāt /
analyzed: indrāya giraḥ aniśita sargāḥ apaḥ prairayat sagarasya budhnāt
translated: To Indra have been sent the songs with their sharp-pointed courses, he has sent forth the waters from the depths of the ocean,

original: yo akṣeṇeva cakriyau śacībhirviṣvaktastambha pṛthivīmuta dyām / /
analyzed: yaḥ akṣeṇa iva cakriyau śacībhiḥ viṣvakta stambha pṛthivīm uta dyām
translated: Who with his might, as with a pivot, has fixed both heaven and earth on every side.

original: ā tvā sakhāyaḥ sakhyā vavṛtyustiraḥ purū cidarṇavāṃ jagamyāḥ /
analyzed: ā tvā sakhāyaḥ sakhyā vavṛtyuḥ tiras purū cit arṇavām jagamyāḥ
translated: May thy friends turn to thee, O friend, and come to thee. Pass over many a stream.

original: piturnapātamā dadhita vedhā asminkṣaye pratarāṃ dīdyānaḥ / /
analyzed: piturnapātamāḥ dadhita vedhāḥ asmin kṣaye pratarām dīdyānaḥ  /
translated: Place in the protection of the father, O creator, shining more quickly in this abode.

original: ko adya yuṅkte dhuri gā ṛtasya śimīvato bhāmino durhṛṇāyūn /
analyzed: kaḥ adya yuṅkte dhuri gāḥ ṛtasya śimīvataḥ bhāminaḥ durhṛṇāyūn
translated: Who today yokes to the pole the two oxen of truth, the strong, the beautiful, the difficult to subdue?

analyzed: āsanneṣām apsuvāhaḥ mayobhūn yaḥ eṣām bhṛtyām ṛṇadhat sa jīvāt  /
translated: May they, whose charioteer is water, be near, may he who has given them wages live.

analyzed: caturtha prapāṭhakaḥ dvitīyaḥ ṛdhaḥ
translated: Fourth recitation, second half.

analyzed: gāyanti tvā gāyatriṇaḥ rcanti arkam arkiṇaḥ
translated: The Gāyatrī-reciters sing to you, the Arkya-reciters praise the Arkya.

analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ tvā śatakrato udvaṃśam iva yemire
translated: The Brahmins have stretched you out like a beam, O Śatakratu.

analyzed: indram viśvāḥ avīvṛdhan samudra vyacasam giraḥ
translated: All the songs have increased Indra, whose expanse is like the ocean.

analyzed: rathītamam rathīnām vājānām satpatim patim
translated: The best of charioteers, the lord of lords, the lord of strength.

analyzed: imam indra sutam piba jyeṣṭham amartyam madam
translated: O Indra, drink this pressed (Soma), the best, immortal, exhilarating drink.

analyzed: śukrasya tvā abhyakṣarandhārāḥ ṛtasya sādane
translated: The stream of truth has flowed forth to thee, O bright one, in the abode of truth.

original: yadindra citra ma iha nāsti tvādātamadrivaḥ /
analyzed: yat indra citra me iha na asti tvādātam adrivas
translated: If, O Indra, wondrous, here is nothing to be given to me, O wielder of the thunderbolt,

analyzed: rādhaḥ tat naḥ vidadvaso ubhayāhastyā bhara
translated: Grant us that bounty which thou knowest, O thou who hast wealth in both hands, bring it!

original: śrudī havaṃ tiraścyā indra yastvā saparyati /
analyzed: śrudi havam tiraścyāḥ indra yaḥ tvā saparyati
translated: O Indra, hear the call of him who lies across, who serves thee,

analyzed: su vīryasya gomataḥ rāyaspūrdhi mahān asi
translated: Of good heroism, of the possession of cattle, increase our wealth, thou art great.

original: asāvi soma indra te śaviṣṭha dhṛṣṇavā gahi /
analyzed: asāvi somaḥ indra te śaviṣṭha dhṛṣṇavā gahi
translated: The Soma has been pressed for thee, O Indra, most powerful, daring one, come.

original: ā tvā pṛṇaktvindriyaṃ rajaḥ sūryo na raśmibhiḥ / /
analyzed: ā tvā pṛṇaktu indriyam rajaḥ sūryaḥ na raśmibhiḥ
translated: May the region of power pervade thee, O Indra, as the sun with its rays.

analyzed: ā indra yāhi haribhiḥ upa kaṇvasya suṣṭutim
translated: O Indra, come with thy two bay horses to Kaṇva's eulogy.

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso / /🔽ā tvā giro rathīrivāsthuḥ suteṣu girvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso  ā tvā giraḥ rathīḥ iva asthuḥ suteṣu girvaṇaḥ
translated: From the rule of this very heaven, O you who have heaven as your abode, go to heaven, O you who have heaven as your abode.🔽O you who love the song, the songs have come to thee as a charioteer to the libations.

original: abhi tvā samanūṣata gāvo vatsaṃ na dhenavaḥ / /🔽eto nvindraṃ stavāma śuddhaṃ śuddhena sāmnā /
analyzed: abhi tvā samanūṣata gāvaḥ vatsam na dhenavaḥ    eta u nu indram stavāma śuddham śuddhena sāmnā
translated: They have followed thee, as milch cows follow their calf.🔽Let us now praise Indra, the pure one, with a pure hymn.

analyzed: śuddhaiḥ ukthaiḥ vāvṛdhvāṃsam śuddhaiḥ āśīḥ vānmamattu
translated: May he, whom we magnify with pure praises, rejoice in pure libations.

original: sīdantaste vayo yathā gośrīte madhau madire vivakṣaṇe /
analyzed: R sīdantaḥ te vayaḥ yathā go śrīte madhau madire vivakṣaṇe
translated: Sitting as on your own back, in the sweet, intoxicating, well-formed drink that is like the beauty of cows,

analyzed: abhi tvām indra nonumaḥ
translated: We praise you, O Indra.

analyzed: vayam u tvām apūrvya sthūram na kiṃcid bharantaḥ vasyavaḥ
translated: We, O you who are without compare, bearing you, the great one, in our need,

original: vajriñcitraṃ havāmahe / /🔽svādoritthā viṣūvato madhoḥ pibanti gauryaḥ /
analyzed: vajrin citram havāmahe    svādoḥ itthā viṣūvataḥ madhoḥ pibanti gauryaḥ
translated: We call upon you, O wielder of the thunderbolt, O wondrous one.🔽The tawny cows drink of that sweet drink which is pressed out in two parts,

original: yā indreṇa sayāvarīrvṛṣṇā madanti śobhathā vasvīranu svarājyam / /
analyzed: yāḥ indreṇa sa yāvarīḥ vṛṣṇā madanti śobhatha vasvīḥ anu sva rājyam
translated: Which, united with Indra, rejoice, shining forth, the prosperous ones, according to their own dominion.

original: itthā hi soma inmado brahma cakāra vardhanam /
analyzed: itthā hi somaḥ id madaḥ brahma cakāra vardhanam
translated: For thus, O Soma, in this state of intoxication, he has made the hymn a means of growth,

original: śaviṣṭha vajrinnojasā pṛthivyā niḥ śaśā ahimarcannanu svarājyam / /
analyzed: śaviṣṭha vajrin ojasā pṛthivyāḥ niḥ śaśāḥ ahim arcan anu sva rājyam  /
translated: The most powerful one, O wielder of the thunderbolt, having destroyed the serpent with your strength, shining forth, according to your own dominion.

original: indro madāya vāvṛdhe śavase vṛtrahā nṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ madāya vāvṛdhe śavase vṛtrahā nṛbhiḥ
translated: Indra has grown for the rapture, for strength, the slayer of Vrtra, with the men,

original: taminmahatsvājiṣūtimarbhe havāmahe sa vājeṣu pra no 'viṣat / /
analyzed: tam id mahatsu āji sūtim arbhe havāmahe sa vājeṣu pra naḥ viṣat  /
translated: Him, the invincible one in great battles, we call upon in the conflict. May he favor us in the contests.

analyzed: indra tubhyam idadrivas nuttam vajrin vīryam
translated: O Indra, this strength, O you who have the stone, O wielder of the thunderbolt, is unsurpassed,

original: yaddha tyaṃ māyinaṃ mṛgaṃ tava tyanmāyayāvadhīrarcannanu svarājyam / /
analyzed: yat ha tyam māyinam mṛgam tava tyad māyayā avadhīḥ arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: That which is the deceiving beast, with that deception of thine thou hast slain it, praising after thy own royal sway.

original: prehyabhīhi dhṛṣṇuhi na te vajro ni yaṃsate /
analyzed: prehi abhīhi dhṛṣṇuhi na te vajraḥ ni yaṃsate
translated: Come hither, advance, be bold, thy thunderbolt never fails to strike.

original: indra nṛmṇaṃ hi te śavo hano vṛtraṃ jayā apo 'rcannanu svarājyam / /
analyzed: indra nṛmṇam hi te śavaḥ hanaḥ vṛtram jaya apaḥ rcan anu sva rājyam
translated: For, Indra, thy strength is manly valour: slay Vritra, win the waters, praising after thy own royal sway.

analyzed: yat udīrate ājayaḥ dhṛṣṇave dhīyate dhanam
translated: When the victorious ones send forth the wealth that is to be bestowed on the daring one,

original: yuṅkṣvā madacyutā harī kaṃ hanaḥ kaṃ vasau dadho 'smāṃ indra vasau dadhaḥ / /
analyzed: yuṅkṣva mada cyutā harī kam hanaḥ kam vasau dadhaḥ smām indra vasau dadhaḥ  /
translated: yoke thy two steeds that are never to be turned back: whom wilt thou slay? whom wilt thou make to tremble? make us, O Indra, to tremble.

analyzed: akṣan amīmadanta hi ava priyāḥ adhūṣata
translated: They have pressed the juice, they have rejoiced themselves, they have sung their songs of joy.

original: astoṣata svabhānavo viprā naviṣṭhayā matī yojā nvindra te harī / /
analyzed: astoṣata sva bhānavaḥ viprāḥ naviṣṭhayā matī yojā nu indra te harī  /
translated: The self-shining sages have praised with their newest hymn: yoke thou, O Indra, thy two steeds.

original: upo ṣu śṛṇuhī giro maghavanmātathā iva /
analyzed: upa u su śṛṇuhī giraḥ maghavan mā atathāḥ iva
translated: Listen, O bountiful one, to the songs, as if thou wert not so.

original: kadā naḥ sūnṛtāvataḥ kara idarthayāsa idyojā nvindra te harī / /
analyzed: kadā naḥ sūnṛtāvataḥ karaḥ id arthayāse id yojāḥ nu indra te harī  /
translated: When wilt thou, O thou who art to be invoked by those who have truth and pleasant speech, give us wealth, as thou art to be invoked? yoke thou, O Indra, thy two steeds.
The moon, the bird, runs in the sky.

original: na vo hiraṇyanemayaḥ padaṃ vindanti vidyuto vittaṃ me asya rodasī / /
analyzed: na vaḥ hiraṇya nemayaḥ padam vindanti vidyutaḥ vittam me asya rodasī
translated: The lightnings, whose path is golden, find not thy place. Find thou mine, O thou of the two worlds.

analyzed: prati priyatamam ratham vṛṣaṇam vasu vāhanam
translated: To the most beloved chariot, the strong, bearing wealth,

original: stotā vāmaśvināvṛśi stomebhirbhūṣati prati mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam / /
analyzed: stotā vām aśvinā ṛśi stomebhiḥ bhūṣati prati mādhvī mama śrutam havam  /
translated: The praiser, O Asvins, adorns you with his hymns, sweet to the draught, listen to my call.

original: ā te agna idhīmahi dyumantaṃ devājaram /
analyzed: ā te agne idhīmahi dyumantam deva ajaram
translated: O Agni, we kindle you, the glorious, the undecaying god.

original: yuddha syā te panīyasī samiddīdayati dyavīṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara / /
analyzed: yudh ha syā te panīyasī samidh dīdayati dyavi iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: In your most excellent contest, the kindling wood shines forth. Bring strength to the praisers.

analyzed: ā agnim na svavṛktibhiḥ hotāram tvā vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose you, Agni, with our own songs, as the Hotar.

original: śīraṃ pāvakaśociṣaṃ vi vo made yajñeṣu stīrṇabarhiṣaṃ vivakṣase / /
analyzed: śīram pāvaka śociṣam vi vaḥ made yajñeṣu stīrṇa barhiṣam vivakṣase  /
translated: The bright one, with purifying radiance, in your joy, at sacrifices where the grass is strewn, you shine forth.

original: mahe no adya bodhayoṣo rāye divitmatī /
analyzed: mahe naḥ adya bodhaya uṣaḥ rāye divitmatī
translated: O Ushas, today, for great wealth, for heavenly riches,

original: yathā cinno abodhayaḥ satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte / /
analyzed: yathā cit naḥ abodhayaḥ satyaśravasi vāyye su jāte aśva sūnṛte  /
translated: as you have awakened us, for Satyaśravas, for the noble, for the well-born, for the one with beautiful horses and beautiful speech.

original: bhadraṃ no api vātaya mano dakṣamuta kratum /
analyzed: bhadram naḥ api vātaya manaḥ dakṣam uta kratum
translated: Send us good thoughts, good winds, good mind, good skill, and good wisdom.

original: athā te sakhye andhaso vi vo made raṇā gāvo na yavase vivakṣase / /🔽kratvā mahāṃ anuṣvadhaṃ bhīma ā vāvṛte śavaḥ /
analyzed: athā te sakhye andhasaḥ vi vaḥ made raṇā gāvaḥ na yavase vivakṣase  / kratvā mahān anuṣvadham bhīmaḥ ā vāvṛte śavaḥ
translated: Then in your friendship, in the joy of the drink, the delights, the cows, in your joy, you shine forth like in a pasture.🔽By his wisdom, the great one, in accordance with his desire, the terrible one, his power is turned loose.

original: śriya ṛṣva upākayorni śiprī harivāṃ dadhe hastayorvajramāyasam / /
analyzed: śriye ṛṣvaḥ upākayoḥ ni śiprī harivān dadhe hastayoḥ vajram āyasam  /
translated: The lofty one, with the two shining ones, has placed the wanton one, the tawny one, the iron thunderbolt, in his hands.

original: sa ghā taṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rathamadhi tiṣṭhāti govidam /
analyzed: sa gha tam vṛṣaṇam ratham adhi tiṣṭhāti go vidam
translated: He mounts that bull, that chariot, which finds the cows.

original: yaḥ pātraṃ hāriyojanaṃ pūrṇamindrā ciketati yojā nvindra te harī / /
analyzed: yaḥ pātram hāriyojanam pūrṇam indrā ciketati yojā nu indra te harī  /
translated: He who knows the full vessel yoked to the tawny horses, O Indra, yoke thy two tawny horses, O Indra.

original: agniṃ taṃ manye yo vasurastaṃ yaṃ yanti dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: agnim tam manye yaḥ vasuraḥ tam yam yanti dhenavaḥ
translated: I think of that Agni who is the Vasu, to whom the cows go,

original: astamarvanta āśavo 'staṃ nityāso vājina iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara / /
analyzed: astamarvantaḥ āśavaḥ stam nityāsaḥ vājinaḥ iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: to whom the swift horses go, to whom the strong ones always go, bring food to the praisers.

original: na tamaṃho na duritaṃ devāso aṣṭa martyam /
analyzed: na tam aṃhaḥ na duritam devāsaḥ aṣṭa martyam
translated: O gods, do not inflict on mortal man either affliction or evil,

original: sajoṣaso yamaryamā mitro nayati varuṇo ati dviṣaḥ / /🔽pari pra dhanvendrāya soma svādurmitrāya pūṣṇe bhagāya / /
analyzed: sajoṣasaḥ yam aryamā mitraḥ nayati varuṇaḥ ati dviṣaḥ  / pari pra dhanva indrāya soma svāduḥ mitrāya pūṣṇe bhagāya
translated: the gods who are of one mind, Yama, Aryaman, Mitra leads us beyond enmities, Varuna.🔽Flow around, O Soma, to Indra, sweet, to Mitra, to Pushan, to Bhaga.

original: paryū ṣu pra dhanva vājasātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ /
analyzed: pari u su pra dhanva vāja sātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ
translated: Flow around, O Soma, to the winning of strength, around the enemies, O powerful one.

analyzed: dviṣaḥ taradhyai ṛṇayāḥ naḥ īrase
translated: You drive away the haters with a debt, you do not move.

original: pavasva soma mahāntsamudraḥ pitā devānāṃ viśvābhi dhāma / /
analyzed: pavasva soma mahān samudraḥ pitā devānām viśva abhi dhāma
translated: Flow, O Soma, as a great ocean, the father of the gods, to all the worlds.

original: pavasva soma mahe dakṣāyāśvo na nikto vājī dhanāya / /
analyzed: pavasva soma mahe dakṣāya aśvaḥ na niktaḥ vājī dhanāya  /
translated: Flow, O Soma, for great strength, like a bathed horse, a strong one, for wealth.

analyzed: induḥ paviṣṭa cāruḥ madāya apām upasthe kaviḥ bhagāya  /
translated: The beautiful Indu has entered to make (us) joyful, the sage in the lap of the waters, for Bhaga.

original: anu hi tvā sutaṃ soma madāmasi mahe samaryarājye /
analyzed: anu hi tvā sutam soma madāmasi mahe samarya rājye
translated: For we delight in thee, O Soma, when thou art pressed, for the great kingdom of men.

analyzed: vājān abhi pavamāna pra gāhase
translated: O Pavamana, thou goest forth to the prizes.

original: ka īṃ vyaktā naraḥ sanīḍā rudrasya maryā atha svaśvāḥ / /
analyzed: ke īm vyaktāḥ naraḥ sanīḍāḥ rudrasya maryāḥ atha su aśvāḥ
translated: Who are the men who have disclosed the boundary of Rudra, and who have good horses?

original: agne tamadyāśvaṃ na stomaiḥ kratuṃ na bhadraṃ hṛdispṛśam /
analyzed: agne tam adya aśvam na stomaiḥ kratum na bhadram hṛdispṛśam
translated: O Agni, today with praises, make the horse successful, and the sacrifice prosperous, touching the heart.

analyzed: ṛdhyāma te ohaiḥ
translated: May we prosper through your aids.

original: āvirmaryā ā vājaṃ vājino agmaṃ devasya savituḥ savam /
analyzed: āvis maryāḥ ā vājam vājinaḥ agmam devasya savituḥ savam
translated: The swift ones have come to the prize, to the impulse of the god Savitar.

analyzed: rocantaḥ jayata
translated: O horses, win the heavenly world.

original: pavasva soma dyumnī sudhāro mahāṃ avīnāmanupūrvyaḥ / /
analyzed: pavasva soma dyumnī su dhāraḥ mahān avīnām anupūrvyaḥ
translated: Flow on, O Soma, brilliant, with good streams, great, uninterrupted.

analyzed: pañcama prapāṭhakaḥ dvitīyaḥ ṛdhaḥ
translated: Fifth Prapaṭhaka. Second Ardham.

original: viśvatodāvanviśvato na ā bhara yaṃ tvā śaviṣṭhamīmahe / /
analyzed: viśvatodāvan viśvatas naḥ ā bhara yam tvā śaviṣṭham īmahe  /
translated: Bring from all sides the wealth which thou hast on all sides, whom we invoke as most powerful.

original: eṣa brahmā ya ṛtviya indro nāma śruto gṛṇe / /
analyzed: eṣa brahmā yaḥ ṛtviyaḥ indraḥ nāma śrutaḥ gṛṇe
translated: This is the true Brahman, Indra by name, I sing, who is heard.

original: brahmāṇa indraṃ mahayanto arkairavardhayannahaye hantavā u / /
analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ indram mahayantaḥ arkaiḥ avardhayan ahaye hantavai u
translated: The Brahmans, extolling Indra with hymns, have increased him for the slaying of the foe.

original: anavaste rathamaśvāya takṣustvaṣṭā vajraṃ puruhūta dyumantam / /
analyzed: anavaḥ te ratham aśvāya takṣuḥ tvaṣṭā vajram puruhūta dyumantam  /
translated: Tvaṣṭṛ has fashioned the chariot without a pillar for the horse, and Tvaṣṭṛ, invoked by many, the mighty thunderbolt.

original: śaṃ padaṃ maghaṃ rayīṣiṇo na kāmamavrato hinoti na spṛśadrayim / /
analyzed: śam padam magham rayi iṣiṇaḥ na kāmam avrataḥ hinoti na spṛśat rayim  /
translated: The one without vows does not attain the auspicious state, the wealth of the desirers, he does not touch prosperity.

original: sadā gāvaḥ śucayo viśvadhāyasaḥ sadā devā arepasaḥ / /
analyzed: sadā gāvaḥ śucayaḥ viśva dhāyasaḥ sadā devāḥ arepasaḥ
translated: The cows are always pure, supporting all, the gods are always free from blemish.

original: ā yāhi vanasā saha gāvaḥ sacanta varttaniṃ yadūdhabhiḥ / /🔽upa prakṣe madhumati kṣiyantaḥ puṣyema rayiṃ dhīmahe ta indra / /
analyzed: ā yāhi vanasā saha gāvaḥ sacanta vartanim yat ūdhabhiḥ  upa prakṣe madhumati kṣiyantaḥ puṣyema rayim dhīmahe te indra
translated: Come hither with the forest-lord, the cows attend the path with their udders.🔽Approaching, longing for the sweet, may we prosper our wealth, O Indra, we who meditate on thee.

original: arcantyarkaṃ marutaḥ svarkkā ā stobhati śruto yuvā sa indraḥ / /
analyzed: arcanti arkam marutaḥ su arkkāḥ ā stobhati śrutaḥ yuvā saḥ indraḥ
translated: The Maruts sing the song of praise in heaven; the young and famous Indra exults.

original: pra va indrāya vṛtrahantamāya viprāya gāthaṃ gāyata yaṃ jujoṣate / /
analyzed: pra vaḥ indrāya vṛtra hantamāya viprāya gātham gāyata yam jujoṣate  /
translated: Sing forth the song of praise to Indra, best slayer of Vrtra, to the sage whom he delights.

analyzed: aceti agniḥ cikitiḥ havyavāṭ na sumat rathaḥ
translated: Agni, the unerring, the wise, the bearer of oblations, the swift-chariot.

original: agne tvaṃ no antama uta trātā śivo bhuvo varūthyaḥ / /
analyzed: agne tvam naḥ antamaḥ uta trātā śivaḥ bhuvaḥ varūthyaḥ
translated: O Agni, be thou our nearest friend, a kind deliverer, a gracious protector.

original: bhago na citro agnirmahonāṃ dadhāti ratnam / /
analyzed: bhagaḥ na citraḥ agniḥ mahānām dadhāti ratnam
translated: Agni, the wondrous, the bountiful, bestows treasure on the great.

original: viśvasya pra stobha puro vā sanyadi veha nūnam / /
analyzed: viśvasya pra stobha puras vā san yadi vā iha nūnam
translated: O Agni, thou art the impeller of all the people, whether they be of old or of this day.

original: uṣā apa svasuṣṭamaḥ saṃ varttayati varttaniṃ sujātatā / /
analyzed: uṣāḥ apa sva suṣṭamaḥ sam vartayati vartanim su jāta tā
translated: Dawn, most auspicious among sisters, sets the wheel in motion, well-born.

original: imā nu kaṃ bhuvanā sīṣadhemendraśca viśve ca devāḥ / /
analyzed: imā nu kam bhuvanā sīṣadhema indraḥ ca viśve ca devāḥ
translated: These two worlds have prospered for him, Indra and all the gods.

original: vi srutayo yathā patha indra tvadyantu rātayaḥ / /
analyzed: vi srutayaḥ yathā pathaḥ indra tvat yantu rātayaḥ
translated: Let thy gifts, O Indra, go forth like flowing streams along the path.

original: ayā vājaṃ devahitaṃ sanema madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ / /
analyzed: ayā vājam deva hitam sanema madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: By thee may we gain the treasure which the gods love; may we rejoice a hundred winters with brave sons.

original: ūrjā mitro varuṇaḥ pinvateḍāḥ pīvarīmiṣaṃ kṛṇuhī na indra / /
analyzed: ūrjā mitraḥ varuṇaḥ pinvatā iḍāḥ pīvarī miṣam kṛṇuhi naḥ indra
translated: Mitra and Varuna swell with strength, O Indra, make our food abundant.

analyzed: indraḥ viśvasya rājati
translated: Indra rules over all.

original: trikadrukeṣu mahiṣo yavāśiraṃ tuviśuṣmastṛmpatsomamapibadviṣṇunā sutaṃ yathāvaśam /
analyzed: trikadrukeṣu mahiṣaḥ yava āśiram tuvi śuṣmaḥ tṛmpat somam apibat viṣṇunā sutam yathāvaśam
translated: The mighty one, on the Trikadrukas, the one who eats barley, the very strong one, has drunk the Soma to his fill, pressed by Vishnu, as he wishes.

original: sa īṃ mamāda mahi karma karttave mahāmuruṃ sainaṃ saścaddevo devaṃ satya induḥ satyamindram / /🔽ayaṃ sahasramānavo dṛśaḥ kavīnāṃ matirjyotirvidharma /
analyzed: saḥ īm mamāda mahi karma karttave mahām urum saḥ enam saścat devaḥ devam satyaḥ induḥ satyam indram  /
translated: He has drunk it to perform great deeds, the great, the vast one. The god, the true one, the moon, has followed the god, the true one, Indra.🔽This one, the thousand-eyed one, the light of the wise, the thought of the poets, the light that spreads out in various ways,

original: bradhnaḥ samīcīruṣasaḥ samairayadarepasaḥ socetasaḥ svasare manyumantaścitā goḥ / /
analyzed: bradhnaḥ samīcīḥ uṣasaḥ samairayat arepasaḥ socetasaḥ svasare manyumantaḥ citā goḥ  /
translated: the sun has brought together the shining dawns, the spotless ones, of one mind in the abode of the cow, the wrathful ones.

original: endra yāhyupa naḥ parāvato nāyamacchā vidathānīva satpatirastā rājeva satpatiḥ /🔽havāmahe tvā prayasvantaḥ suteṣvā putrāso na pitaraṃ vājasātaye maṃhiṣṭhaṃ vājasātaye / /
analyzed: ā indra yāhi upa naḥ parāvataḥ na ayam acchā vidathāni iva sat patiḥ astā rājā iva sat patiḥ    havāmahe tvā prayasvantaḥ suta iṣvā putrāsaḥ na pitaram vājasātaye maṃhiṣṭham vājasātaye  /
translated: O Indra, come to us from afar, as a good lord to the assemblies, as a good lord, a king.🔽We call you, the generous ones, to the pressed (juices), the sons to the father, for the winning of strength, the most bountiful one for the winning of strength.

original: tamindraṃ johavīmi maghavānamugraṃ satrā dadhānamapratiṣkutaṃ śravāṃsi bhūriḥ /
analyzed: tam indram johavīmi maghavānam ugram satrā dadhānam apratiṣkutam śravāṃsi bhūriḥ
translated: I invoke that Indra, the wealthy one, the fierce one, who always holds, the unconquerable, the abundant glories.

original: maṃhiṣṭho gīrbhirā ca yajñiyo vavartta rāye no viśvā supathā kṛṇotu vajrī / /
analyzed: maṃhiṣṭhaḥ gīrbhirā ca yajñiyaḥ vavarta rāye naḥ viśvā su pathā kṛṇotu vajrī  /
translated: Most bountiful, may he be won by our songs, worthy of sacrifice. May the wielder of the thunderbolt make all paths easy for us.

original: astu śrauṣṭpuro agniṃ dhiyā dadha ā nu tyacchardho divyaṃ vṛṇīmaha indravāyū vṛṇīmahe /
analyzed: astu śrauṣṭ puras agnim dhiyā dadhe ā nu tyad śardhaḥ divyam vṛṇīmahe indra vāyū vṛṇīmahe
translated: Let there be Agni, the hearer of our prayers, in the east. We choose the heavenly host. We choose Indra and Vayu.

original: yaddha krāṇā vivasvate nābhā sandāya navyase /
analyzed: yat ha krāṇāḥ vivasvate nābhā sandāya navyase
translated: When the wise one, for Vivasvan, has set the navel for the new alliance,

original: adha pra nūnamupa yanti dhītayo devāṃacchā na dhītayaḥ / /
analyzed: adha pra nūnam upa yanti dhītayaḥ devāṃacchā na dhītayaḥ
translated: Now indeed the hymns come to the gods, like hymns to the gods.

original: pra vo mahe matayo yantu viṣṇave marutvate girijā evayāmarut /
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahe matayaḥ yantu viṣṇave marutvate giri jāḥ eva yā marut
translated: May your great thoughts go to Vishnu, to the Maruts, to the mountain-born Evayamarut.

original: pra śardhāya pra yajyave sukhādaye tavase bhandadiṣṭaye dhunivratāya śavase / /
