analyzed: tisraḥ vācaḥ īrayati pra vahniḥ ṛtasya dhītim brahmaṇaḥ manīṣām
translated: The priest sends forth three voices, the thought of truth, the wisdom of holy prayer.

original: gāvo yanti gopatiṃ pṛcchamānāḥ somaṃ yanti matayo vāvaśānāḥ / /
analyzed: gāvaḥ yanti gopatim pṛcchamānāḥ somam yanti matayaḥ vāvaśānāḥ  /
translated: The cows go to the lord of cows, inquiring; the thoughts go to Soma, longing for him.

original: asya preṣā hemanā pūyamāno devo devebhiḥ samapṛkta rasam /
analyzed: asya preṣā hemanā pūyamānaḥ devaḥ devebhiḥ samapṛkta rasam
translated: His messengers, being purified by the ladle, the God has mixed the juice with the Gods.

original: sutaḥ pavitraṃ paryeti rebhanmiteva sadma paśumanti hotā / /
analyzed: sutaḥ pavitram paryeti rebhan mitā iva sadma paśumanti hotā  /
translated: The pressed (juice) goes around the filter, singing, like a guest to the house of the bountiful host.

original: somaḥ pavate janitā matīnāṃ janitā divo janitā pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: somaḥ pavate janitā matīnām janitā divaḥ janitā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Soma, the begetter of thoughts, the begetter of heaven, the begetter of earth,

analyzed: janitā agneḥ janitā sūryasya janitā indrasya janitā uta viṣṇoḥ
translated: The begetter of Agni, the begetter of the sun, the begetter of Indra, and also of Vishnu, is purified.

analyzed: abhi tri pṛṣṭham vṛṣaṇam vayaḥ dhām ā aṅga uṣiṇam avāvaśanta vāṇīḥ
translated: The voices have sung forth to the three-backed, the mighty, the life-bestowing, the bull, the lover of song.

original: vanā vasāno varuṇo na sindhūrvi ratnadhā dayate vāryāṇi / /
analyzed: vanā vasānaḥ varuṇaḥ na sindhu urvi ratna dhāḥ dayate vāryāṇi
translated: Wearing the woods, like Varuna the streams, he, the giver of treasures, grants boons.

original: akrāntsamudraḥ prathame vidharmaṃ janayanprajā bhuvanasya gopāḥ /
analyzed: akrān samudraḥ prathame vidharmam janayan prajāḥ bhuvanasya gopāḥ
translated: The ocean, the first of the world's guardians, begetting the law, begetting offspring,

original: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avye bṛhatsomo vāvṛdhe svāno adriḥ / /
analyzed: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avye bṛhat somaḥ vāvṛdhe svānaḥ adriḥ  /
translated: The bull on the pure fleece, on the back of the cloud, the great Soma has grown, the self-existent stone.

original: kanikranti harirā sṛjyamānaḥ sīdanvanasya jaṭhare punānaḥ /
analyzed: kanikranti hariḥ ā sṛjyamānaḥ sīdan vanasya jaṭhare punānaḥ
translated: The tawny one neighs when let loose, sitting in the belly of the wood, being purified.

original: nṛbhiryataḥ kṛṇute nirṇijaṃ gāmato matiṃ janayata svadhābhiḥ / /
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ yatas kṛṇute nirṇijam gām atas matim janayata svadhābhiḥ
translated: When urged by men, he makes a cleansing robe for the cow, and from that he generates thought by his own powers.

original: eṣa sya te madhumāṃ indra somo vṛṣā vṛṣṇaḥ pari pavitre akṣāḥ /
analyzed: eṣa sya te madhumān indra somaḥ vṛṣā vṛṣṇaḥ pari pavitre akṣār
translated: This Soma of yours, O Indra, is full of sweetness; the bull has flowed into the strainer of the bull.

original: sahasradāḥ śatadā bhūridāvā śaśvattamaṃ barhirā vājyasthāt / /
analyzed: sahasra dāḥ śata dāḥ bhūri dāvā śaśvattamam barhirā vājī asthāt  /
translated: The giver of a thousand, the giver of a hundred, the giver of much, the strong one, shall sit on the grass forever.

original: pavasva soma madhumāṃ ṛtāvāpo vasāno adhi sāno avye /
analyzed: pavasva soma madhumān ṛtāvāpaḥ vasānaḥ adhi sāno avye
translated: Flow on, O Soma, full of sweetness, righteous one, clothed in the waters, on the back of the cloud.

original: ava droṇāni ghṛtavanti roha madintamo matsara indrapānaḥ / /
analyzed: ava droṇāni ghṛtavanti roha madintamaḥ matsaraḥ indra pānaḥ
translated: Rise to the troughs full of ghee, most delightful, as an offering, a drink for Indra.

original: pra senānīḥ śūro agre rathānāṃ gavyanneti harṣate asya senā /
analyzed: pra senā nīḥ śūraḥ agre rathānām gavyan neti harṣate asya senā
translated: The hero, the general, in front of the chariots, crying for cattle, his army rejoices.

original: bhadrānkṛṇvannindrahavāntsakhibhya ā somo vastrā rabhasāni datte / /
analyzed: bhadrān kṛṇvan indra havān sakhibhyaḥ ā somaḥ vastrā rabhasāni datte  /
translated: Making good things for his friends, Indra's calls, Soma gives out garments and swift horses.

original: pra te dhārā madhumatīrasṛgranvāraṃ yatpūto atyeṣyavyam /
analyzed: pra te dhārāḥ madhumatīḥ asṛgran vāram yat pūtaḥ atyeṣyavyam
translated: Your streams full of sweetness have flowed forth, when, being purified, you will pass over the trough.

original: pavamāna pavase dhāma gonāṃ janayantsūryamapinvo arkaiḥ / /
analyzed: pavamāna pavase dhāma gonām janayan sūryam apinvaḥ arkaiḥ
translated: O Pavamana, you flow, purifying the abode of the cows, generating the sun, filling (it) with your songs.

original: pra gāyatābhyarcāma devāntsomaṃ hinota mahate dhanāya /
analyzed: pra gāyata abhyarcāma devān somam hinota mahate dhanāya
translated: Sing forth, let us adore the Gods: urge ye the Soma for great wealth.

original: svāduḥ pavatāmati vāramavyamā sīdatu kalaśaṃ deva induḥ / /🔽pra hinvāno janitā rodasyo ratho na vājaṃ saniṣannayāsīt /
analyzed: svāduḥ pavatām ati vāram avyamā sīdatu kalaśam devaḥ induḥ    pra hinvānaḥ janitā rodasyaḥ rathaḥ na vājam saniṣad ayāsīt
translated: Sweet hath he flowed into the fleecy filter: in the bright beaker hath the God, the Soma, settled.🔽Impelled, the Father of the two worldhalves hath come, as 'twere, a chariot, to the spoil.

original: indraṃ gacchannāyudhā saṃśiśāno viśvā vasu hastayorādadhānaḥ / /
analyzed: indram gacchan āyudhā saṃśiśānaḥ viśvā vasu hastayoḥ ādadhānaḥ
translated: Going to Indra, sharpening his weapons, he hath laid in both his hands all precious things.

original: takṣadyadī manaso venato vāgjyeṣṭhasya dharmaṃ dyukṣoranīke /
analyzed: takṣat yadī manasaḥ venāt vāc jyeṣṭhasya dharmam dyukṣoḥ anīke
translated: He fashions that which is in the heart, the wish, the law of the most lofty Pair in heaven.

original: ādīmāyanvaramā vāvaśānā juṣṭaṃ patiṃ kalaśe gāva indum / /🔽sākamukṣo marjayanta svasāro daśa dhīrasya dhītayo dhanutrīḥ /
analyzed: ādīmāyan varamāḥ vāvaśānāḥ juṣṭam patim kalaśe gāvaḥ indum  /   sākamukṣaḥ marjayanta svasāraḥ daśa dhīrasya dhītayaḥ dhanutrīḥ
translated: The cows have come, lowing, to the beaker, to the dear husband, to the drop, to their treasure.🔽The sisters, the ten, the well-fed, the wise, the skilful, the inspirers, have adorned the drops.

original: hariḥ paryadravajjāḥ sūryasya droṇaṃ nanakṣe atyo na vājī / /🔽adhi yadasminvājinīva śubhaḥ spardhante dhiyaḥ sūre na viśaḥ /
analyzed: hariḥ paryadravat jāḥ sūryasya droṇam nanakṣe atyaḥ na vājī  / adhi yat asmin vājinī iva śubhaḥ spardhante dhiyaḥ sūre na viśaḥ
translated: The tawny one hath run about, the son of Sûrya: he hath filled the trough, as a strong courser the trough.🔽When on this (earth) the beautiful, like a courser, the thoughts contend, as men contend in the light of the Sun.

original: apo vṛṇānaḥ pavate kavīyanvrajaṃ na paśuvardhanāya manma / /
analyzed: apaḥ vṛṇānaḥ pavate kavīyan vrajam na paśu vardhanāya manma
translated: Flowing, choosing the waters, the wise one's own, as 'twere a stall, for the growth of cattle, my thought.

original: indurvājī pavate gonyoghā indre somaḥ saha invanmadāya /
analyzed: induḥ vājī pavate gonyoghāḥ indre somaḥ sahaḥ invat madāya
translated: The strong Indu flows on, the Soma, with a thousand streams, to Indra, to inspirit him.

original: hanti rakṣo bādhate paryarātiṃ varivaskṛṇvanvṛjanasya rājā / /
analyzed: hanti rakṣaḥ bādhate paryarātim varivaskṛṇvan vṛjanasya rājā
translated: He slays the Rakshas, repels the enemy, the king of the people, making room.

original: ayā pavā pavasvainā vasūni māṃścatva indro sarasi pra dhanva /
analyzed: ayā pavā pavasva enā vasūni māṃścatve indra u sarasi pra dhanva
translated: Flow on, O purifier, flow on to these treasures, and, O Indra, shoot forth to the lake.

original: braghnaścidyasya vāto na jūtiṃ purumedhāścittakave naraṃ dhāt / /
analyzed: braghnaḥ cit yasya vātaḥ na jūtim puru medhāḥ citta kave naram dhāt  /
translated: Whose speed, like that of the wind, the very wise, the thoughtful one, has bestowed on the man.

analyzed: mahat tat somaḥ mahiṣaḥ cakāra apām yat garbhaḥ vṛṇīta devān
translated: That great deed did Soma and the great bull, when the embryo of the waters chose the gods.

analyzed: adadhāt indre pavamānaḥ ojaḥ janayat sūrye jyotiḥ induḥ
translated: Pavamana has placed strength in Indra, the drop has produced light in the sun.

original: asarji vakvā rathye yathājau dhiyā manotā prathamā manīṣa /
analyzed: asarji vakvā rathye yathā ājau dhiyā manotā prathamā manīṣa
translated: The swift one has started, like a chariot in a race, the thought, the first thought, has started.

original: daśa svasāro adhi sāno avye mṛjanti vahniṃ sadaneṣvaccha / /
analyzed: daśa svasāraḥ adhi sāno avye mṛjanti vahnim sadaneṣu accha
translated: The ten sisters on the uneven ridge purify the oblation in the vessels.

analyzed: pra manīṣāḥ īrate somam accha
translated: Like waves of water, hastening to cross, the thoughts move towards Soma.

original: namasyantīrupa ca yanti saṃ cāca viśantyuśatīruśantam / /
analyzed: namasyantīḥ upa ca yanti sam ca ā ca viśanti uśatīḥ uśantam  /
translated: They bow down and come together, and enter the eager one with eagerness.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭha prapāṭhakaḥ dvitīyaḥ ṛdhaḥ
translated: Sixth recitation. Second half.

analyzed: purojitī vaḥ andhasaḥ sutāya mādayitnave
translated: You who conquer in front, for the sake of the intoxicating Soma juice,

analyzed: apa śvānam śnathiṣṭana sakhāyaḥ dīrghajihvyam
translated: Break the dog's back, O friends, the one with the long tongue.

original: ayaṃ pūṣā rayirbhagaḥ somaḥ punāno arṣati /
analyzed: ayam pūṣā rayiḥ bhagaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ arṣati
translated: This is Pūṣan, wealth, Bhaga, Soma being purified flows.

analyzed: patiḥ viśvasya bhūmanaḥ vyakhyat rodasī ubhe
translated: The lord of all the worlds has spread out both heaven and earth.

analyzed: sutāsaḥ madhumattamāḥ somāḥ indrāya mandinaḥ
translated: The most sweet-flavoured Soma juices, the Somas that delight Indra,

analyzed: pavitravantaḥ akṣaran devān gacchantu vaḥ madāḥ  /
translated: Flowing through the filter, let your gladdening draughts go to the gods.

analyzed: somāḥ pavante indavaḥ smabhyam gātu vittamāḥ
translated: The Soma drops are purified, best able to bring us bliss.

original: mitrāḥ svānā arepasaḥ svādhyaḥ svarvidaḥ / /🔽abhī no vājasātamaṃ rayimarṣa śataspṛham /
analyzed: mitrāḥ svānāḥ arepasaḥ svādhyaḥ svar vidaḥ  abhi naḥ vāja sātamam rayi marṣa śata spṛham
translated: The friends, the kinsmen, the spotless, the pure, the finders of light.🔽Send us, O Indu, wealth most worthy of our choice, a hundredfold desired,

analyzed: indo sahasrabharṇasam tuvi dyumnam vibhāsaham
translated: Wealth, O Indu, a thousandfold, of mighty splendour, to be enjoyed by all.

analyzed: abhi navante adruhaḥ priyam indrasya kāmyam
translated: The guileless ones have sung forth the dear, the lovely draught of Indra,

original: vatsaṃ na pūrva āyuni jātaṃ rihanti mātaraḥ / /
analyzed: vatsam na pūrve āyuni jātam rihanti mātaraḥ
translated: As the mothers lick the newly-born calf at the beginning of the day.

analyzed: ā haryatāya dhṛṣṇave dhanuṣṭanvanti pauṃsyam
translated: They stretch the bow for the eager, impetuous one, for manly strength.

original: śukrā vi yantyasurāya nirṇije vipāmagre mahīyuvaḥ / /
analyzed: śukrāḥ vi yanti asurāya nirṇije vipām agre mahīyuvaḥ  /
translated: The bright ones move for the Asura to the cleansing sieve, the mighty ones in front.

original: pari tyaṃ haryataṃ hariṃ babhruṃ punanti vāreṇa /
analyzed: pari tyam haryatam harim babhrum punanti vāreṇa
translated: They purify the tawny, the brown, the tawny one with the wool.

original: yo devānviśvāṃ itpari madena saha gacchati / /
analyzed: yaḥ devān viśvān id pari madena saha gacchati
translated: He who goes around with the rapture to all the gods.

original: pra sunvānāsyāndhaso marto na vaṣṭa tadvacaḥ /
analyzed: pra sunvāna asya andhasaḥ martaḥ na vaṣṭa tat vacaḥ
translated: The mortal man should not disregard that word of the Soma when it is being pressed.

original: apa śvānamarādhasaṃ hatā makhaṃ na bhṛgavaḥ / /
analyzed: apa śvānam arādhasam hatāḥ makham na bhṛgavaḥ
translated: Like the Bhṛgus have they slain the dog that is to be avoided, the Makha.

original: abhi priyāṇi pavate canohito nāmāni yahvo adhi yeṣu vardhate /
analyzed: abhi priyāṇi pavate canohitaḥ nāmāni yahvaḥ adhi yeṣu vardhate
translated: He flows on to the dear places, well-disposed, the mighty one, to the names where he is magnified.

original: ā sūryasya bṛhato bṛhannadhi rathaṃ viṣvañcamaruhadvicakṣaṇaḥ / /🔽acodaso no dhanvantvindavaḥ pra svānāso bṛhaddeveṣu harayaḥ /
analyzed: ā sūryasya bṛhataḥ bṛhan adhi ratham viṣvañcam aruhat vicakṣaṇaḥ  / acodasaḥ naḥ dhanvantu indavaḥ pra svānāsaḥ bṛhat deveṣu harayaḥ
translated: The wise one has mounted the spacious car of the great Sūrya, moving in all directions.🔽Let the drops come to us unbidden, the bright ones, the tawny ones, to the great gods.

original: vi cidaśnānā iṣayo arātayo 'ryo naḥ santu saniṣantu no dhiyaḥ / /
analyzed: vi cit aśnānāḥ iṣayaḥ arātayaḥ ryaḥ naḥ santu saniṣantu naḥ dhiyaḥ  /
translated: Even the hidden enemies, the famine-makers, be friendly to us, and let them further our thoughts.

original: eṣa pra kośe madhumāṃ acikradadindrasya vajro vapuṣo vapuṣṭamaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa pra kośe madhumān acikradat indrasya vajraḥ vapuṣaḥ vapuṣṭamaḥ
translated: This one, rich in honey, has roared in the trough, Indra's thunderbolt, most beautiful of beautiful things.

original: abhyR sudughā ghṛtaścuto vāśrā arṣanti payasā ca ghenavaḥ / /
analyzed: su dughāḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ vāśrāḥ arṣanti payasā ca ghenavaḥ
translated: The well-milked, ghee-dropping, lowing cows flow to him with milk and with curd.

original: pro ayāsīdindurindrasya niṣkṛtaṃ sakhā sakhyurna pra mināti saṅgiram /
analyzed: pra u ayāsīt induḥ indrasya niṣkṛtam sakhā sakhyuḥ na pra mināti saṅgiram
translated: The drop has gone to Indra's place of worship; the friend does not transgress the promise to his friend.

original: marya iva yuvatibhiḥ samarṣati somaḥ kalaśe śatayāmanā pathā / /
analyzed: maryaḥ iva yuvatibhiḥ samarṣati somaḥ kalaśe śata yāmanā pathā  /
translated: Like a young man he is mingled with the maidens; Soma, in a hundred ways, in the trough, with the path.

original: dhartā divaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso dakṣo devānāmanumādyo nṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: dhartā divaḥ pavate kṛtvyaḥ rasaḥ dakṣaḥ devānām anumādyaḥ nṛbhiḥ
translated: The purifying juice, the supporter of the sky, the power of the gods, to be praised by men,

original: hariḥ sṛjāno atyo na satvabhirvṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇuṣe nadīṣvā / /
analyzed: hariḥ sṛjānaḥ atyaḥ na satvabhiḥ vṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇuṣe nadīṣvā  /
translated: The tawny one, as he is let loose, like a horse with strong (horses), spreads out his rays in the rivers.

original: vṛṣā matīnāṃ pavate vicakṣaṇaḥ somo ahnāṃ pratarītoṣasāṃ divaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā matīnām pavate vicakṣaṇaḥ somaḥ ahnām pratarītā uṣasām divaḥ
translated: The bull, the all-seeing one, flows on for the thoughts, Soma, the leader of the days, of the dawns, of the sky.

analyzed: prāṇā sindhūnām kalaśām acikradat indrasya hārdī āviśat manīṣibhiḥ
translated: The life of the rivers, the pitchers have roared, entering the heart of Indra with the wise ones.

original: trirasmai sapta dhenavo duduhrire satyāmāśiraṃ parame vyomani /
analyzed: tris asmai sapta dhenavaḥ duduhrire satyām āśiram parame vyomani
translated: Three times seven milch cows have yielded for him the true and auspicious milk in the highest heaven.

original: catvāryanyā bhuvanāni nirṇije cārūṇi cakre yadṛtairavardhata / /
analyzed: catvāri anyā bhuvanāni nirṇije cārūṇi cakre yat ṛtaiḥ avardhata  /
translated: Four other worlds has he cleansed, and made them beautiful, when he increased them with the holy truths.

original: indrāya soma suṣutaḥ pari sravāpāmīvā bhavatu rakṣasā saha /
analyzed: indrāya soma suṣutaḥ pari srava apa amīvā bhavatu rakṣasā saha
translated: O Soma, well pressed, flow around for Indra. Let the evil spell be with the Rakshas.

original: mā te rasasya matsata dvayāvino draviṇasvanta iha santvindavaḥ / /
analyzed: mā te rasasya matsata dvayāvinaḥ draviṇasvantaḥ iha santu indavaḥ
translated: Let not the two-footed ones enjoy thy juice. Let the juices be here rich in treasure.

original: asāvi somo aruṣo vṛṣā harī rājeva dasmo abhi gā acikradat /
analyzed: asāvi somaḥ aruṣaḥ vṛṣā hariḥ rājā iva dasmaḥ abhi gāḥ acikradat
translated: The red, the strong Soma has flowed, the tawny one has roared for the cows like a king.

original: punāno vāramatyeṣyavyayaṃ śyeno na yoniṃ ghṛtavantamāsadat / /
analyzed: punānaḥ vāram atyeṣi avyayam śyenaḥ na yonim ghṛtavantam āsadat  /
translated: Purified, he has passed through the wool, the fleece, the eagle has sat down in his own home rich in ghee.

original: pra devamacchā madhumanta indavo 'siṣyadanta gāva ā na dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: pra devam acchā madhumantaḥ indavaḥ siṣyadanta gāvaḥ ā na dhenavaḥ
translated: The Soma drops, rich in sweetness, have flowed to the god. The cows, the milch cows, have been shaken like (milked) cows.

original: barhiṣado vacanāvanta ūdhabhiḥ parisrutamusriyā nirṇijaṃ dhire / /
analyzed: barhiṣadaḥ vacanāvantaḥ ūdhabhiḥ parisrutam usriyāḥ nirṇijam dhire  /
translated: The grass-sitters, the eloquent ones, with their udders, have supported the overflowing, the golden-coloured, the garment.

original: añjate vyañjate samañjate kratuṃ rihanti maghvābhyañjate /
analyzed: añjate vyañjate samañjate kratum rihanti maghvā abhyañjate
translated: They anoint, they spread, they collect. They kiss the sacrifice. They anoint with the oblation.

analyzed: sindhoḥ uru śvāse patayantam ukṣaṇam hiraṇya pāvāḥ paśum apsu gṛbhṇate  /
translated: The golden-coloured animal, floating on the breath of the river, is seized by the waters by those who have the fleece.

original: pavitraṃ te vitataṃ brahmaṇaspate prabhurgātrāṇi paryeṣi viśvataḥ /
analyzed: pavitram te vitatam brahmaṇaspate prabhuḥ gātrāṇi paryeṣi viśvatas
translated: O Lord of the Veda, thy purifying power is spread out. Thou, the powerful one, dost encompass the limbs of all.

original: ataptatanūrna tadāmo aśnute śṛtāsa idvahantaḥ saṃ tadāśata / /
analyzed: a tapta tanūḥ na tat āmaḥ aśnute śṛtāsaḥ id vahantaḥ sam tat āśata  /
translated: The bodies that are not heated do not reach that. The well-prepared ones, carrying it, come together at that time.

original: indramaccha sutā ime vṛṣaṇaṃ yantu harayaḥ /
analyzed: indram accha sutāḥ ime vṛṣaṇam yantu harayaḥ
translated: Let these pressed juices go to Indra, the strong one, let the tawny ones go.

original: śruṣṭe jātāsa indavaḥ svarvidaḥ / /🔽pra dhanvā soma jāgṛvirindrāyendo pari srava /
analyzed: śruṣṭe jātāsaḥ indavaḥ svar vidaḥ  pra dhanva soma jāgṛviḥ indrāya indo pari srava
translated: The drops born in the heard have become the finders of heaven.🔽O Soma, flow on, O Indu, to Indra, with thy stream, O watchful one.

original: dyumantaṃ śuṣmamā bhara svarvidam / /🔽sakhāya ā ni ṣīdata punānāya pra gāyata /
analyzed: dyumantam śuṣmam ā bhara svar vidam    sakhāyaḥ ā ni sīdata punānāya pra gāyata
translated: Bring splendour and strength, the finder of heaven.🔽O friends, sit down, sing forth to the one who is being purified.

original: śiśuṃ na yajñaiḥ pari bhūṣata śriye / /🔽taṃ vaḥ sakhāyo madāya punānamabhi gāyata /
analyzed: śiśum na yajñaiḥ pari bhūṣata śriye    tam vaḥ sakhāyaḥ madāya punānam abhi gāyata
translated: Adorn the child with sacrifices for glory.🔽O friends, sing to him who is being purified for your delight.

original: śiśuṃ na havyaiḥ svadayanta gūrtibhiḥ / /🔽prāṇā śiśurmahīnāṃ hinvannṛtasya dīdhitim /
analyzed: śiśum na havyaiḥ svadayanta gūrtibhiḥ    śiśuḥ mahīnām hinvan ṛtasya dīdhitim
translated: They sweeten the child with oblations and offerings, as with food.🔽The breath, the child of the great ones, impelling the thought of truth,

analyzed: viśvā pari priyā bhuvat adha dvitā
translated: Has gone around all the dear abodes twice.

original: pavasva devavītaya indo dhārābhirojasā /🔽ā kalaśaṃ madhumāntsoma naḥ sadaḥ / /
analyzed: pavasva deva vītaye indo dhārābhiḥ ojasā  ā kalaśam madhumān soma naḥ sadaḥ  /
translated: Flow on, O Indu, for the feast of the gods, with thy streams, with strength,🔽Into the vat, O Soma, into the seat, full of honey for us.

original: somaḥ punāna ūrmiṇāvyaṃ vāraṃ vi dhāvati /
analyzed: somaḥ punānaḥ ūrmiṇā avyam vāram vi dhāvati
translated: Soma, being purified, flows over the woolen filter with a wave,

analyzed: agre vācaḥ pavamānaḥ kanikradat
translated: Pavamana, neighing, in front of the voices.

original: pra punānāya vedhase somāya vaca ucyate /
analyzed: pra punānāya vedhase somāya vacaḥ ucyate
translated: To Soma, the purifying, the creator, this speech is addressed,

original: bhṛtiṃ na bharā matibhirjujoṣate / /🔽gomanna indo aśvavatsutaḥ sudakṣa dhaniva /
analyzed: bhṛtim na bharā matibhiḥ jujoṣate    gomat naḥ indo aśvavat sutaḥ su dakṣa dhanivas
translated: Like a fee, to be borne with thoughts, he is to be delighted with.🔽O Indu, rich in cattle and horses, well-born, of good strength, and possessing wealth,

analyzed: śucim ca varṇam adhi goṣu dhārya
translated: And the pure color upon the cows, do thou bear.

analyzed: asmabhyam tvā vasu vidam abhi vāṇīḥ anūṣata
translated: To thee, O finder of treasures, we have sung this song,

analyzed: gobhiḥ te varṇam abhi vāsayāmasi
translated: With the cows we clothe thy color.

original: pavate haryato harirati hvarāṃsi raṃhyā /🔽abhyarṣa stotṛbhyo vīravadyaśaḥ / /
analyzed: pavate haryataḥ hariḥ ati hvarāṃsi raṃhyā
translated: The tawny one, the tawny one, flows over the backs, the swift one,🔽Do thou, O Soma, flow to the praisers, with glory that brings forth heroes.

original: pari kośaṃ madhuścutaṃ somaḥ punāno arṣati /
analyzed: pari kośam madhuścutam somaḥ punānaḥ arṣati
translated: Soma, being purified, flows around the honey-dropping vat,

analyzed: abhi vāṇīḥ ṛṣīṇām saptā nūṣata
translated: The seven voices of the Rishis have sung to him.

original: pavasva madhumattama indrāya soma kratuvittamo madaḥ /
analyzed: pavasva madhumattamaḥ indrāya soma kratu vittamaḥ madaḥ
translated: Flow as the sweetest of sweet juices, O Soma, as the most wise delight to Indra,

analyzed: mahi dyukṣatamaḥ madaḥ
translated: As the most heavenly of great delights.

original: abhi dyumnaṃ bṛhadyaśa iṣaspate didīhi deva devayum /
analyzed: abhi dyumnam bṛhat yaśaḥ iṣaspate didīhi deva devayum
translated: O lord of food, shine forth with great glory and fame, O god, to the god-adoring one,

original: vi kośaṃ madhyamaṃ yuva / /🔽ā sotā pari ṣiñcatāśvaṃ na stomamapturaṃ rajasturam /
analyzed: vi kośam madhyamam yuva  ā sotā pari siñcata aśvam na stomam apturam rajasturam
translated: Open the middle vault for him.🔽Let the pressers pour him in, the horse, the song, the swift one in the realm,

analyzed: rohitam
translated: The forest-roaming one, the one who is urged on by the waters.

original: etamu tyaṃ madacyutaṃ sahasradhāraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ divoduham /
analyzed: etam u tyam mada cyutam sahasra dhāram vṛṣabham divoduham
translated: This bull, the one who drips with delight, the thousand-streamed, the milker of the sky,

analyzed: viśvā vasūni bibhratam
translated: Who bears all treasures.

original: sa sunve yo vasūnāṃ yo rāyāmānetā ya iḍānām /
analyzed: sa sunve yaḥ vasūnām yaḥ rāyām ānetā yaḥ iḍānām
translated: He presses the Soma who is the bringer of treasures, who is the leader of wealth, who is the giver of food,

analyzed: romaḥ yaḥ su kṣitīnām
translated: who is the bestower of good abodes.

analyzed: tvam daivyā pavamāna janimāni dyumattamaḥ
translated: O Pavamana, you, O divine one, the most splendid,

analyzed: amṛta tvāya ghoṣayan
translated: proclaiming for immortality,

original: eṣa sya dhārayā suto 'vyo vārebhiḥ pavate madintamaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa sya dhārayā sutaḥ vyaḥ vārebhiḥ pavate madintamaḥ
translated: This one, pressed with its stream, flows through the woolen filter, the most delightful,

analyzed: krīḍan ūrmiḥ apām iva
translated: like a playful wave of the waters.

original: ya usriyā api yā antaraśmani nirgā akṛntadojasā /
analyzed: yaḥ usriyāḥ api yāḥ antar aśmani nirgāḥ akṛntat ojasā
translated: He who with his might has cut out the cows that are within the bone,

original: abhi vrajaṃ tatniṣe gavyamaśvyaṃ varmīva dhṛṣṇavā ruja /
analyzed: abhi vrajam tatniṣe gavyam aśvyam varmī iva dhṛṣṇavā ruja
translated: he has set the cattle-pen on fire, the horse-pen, like a warrior eager for victory.

analyzed: ruja
translated: Om, like a warrior eager for victory.

analyzed: iti saumyam pāvamānam parva kāṇḍam
translated: Thus ends the Parva Kanda of the Sauma Pavamana.

analyzed: iti pūrvārcikaḥ  āraṇyaḥ ārcikaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first section.🔽Aranya Archika

analyzed: āraṇya kāṇḍam
translated: Aranya Kanda

original: indra jyeṣṭhaṃ na ā bhara ojiṣṭhaṃ pupuri śravaḥ /🔽yaddidhṛkṣema vajrahasta rodasī obhe suśipra paprāḥ / /
analyzed: indra jyeṣṭham naḥ ā bhara ojiṣṭham pupuri śravaḥ  yat didhṛkṣema vajrahasta rodasī ā ubhe su śipra paprāḥ
translated: O Indra, bring us the most excellent, the most powerful fame,🔽when, O wielder of the thunderbolt, we desire to fill both the worlds, O you with beautiful eyebrows.

analyzed: indraḥ rājā jagantaḥ carṣaṇīnām adhikṣamā viśva rūpam yat asya
translated: Indra, the king of the people of the world, of his all-formed creation,

original: tato dadāti dāśuṣe vasūni codadrādha upastutaṃ cidarvāk / /
analyzed: tatas dadāti dāśuṣe vasūni ca udadrādhe upastutam cit arvāk
translated: from there he grants wealth to the worshipper, and even to the praised one he impels.

analyzed: yasya idamāḥ rajaḥ yujaḥ tuje jane vanam svar
translated: Whose heaven, whose forest, whose people are yoked to this realm of his,

analyzed: indrasya rantyam bṛhat
translated: The great abode of Indra.

original: uduttamaṃ varuṇa pāśamasmadavādhamaṃ vi madhyamaṃ śrathāya /
analyzed: ud uttamam varuṇa pāśam asmat ava adhamam vi madhyamam śrathāya
translated: O Varuna, raise the highest noose from us, loosen the lowest and the middle one for good.

original: athāditya vrate vayaṃ tavānāgaso aditaye syāma / /
analyzed: atha āditya vrate vayam tava anāgasaḥ aditaye syāma  /
translated: Then, O Aditya, in your vow may we be sinless to Aditi.

analyzed: tvayā vayam pavamānena soma bhare kṛtam vi cinuyāma śaśvat
translated: By you, O Soma, the purifier, we may always win the treasure in the contest.

analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ  /
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, the river, the earth, and the sky grant this to us.

analyzed: imam vṛṣaṇam kṛṇuta ekamid mām
translated: Make this one bull for me alone.

original: sa na indrāya yajyave varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ indrāya yajyave varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ
translated: He for Indra, for the worthy of sacrifice, for Varuna, for the Maruts,

analyzed: roca vid parisrava
translated: Finding room, flow around.

analyzed: enā viśvāni aryaḥ ā dyumnāni mānuṣāṇām
translated: By these (powers) all the glories of men,

analyzed: siṣāsantaḥ vanāmahe
translated: Striving, we win.

analyzed: aham asmi prathama jāḥ ṛtasya pūrvam devebhyaḥ amṛtasya nāma
translated: I am the firstborn of order, the ancient name of immortality for the gods.

analyzed: yaḥ mā dadāti saḥ id evam āvat aham annam annam adantam admi  /
translated: He who gives me speaks thus: I eat food, eating the eater of food.

analyzed: tvam etat adhārayaḥ kṛṣṇāsu rohiṇīṣu ca
translated: You have held this in the dark and the red cows,
In the Parushni (cows) the white milk.

original: arūrucaduṣasaḥ pṛśniragriya ukṣā mimeti bhuvaneṣu vājayuḥ /
analyzed: arūrucat uṣasaḥ pṛśniḥ agriyaḥ ukṣā mimā iti bhuvaneṣu vājayuḥ
translated: The dappled one, the firstborn, has shone forth in the dawns. The bull bellows in the worlds, seeking strength.

original: māyāvino mamire asya māyayā nṛcakṣasaḥ pitaro garbhamādadhuḥ / /🔽indra iddharyoḥ sacā sammiśla ā vacoyujā /
analyzed: māyāvinaḥ mamire asya māyayā nṛ cakṣasaḥ pitaraḥ garbham ādadhuḥ  indraḥ id haryoḥ sacā sammiślaḥ ā vacaḥ yujā
translated: The fathers, the seers of men, have laid the germ in her, the deceitful one, by their deceit.🔽Indra, the powerful one, is united with the two Ida sisters, yoked with speech.
Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, is golden.

analyzed: indra vājeṣu naḥ vaḥ sahasra pradhaneṣu ca
translated: O Indra, in our battles, in the contests for a thousand prizes,

analyzed: ugraḥ ugrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ

translated: And he whose names are Prathas and Saprathas, the oblation of the Anustubh meter,

translated: Vasishtha has yoked the Rathantara, from the shining Dhatr, Savitar, and Vishnu.

analyzed: niyutvān vāyo ā gahi ayam śukraḥ ayāmi te
translated: O Vayu, the one with a thousand, this pure one comes to you.

analyzed: rociṣmataḥ gṛham  yat jāyathāḥ apūrvya maghavan vṛtra hatyāya
translated: You will go to the house of the one who presses the Soma.🔽O you who are born anew, O magnanimous one, for the slaying of Vritra,

analyzed: tat pṛthivīm aprathayaḥ tat astabhnāḥ uta u divam
translated: You have spread out the earth, you have supported the sky.

original: mayi varco atho yaśo 'tho yajñasya yatpayaḥ /
analyzed: mayi varcaḥ atha u yaśaḥ tha u yajñasya yat payaḥ
translated: In me be splendor and fame, and the milk of the sacrifice.

analyzed: parameṣṭhī prajāpatiḥ divi dyām iva dṛṃhatu
translated: May Prajapati, the supreme lord, make me firm like the sky in the sky.

original: saṃ te payāṃsi samu yantu vājāḥ saṃ vṛṣṇyānyabhimātiṣāhaḥ /
analyzed: sam te payāṃsi samu yantu vājāḥ sam vṛṣṇyāni abhimātiṣāhaḥ
translated: May your milk and strength come together, may your bull-like powers come together, O you who conquer hostility.

original: āpyāyamāno amṛtāya soma divi śravāṃsyuttamāni dhiṣva / /
analyzed: āpyāyamānaḥ amṛtāya soma divi śravāṃsi uttamāni dhiṣva  /
translated: O Soma, being made to grow for immortality, establish in heaven the highest glories.

original: tvamimā oṣadhīḥ soma viśvāstvamapo ajanayastvaṃ gāḥ /
analyzed: tvam imāḥ oṣadhīḥ soma viśvāḥ tvam apaḥ ajanayaḥ tvam gāḥ
translated: You, O Soma, have created all these plants, you have created the waters and the cows.

analyzed: tvam jyotiṣā vi tamaḥ vavartha
translated: You have dispelled the darkness with your light.

analyzed: agnim īḍe purohitam yajñasya devam ṛtvijam
translated: I praise Agni, the priest, the god who officiates at the sacrifice,

analyzed: ratna dhātamam
translated: The priest who bestows treasures.

original: te manvata prathamaṃ nāma gonāṃ triḥ sapta paramaṃ nāma janān /
analyzed: te manvata prathamam nāma gonām tris sapta paramam nāma janān
translated: They first thought of the highest name of the cows, three times seven of the highest name of the people.

analyzed: tāḥ jānatīḥ abhyanūṣata kṣā āvirbhuvan aruṇīḥ yaśasā gāvaḥ  /
translated: Knowing those, they have sung the earth, the red cows have appeared with glory.

analyzed: sam anyāḥ yanti upayanti anyāḥ samānam ūrvam nadī a spṛṇanti
translated: Some flow together, others approach, the rivers fill the same lake.

analyzed: tam ū śucim śucayaḥ dīdivāṃsam apa anna pātam upa yanti āpaḥ  /
translated: To that pure one, shining with purity, the waters come, the waters that drink the sky.

original: ā prāgādbhadrā yuvatirahnaḥ ketūntsamīrtsati /🔽abhūdbhadrā niveśanī viśvasya jagato rātrī / /
analyzed: ā prāgāt bhadrā yuvatiḥ ahnaḥ ketūn samīrtsati  abhūt bhadrā niveśanī viśvasya jagataḥ rātrī
translated: The auspicious young woman has come from the east, she rivals the lights of the day.🔽The auspicious one has become the one who settles down, the night for the whole moving world.

original: prakṣasya vṛṣṇo aruṣasya nū mahaḥ pra no vaco vidathā jātavedase /
analyzed: prakṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ aruṣasya nu mahaḥ pra naḥ vacaḥ vidathā jātavedase
translated: The great power of the red bull of the dawn, our thought to the all-knowing one,

original: vaiśvānarāya matirnavyase śuciḥ soma iva pavate cāruragnaye / /
analyzed: vaiśvānarāya matiḥ navyase śuciḥ somaḥ iva pavate cāruḥ agnaye  /
translated: A pure thought like Soma flows on to Agni, a charming one to the one who knows all.

original: viśve devā mama śṛṇvantu yajñamubhe rodasī apāṃ napācca manma /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ mama śṛṇvantu yajñam ubhe rodasī apām napāt ca manma
translated: May all the gods listen to my sacrifice, to my thought, to the waters' foam, to the two world-halves.

original: mā vo vacāṃsi paricakṣyāṇi vocaṃ sumneṣvidvo antamā madema / /
analyzed: mā vaḥ vacāṃsi paricakṣyāṇi vocam sumneṣu id vaḥ antamāḥ madema  /
translated: Let me not speak words that should be concealed. May we find delight in your blissful states.

analyzed: R yaśaḥ mā dyāvāpṛthivī yaśaḥ mā indra bṛhaspatī
translated: May heaven and earth grant me glory, may Indra and Brihaspati grant me glory.

original: yaśo bhagasya vindatu yaśo mā pratimucyatām /
analyzed: yaśaḥ bhagasya vindatu yaśaḥ mā pratimucyatām
translated: May I obtain the glory of Bhaga, may glory be bestowed upon me.

original: saṃ sado 'haṃ pravaditā syām / /🔽indrasya nu vīryāṇi pravocaṃ yāni cakāra prathamāni vajrī /
analyzed: ro sam sadaḥ ham pravaditā syām  indrasya nu vīryāṇi pravocam yāni cakāra prathamāni vajrī
translated: May I be one who speaks in the assembly.🔽I will proclaim the heroic deeds of Indra, the first deeds performed by the wielder of the thunderbolt.

analyzed: ahan ahim anu apaḥ tatarda pra vakṣaṇāḥ abhinat parvatānām
translated: He slew the dragon, he cleft the waters, he pierced the flanks of the mountains.

original: agnirasmi janmanā jātavedā ghṛtaṃ me cakṣuramṛtaṃ ma āsan /
analyzed: agniḥ asmi janmanā jātavedāḥ ghṛtam me cakṣuḥ amṛtam me āsan
translated: I am Agni, the all-knower by birth, ghee is my eye, immortality is my food.

analyzed: asmi
translated: The three-formed sun, the measurer of space, the eternal light, I am the oblation, all.

original: pātyagnirvipo agraṃ padaṃ veḥ pāti yahvaścaraṇaṃ sūryasya /
analyzed: pāti agniḥ vipaḥ agram padam veḥ pāti yahvaḥ caraṇam sūryasya
translated: Agni protects the foremost place of the song, he protects the young foot of the sun.

original: pāti nābhā saptaśīrṣāṇamagniḥ / /🔽bhrājantyagne samidhāna dīdivo jihvā caratyantarāsani /
analyzed: pāti nābhā sapta śīrṣāṇam agniḥ  R bhrājanti agne samidhāna dīdivas jihvā carati antarāsani
translated: Agni protects the navel with seven heads.🔽O Agni, the shining tongue moves between the flames, when you are kindled with brilliance.

original: sa tvaṃ no agne payasā vasuvidrayiṃ varco dṛśe 'dāḥ / /
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ agne payasā vasu vidrayim varcaḥ dṛśe dāḥ  /
translated: You, O Agni, have given us wealth-finding radiance to see with, with your life-giving sap.

original: vasanta innu rantyo grīṣma innu rantyaḥ /
analyzed: vasante id nu rantyaḥ grīṣme id nu rantyaḥ
translated: Spring is indeed delightful, summer is indeed delightful.

original: varṣāṇyanu śarado hemantaḥ śiśira innu rantyaḥ / /
analyzed: varṣāṇi anu śaradaḥ hemantaḥ śiśiraḥ id nu rantyaḥ  /
translated: The years, the autumns, the winter, and the dewy seasons rejoice in him.
The Purusha had a thousand heads, a thousand eyes, a thousand feet.

analyzed: sa bhūmim sarvatas vṛtvā atyatiṣṭhat daśa aṅgulam
translated: He pervaded the earth on all sides, extending ten fingers.

analyzed: tripād ūrdhvaḥ udait puruṣaḥ
translated: Three-fourths of him is immortal in heaven, one-fourth again is this (universe) that hath sprung.

analyzed: tathā viṣvaṅ vyakrāmat aśana anaśane abhi
translated: Thus he hath spread over all this (universe), above and below and on every side.

original: puruṣa evedaṃ sarvaṃ yadbhūtaṃ yacca bhāvyam /
analyzed: eva
translated: The Purusha is all that yet hath been and all that is to be;🔽The Lord of Immortals which waxes greater still by food.🔽So mighty is his greatness, yea, greater than this is the Purusha.

original: pādo 'sya sarvā bhūtāni tripādasyāmṛtaṃ divi / /🔽tāvānasya mahimā tato jyāyāṃśca pūruṣaḥ /🔽utāmṛtatvasyeśāno yadannenātirohati / /🔽tato virāḍajāyata virājo adhi pūruṣaḥ /
analyzed: pādaḥ sya sarvā bhūtāni tri pādasya amṛtam divi    tāvān asya mahimā tatas jyāyān ca pūruṣaḥ  uta amṛta tvasya īśānaḥ yat annena atirohati    tatas virāj ajāyata virājaḥ adhi pūruṣaḥ
translated: All creatures are one-fourth of him, three-fourths eternal life in heaven.🔽From him was born Virāj. From Virāj was born Purusha.

analyzed: saḥ jātaḥ atyaricyata paścāt bhūmim atho puras
translated: When he was born, he filled the whole of this (universe) that is beyond, below, and above.

original: manye vāṃ dyāvāpṛthivī subhojasau ye aprathethāmamitamabhi yojanam /
analyzed: manye vām dyāvāpṛthivī subhojasau ye aprathethām amitam abhi yojanam
translated: I think of you, O Heaven and Earth, who are bountiful, who have extended your extent immeasurably.

original: dyāvāpṛthivī bhavataṃ syone te no muñcatamaṃhasaḥ / /
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: Be ye, O Heaven and Earth, propitious to us. Deliver us from tribulation.

original: harī ta indra śmaśrūṇyuto te haritau hari /
analyzed: harī te indra śmaśrūṇi uta u te haritau hari
translated: O Indra, your two bay horses are your beard, your two bays are your hair, O tawny one.

original: taṃ tvā stuvanti kavayaḥ puruṣāso vanargavaḥ / /
analyzed: tam tvā stuvanti kavayaḥ puruṣāsaḥ vanargavaḥ
translated: Thee, O Agni, the sages, the men, the foresters, praise.

analyzed: yat varcaḥ hiraṇyasya yat vā varcaḥ gavām uta
translated: Whatever splendour there is in gold, or in cows,

original: satyasya brahmaṇo varcastena mā saṃ sṛjāmasi / /
analyzed: satyasya brahmaṇaḥ varcaḥ tena mā sam sṛjāmasi
translated: and the splendour of true Brahman, with that we unite thee.

original: sahastanna indra daddhyoja īśe hyasya mahato virapśin /

translated: Where our forefathers, knowing the path, bestowing heaven, longing for the cows,

original: mā cidanyadvi śaṃsata sakhāyo mā riṣaṇyata /
analyzed: mā cit anyat vi śaṃsata sakhāyaḥ mā riṣaṇyata
translated: Do not think of anything else, O friends, do not be dispirited.

original: indramitstotā vṛṣaṇaṃ sacā sute muhurukthā ca śaṃsata / /🔽avakrakṣiṇaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ yathā juvaṃ gāṃ na carṣaṇīsaham /
analyzed: indram id stotā vṛṣaṇam sacā sute muhur ukthā ca śaṃsata  / avakrakṣiṇam vṛṣabham yathā juvam gām na carṣaṇīsaham
translated: Praise Indra, the mighty one, together with the pressed (Soma), and repeatedly recite the hymns.🔽The irresistible bull, like a lover, the cow who is victorious over the people,
The one who causes hatred, the one who brings people together, the most generous, the one who goes to both sides.

original: udu tye madhumattamā gira stomāsa īrate /
analyzed: udu tye madhumattamāḥ giraḥ stomāsaḥ īrate
translated: These most sweet hymns and praises rise up to you,

original: satrājito dhanasā akṣitotayo vājanto rathā iva / /
analyzed: satrājitaḥ dhana sāḥ akṣita ūtayaḥ vājantaḥ rathāḥ iva
translated: The ever-victorious, the wealth-winners, the imperishable ones, striving for strength like chariots.

original: kaṇvā iva bhṛgavaḥ sūryā iva viśvamiddhītamāśata /🔽indraṃ stomebhirmahayanta āyavaḥ priyamedhāso asvaran / /
analyzed: kaṇvāḥ iva bhṛgavaḥ sūryāḥ iva viśvam id hītam āśata  indram stomebhiḥ mahayantaḥ āyavaḥ priyamedhāsaḥ asvaran  /
translated: Like the Kaṇvas, the Bhṛgus, the Sūryas, they have come to all that is to be done.🔽The living ones magnify Indra with their hymns. The Priyamedhas have sung.

original: paryū ṣu pra dhanva vājasātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ /
analyzed: pari u su pra dhanva vāja sātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ
translated: Rush forth to the winning of strength, to overcome the enemies, O mighty one.

analyzed: dviṣaḥ taradhyai ṛṇayāḥ naḥ īrase
translated: You drive away the haters with the debt, as on a chariot.

original: ajījano hi pavamāna sūryaṃ vidhāre śakmanā payaḥ /
analyzed: ajījanaḥ hi pavamāna sūryam vidhāre śakmanā payaḥ
translated: For you, O Pavamāna, have generated the sun, the life-giving one, with power, with milk,
With the swift one who is rich in cows, with the longing one.

original: anu hi tvā sutaṃ soma madāmasi mahe samaryarājye /
analyzed: anu hi tvā sutam soma madāmasi mahe samarya rājye
translated: For we delight in you, O Soma, when pressed, for the great lordship over men.

analyzed: vājām abhi pavamāna pra gāhase
translated: O Pavamana, thou goest forth to the strength-bestowing (waters).

original: pari pra dhanvendrāya soma svādurmitrāya pūṣṇe bhagāya / /
analyzed: pari pra dhanva indrāya soma svāduḥ mitrāya pūṣṇe bhagāya  /
translated: Thou flowest forth, O Soma, sweet for Indra, for Mitra, for Pushan, for Bhaga.

original: evāmṛtāya mahe kṣayāya sa śukro arṣa divyaḥ pīyūṣaḥ / /
analyzed: eva amṛtāya mahe kṣayāya sa śukraḥ arṣa divyaḥ pīyūṣaḥ  /
translated: So to the great abode of the immortal, thou, O bright one, flowest on, the heavenly drink.

original: indraste soma sutasya peyātkratve dakṣāya viśve ca devāḥ / /
analyzed: indraḥ te soma sutasya peyāt kratve dakṣāya viśve ca devāḥ
translated: May Indra drink of thy juice, O Soma, for wisdom and power, and all the gods.

original: sūryasyeva raśmayo drāvayitnavo matsarāsaḥ prasutaḥ sākamīrate /
analyzed: sūryasya iva raśmayaḥ drāvayitnavaḥ matsarāsaḥ prasutaḥ sākam īrate
translated: Like the rays of the sun, hastening, impetuous, the gladdening ones, the abundant ones, go forth together.

original: tantuṃ tataṃ pari sargāsa āśavo nendrādṛte pavate dhāma kiṃ cana / /
analyzed: tantum tatam pari sargāsaḥ āśavaḥ na indrāt ṛte pavate dhāma kim cana
translated: Not a single thing flows forth apart from Indra, the swift ones, the envelopers, around the extended thread.

original: upo matiḥ pṛcyate sicyate madhu mandrājanī codate antarāsani /
analyzed: upa u matiḥ pṛcyate sicyate madhu mandrājanī codate antarāsani
translated: The thought is pressed out, the honey is poured out; the delightful one urges (him) between the two worlds.

original: pavamānaḥ santaniḥ sunvatāmiva madhumāndrapsaḥ pari vāramarṣati / /
analyzed: pavamānaḥ santaniḥ sunvatām iva madhumān drapsaḥ pari vāram arṣati  /
translated: Pavamana, the strainer, like the pressers', the honey-rich drop flows around the enclosing sticks.

original: ukṣā mimeti prati yanti dhenavo devasya devīrupa yanti niṣkṛtam /
analyzed: ukṣā mima iti prati yanti dhenavaḥ devasya devīḥ upa yanti niṣkṛtam
translated: The bull roars; the cows go back; the divine ones of the god go to the completion.

original: atyakramīdarjunaṃ vāramavyayamatkaṃ na niktaṃ pari somo avyata / /
analyzed: atyakramīt arjunam vāram avyayam atkam na niktam pari somaḥ avyata  /
translated: He has passed over the dark, the undecaying enclosure; Soma has girt himself with the skirt.

analyzed: janayata
translated: The men, with thoughts, beget Agni, praised, from the kindling-stick, falling from the hand.

analyzed: dūredṛśam gṛhapatim athavyum
translated: The far-seeing, the lord of the house, the one to be sought out.

analyzed: tam agnim aste vasavaḥ nyṛṇvan supraticakṣam avase kutaścid
translated: The Vasus have set that Agni in place, well-looking, for help from somewhere.
He who is ever present in the house is most worthy of Dakṣiṇā.

original: preddho agne dīdihi puro no 'jasrayā sūrmyā yaviṣṭha /
analyzed: preddhaḥ agne dīdihi puras naḥ jasrayā sūrmyā yaviṣṭha
translated: O Agni, well-kindled, shine in front of us with your ceaseless light, O youngest.

analyzed: tvām śaśvantaḥ upa yanti vājāḥ
translated: To you come all the powers.

analyzed: ā ayam gauḥ pṛśniḥ akramīt asadat mātaram puras
translated: This dappled bull has come, has sat down in front of his mother.

analyzed: pitaram ca
translated: Going to his father, he goes to heaven.

analyzed: antar carati rocanā asya prāṇāt apānatī
translated: He moves in the light within, breathing out from his breath.

analyzed: vyakhyat mahiṣaḥ divam
translated: The buffalo has spread out the sky.

analyzed: triṃśat dhāma vi rājati vāc pataṅgāya dhīyate
translated: The thirtyfold abode shines forth. Speech is placed in the bird.

analyzed: prati vastoḥ aha dyubhiḥ
translated: In return for the cloud, with the lights.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭha prapāṭhakaḥ dvitīyaḥ ṛdhaḥ
translated: Sixth recitation. Second half.

analyzed: upaprayantaḥ adhvaram mantram vocema agnaye
translated: Approaching the sacrifice, we will speak the hymn to Agni,

analyzed: ca
translated: To him who listens to us from afar.

analyzed: yaḥ snīhitīṣu pūrvyaḥ saṃjagmānāsu kṛṣṭiṣu
translated: He who is foremost in the early battles, in the gatherings of the people,

analyzed: rakṣat dāśuṣe gayam
translated: Has protected the house for the worshipper.

original: sa no vedo amātyamagnī rakṣatu śantamaḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ vedaḥ amātyam agniḥ rakṣatu śantamaḥ
translated: May that most auspicious Agni protect us, our friend,

analyzed: uta asmān pātu aṃhasaḥ
translated: And may he deliver us from sin.

analyzed: uta bruvantu jantavaḥ ud agniḥ vṛtra hā ajani
translated: And let the people say: Agni, the Vr̥itra-slayer, has been born,

analyzed: R dhanaṃjayaḥ raṇeraṇe
translated: The winner of wealth in every fight.

original: agne yuṅkṣvā hi ye tavāśvāso deva sādhavaḥ /🔽araṃ vahantyāśavaḥ / /
analyzed: yuṅkṣva hi ye te āśvāsaḥ deva sādhavaḥ      aram vahanti āśavaḥ
translated: Which carry you swiftly.

original: acchā no yāhyā vahābhi prayāṃsi vītaye /
analyzed: acchā naḥ yāhi ā vaha abhi prayāṃsi vītaye
translated: Come to us, bring the offerings for the feast,

analyzed: ā devān soma pītaye
translated: To the gods for the drinking of Soma.

analyzed: udagne bhārataiḥ dyumat ajasreṇa davidyutat
translated: Rise up, O Agni, O Bhārata, shine forth with your inexhaustible light,

analyzed: R vi bhāhi ajaraiḥ
translated: Shine forth, O you who are not subject to old age.

original: pra sunvānāyāndhaso martto na vaṣṭa tadvacaḥ /
analyzed: pra sunvānāya andhasaḥ marttaḥ na vaṣṭa tat vacaḥ
translated: To the Soma that is being pressed, the mortal has not offered that word.

original: apa śvānamarādhasaṃ hatā makhaṃ na bhṛgavaḥ / /
analyzed: apa śvānam arādhasam hatāḥ makham na bhṛgavaḥ
translated: Drive away the wicked dog, as the Bhṛgus struck down the sacrifice.

original: ā jāmiratke avyata bhuje na putra oṇyoḥ /
analyzed: ā jāmiratke avyata bhuje na putraḥ oṇyoḥ
translated: He has woven, like a son, in the two bowls, the son of Jamadagni,

original: sarajjāro na yoṣaṇāṃ varo na yonimāsadam / /
analyzed: sarat jāraḥ na yoṣaṇām varaḥ na yonim āsadam
translated: Like a lover to his beloved, like a bridegroom to his bride.

original: sa vīro dakṣasādhano vi yastastambha rodasī /🔽hariḥ pavitre avyata vedhā na yonimāsadam / /
analyzed: sa vīraḥ dakṣa sādhanaḥ vi yastastambha rodasī  hariḥ pavitre avyata vedhāḥ na yonim āsadam
translated: That hero, who supports the strong, who has propped up the two worlds,🔽The golden-hued has woven in the filter, like a creator to his place.

analyzed: abhrātṛvyaḥ anā tvam anāpiḥ indra januṣā sanāt asi
translated: You are without a rival, O Indra, without an enemy, from birth you have been without a kinsman.

analyzed: R yudhā idāpi tvam icchase
translated: You desire to fight with the Pitu.

original: na kī revantaṃ sakhyāya vindase pīyanti te surāśvaḥ /
analyzed: na kī revantam sakhyāya vindase pīyanti te surāśvaḥ
translated: You do not find the wealthy one for friendship. Your Suras drink, O good horse.

analyzed: kṛṇoṣi        iva hūyase
translated: When you make the river swell, you are offered like the father of Aditi.

original: ā tvā sahasramā śataṃ yuktā rathe hiraṇyaye /
analyzed: ā tvā sahasramā śatam yuktāḥ rathe hiraṇyaye
translated: To you a thousand, a hundred are yoked to the golden chariot.

analyzed: brahma yujaḥ harayaḥ indra keśinaḥ vahantu soma pītaye  / ā tvā rathe hiraṇyaye harī mayūra śepyā
translated: O Indra, may the tawny horses yoked by Brahma, the swift ones, carry you to drink the Soma.🔽May your two tawny horses, with the speed of peacocks' wings,

analyzed: śiti pṛṣṭhāḥ vahatām madhvaḥ andhasaḥ vivakṣaṇasya pītaye  /

analyzed: pibā girvaṇaḥ sutasya pūrva pāḥ iva
translated: Drink, O lover of song, of the pressed juice, as the first drinker,

original: pariṣkṛtasya rasina iyamāsutiścārurmadāya patyate / /🔽ā sotā pari ṣiñcatāśvaṃ na stomamapturaṃ rajasturam /
analyzed: pariṣkṛtasya rasinaḥ iyam āsutiḥ cāruḥ madāya patyate  ā sotā pari siñcata aśvam na stomam apturam rajasturam
translated: of the well-purified, sweet juice, this libation is offered for your delight.🔽O presser, pour around the horse, the praise-worthy, swift as thought, swift as the wind,

analyzed: rohitam
translated: roaming in the woods, urged on by the waters.

original: sahasradhāraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ payoduhaṃ priyaṃ devāya janmane /
translated: The thousand-streamed bull, the milk-yielding one, dear to the divine birth,

original: ṛtena ya ṛtajāto vivāvṛdhe rājā deva ṛtaṃ bṛhat / /🔽agnirvṛtrāṇi jaṅghanaddraviṇasyurvipanyayā /
analyzed: ṛtena yaḥ ṛta jātaḥ vivāvṛdhe rājā devaḥ ṛtam bṛhat  / agniḥ vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanat draviṇasyuḥ vipanyayā
translated: he who by truth, born of truth, has grown great, the king, the god, the great truth.🔽May Agni, the wealth-seeker, with his own power, crush the foes,

analyzed: roddhaḥ śukraḥ āhutaḥ
translated: kindled, shining, offered with oblations.

analyzed: garbhe mātuḥ pituḥ pitā vididyutānaḥ akṣare
translated: The father of the father in the mother's womb, shining in the imperishable,

analyzed: rodan ṛtasya yonimā
translated: sitting in the womb of truth.

analyzed: brahma prajāvat ā bhara jātavedaḥ vicarṣaṇe
translated: O all-active Jatavedas, bring the Brahman that is rich in offspring,

analyzed: ro agne yat dīdayat divi
translated: O Agni, that which shines in the sky.

original: asya preṣā hemanā pūyamāno devo devebhiḥ samapṛkta rasam /
analyzed: asya preṣā hemanā pūyamānaḥ devaḥ devebhiḥ samapṛkta rasam
translated: This envoy, purified by the ladle, the god, together with the gods, has mixed the juice.

original: sutaḥ pavitraṃ paryeti rebhanmiteva sadma paśumanti hotā / /
analyzed: sutaḥ pavitram paryeti rebhan mitā iva sadma paśumanti hotā  /
translated: The pressed (juice) goes around the pure (filter), singing like a singer, the priest, rich in cattle, in the house.

original: bhadrā vastrā samanyā ' ' vasāno mahānkavirnivacanāni śaṃsan /
analyzed: bhadrā vastrā samanyā vasānaḥ mahān kaviḥ nivacanāni śaṃsan
translated: Wearing beautiful garments, clad in a garment, the great sage, proclaiming the hymns,

original: ā vacyasva camvoḥ pūyamāno vicakṣaṇo jāgṛvirdevavītau / /
analyzed: ā vacyasva camvoḥ pūyamānaḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ jāgṛviḥ deva vītau  /
translated: Be purified in the bowls, the discerning one, watchful, at the feast of the gods.

original: samu priyo mṛjyate sāno avye yaśastaro yaśasāṃ kṣaito asme /
analyzed: samu priyaḥ mṛjyate sāno avye yaśastaraḥ yaśasām kṣaitaḥ asme
translated: The dear one is being purified on the fleecy (filter), most famous of the famous, the strong one for us.

original: abhi svara dhanvā pūyamāno yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ / /
analyzed: abhi svara dhanva pūyamānaḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ  /
translated: Sing forth, O Dhanvan, being purified. Do you, O ye, protect us ever with your blessings.

original: eto nvindraṃ stavāma śuddhaṃ śuddhena sāmnā /
analyzed: eta u nu indram stavāma śuddham śuddhena sāmnā
translated: Let us now praise Indra, the pure one, with a pure hymn.

analyzed: śuddhaiḥ ukthaiḥ vāvṛdhvāṃsam śuddhaiḥ āśīḥ vānmamattu
translated: May he, who is to be magnified with pure praises, rejoice with pure blessings.

original: indra śuddho na ā gahi śuddhaḥ śuddhābhirūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: indra śuddhaḥ naḥ ā gahi śuddhaḥ śuddhābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: O Indra, come to us, O pure one, with pure aids, O pure one.

original: śuddho rayiṃ ni dhāraya śuddho mamaddhi somya / /🔽indra śuddho hi no rayiṃ śuddho ratnāni dāśuṣe /
analyzed: śuddhaḥ rayim ni dhāraya śuddhaḥ mamaddhi somya  indra śuddhaḥ hi naḥ rayim śuddhaḥ ratnāni dāśuṣe
translated: O pure one, bestow wealth, O pure one, rejoice in the Soma.🔽O Indra, for thou art pure, bestow wealth on the worshipper, pure, precious things.

original: śuddho vṛtrāṇi jighnase śuddho vājaṃ siṣāsasi / /
analyzed: śuddhaḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnase śuddhaḥ vājam siṣāsasi
translated: Pure, thou slayest the foes, pure, thou strivest for booty.

analyzed: agne stomam manāmahe sidhram adya divispṛśaḥ
translated: O Agni, we think of the hymn, the successful one today, O thou who touchest the sky,

analyzed: devasya draviṇasyavaḥ
translated: We who are eager for the wealth of the god.

original: agnirjuṣata no giro hotā yo mānuṣeṣvā /
analyzed: agniḥ juṣata naḥ giraḥ hotā yaḥ mānuṣa iṣvā
translated: May Agni accept our songs, the priest who is among mankind,

analyzed: ro sa yakṣat daivyam janam
translated: He worships the divine people.

original: tvamagne saprathā asi juṣṭo hotā vareṇyaḥ /
analyzed: tvam agne saprathāḥ asi juṣṭaḥ hotā vareṇyaḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are the one who spreads out, the pleasing, desirable Hotar.

analyzed: tvayā yajñam vi tanvate
translated: Through you they spread out the sacrifice.

original: abhi tripṛṣṭhaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vayodhāmāṅgoṣiṇamavāvaśaṃta vāṇīḥ /🔽vanā vasāno varuṇo na sindhūrvi ratnadhā dayate vāryāṇi / /
analyzed: abhi tri pṛṣṭham vṛṣaṇam vayaḥ dhām ā aṅga uṣiṇam avāvaśanta vāṇīḥ    vanā vasānaḥ varuṇaḥ na sindhu urvi ratna dhāḥ dayate vāryāṇi
translated: They have sung praises to the bull with three backs, the one who bestows strength, the protector of the people.🔽Wearing the forest, like Varuna over the rivers, he distributes the bestowers of treasure and boons.

original: śūragrāmaḥ sarvavīraḥ sahāvānjetā pavasva sanitā dhanāni /🔽tigmāyudhaḥ kṣipradhanvā samatsvaṣāḍhaḥ sāhvānpṛtanāsu śatrūn / /🔽urugavyūtirabhayāni kṛṇvantsamīcīne ā pavasvā purandhī /
analyzed: śūra grāmaḥ sarva vīraḥ sahāvān jetā pavasva sanitā dhanāni  tigma āyudhaḥ kṣipra dhanvā samatsu aṣāḍhaḥ sāhvān pṛtanāsu śatrūn  / uru gavyūtiḥ abhayāni kṛṇvan samīcīne ā pavasva purandhī
translated: The one with brave villages, all heroes, the powerful one, the conqueror, flow on, winning the riches.🔽With sharp weapons, a quick bow in battles, the strong one challenges the enemies in the battles.🔽The one with a wide path, making safe havens, flow on, O wise one, to the assembled ones.

original: apaḥ siṣāsannuṣasaḥ saṃ cikrado maho asmabhyaṃ vājān / /
analyzed: apaḥ siṣāsan uṣasaḥ sam cikradaḥ mahaḥ asmabhyam vājān  /
translated: Desiring the waters, roaring at the dawns, bestow great powers on us.

analyzed: tvam indra yaśāḥ asi ṛjīṣī śavasaspatiḥ
translated: You, O Indra, are the glorious one, the impetuous one, the lord of strength.

original: tvaṃ vṛtrāṇi haṃsyapratīnyeka itpurvanuttaścarṣaṇīdhṛtiḥ / /🔽tamu tvā nūnamasura pracetasaṃ rādho bhāgamivemahe /
analyzed: tvam vṛtrāṇi haṃsi apratīni ekaḥ id puru anuttaḥ carṣaṇī dhṛtiḥ    tam u tvā nūnam asura pracetasam rādhaḥ bhāgam iva īmahe
translated: You alone will destroy the unconquerable Vr̥itras, the supporter of people in the first place.🔽To you, O Asura, the wise one, we come for help, as for a share of the bounty.

original: mahīva kṛttiḥ śaraṇā ta indra pra te sumnā no aśnavan / /
analyzed: mahī iva kṛttiḥ śaraṇā te indra pra te sumnā naḥ aśnavan  /
translated: Like a great shield, O Indra, are your protections. May your favors reach us.

original: yajiṣṭhaṃ tvā vavṛmahe devaṃ devatrā hotāramamartyam /
analyzed: yajiṣṭham tvā vavṛmahe devam devatrā hotāram amartyam
translated: We have chosen thee best sacrificer, the god, as priest among the gods, the immortal,

analyzed: asya yajñasya sukratum
translated: For this sacrifice, O wise one.

analyzed: apām napātam subhagam su dīditim agnim śreṣṭha śociṣam
translated: The son of the waters, the fortunate one, the well-shining Agni, the one with the best radiance,

original: sa no mitrasya varuṇasya so apāmā sumnaṃ yakṣate divi / /
analyzed: sa naḥ mitrasya varuṇasya saḥ apāmā sumnam yakṣate divi  /
translated: He will serve the bliss of Mitra, Varuna, and the waters in the sky.

original: yamagne pṛtsu martyamavā vājeṣu yaṃ junāḥ /
analyzed: yam agne pṛtsu martyam avāḥ vājeṣu yam junāḥ
translated: O Agni, the mortal whom you favor in battles and whom you assist in contests,

analyzed: sa yantā śaśvatīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: He is the charioteer of eternal food.

original: na kirasya sahantya paryetā kayasya cit /
analyzed: na kirasya sahantya paryetā kayasya cit
translated: No one can withstand his shooting, not even one of great power.

analyzed: vājaḥ asti śravāyyaḥ
translated: There is a glorious prize to be won.

analyzed: sa vājam viśvacarṣaṇiḥ arvadbhiḥ astu tarutā
translated: May he, the one who is honored by all, be victorious with his horses in the contests,

original: viprebhirastu sanitā / /🔽sākamukṣo marjayanta svasāro daśa dhīrasya dhītayo dhanutrīḥ /
analyzed: viprebhiḥ astu sanitā    sākamukṣaḥ marjayanta svasāraḥ daśa dhīrasya dhītayaḥ dhanutrīḥ
translated: And may he be victorious with the sages.🔽The ten sisters who pour together, the wise one's three daughters who purify,

original: hariḥ paryadravajjāḥ sūryasya droṇaṃ nanakṣe atyo na vājī / /🔽saṃ mātṛbhirna śiśurvāvaśāno vṛṣā dadhanve puruvāro adbhiḥ /
analyzed: hariḥ paryadravat jāḥ sūryasya droṇam nanakṣe atyaḥ na vājī  / sam mātṛbhiḥ na śiśuḥ vāvaśānaḥ vṛṣā dadhanve puru vāraḥ adbhiḥ
translated: The tawny one has flowed around, the son of the sun, he has filled the trough, like a strong horse.🔽Like a child who is well-fed with his mothers, the bull moves forth with the waters, the one who gives many boons.

original: maryo na yoṣāmabhi niṣkṛtaṃ yantsaṃ gacchate kalaśa usriyābhiḥ / /
analyzed: maryaḥ na yoṣām abhi niṣkṛtam yat sam gacchate kalaśe usriyābhiḥ
translated: Like a young man who goes to the appointed place of the woman, he goes to the trough with the cows.

original: uta pra pipya ūdharaghnyāyā indurdhārābhiḥ sacate sumedhāḥ /
analyzed: uta pra pipye ūdhara ghnyāyāḥ induḥ dhārābhiḥ sacate sumedhāḥ
translated: And the wise moon is filled with the streams of the milch cow, he is united with the streams.

original: mūrdhānaṃ gāvaḥ payasā camūṣvabhi śrīṇanti vasubhirna niktaiḥ / /
analyzed: mūrdhānam gāvaḥ payasā camūṣu abhi śrīṇanti vasubhiḥ na niktaiḥ
translated: The cows in the bowls mix the head with milk, with the pure treasures.

original: pibā sutasya rasino matsvā na indra gomataḥ /
analyzed: pibā sutasya rasinaḥ matsva naḥ indra gomataḥ
translated: Drink of the juice of the pressed (Soma), rejoice in us, O Indra, in the possession of cattle.

original: āpirno bodhi sadhamādye 'smāṃ avantu te dhiyaḥ / /
analyzed: āpiḥ naḥ bodhi sadhamādye vṛdhe smām avantu te dhiyaḥ  /
translated: Be thou a protector to us in the best assembly; may thy thoughts protect us.

original: bhūyāma te sumatau vājino vayaṃ mā na starabhimātaye /
analyzed: bhūyāma te sumatau vājinaḥ vayam mā naḥ starabhi mātaye
translated: May we be in thy good grace, O strong one; do not lead us to disgrace.

analyzed: asmām citrābhiḥ avatāt abhiṣṭibhiḥ ā naḥ sumneṣu yāmaya  /
translated: Protect us with thy wondrous aids; lead us to bliss.

original: trirasmai sapta dhenavo duduhrire satyāmāśiraṃ parame vyomani /
analyzed: tris asmai sapta dhenavaḥ duduhrire satyām āśiram parame vyomani
translated: Three times seven milch cows have they caused to yield their true milk for him in the highest heaven.

original: catvāryanyā bhuvanāni nirṇije cārūṇi cakre yadṛtairavardhata / /
analyzed: catvāri anyā bhuvanāni nirṇije cārūṇi cakre yat ṛtaiḥ avardhata  /
translated: Four other worlds he has made beautiful in the cleansing sieve, when he increased by the holy rites.

original: sa bhakṣamāṇo amṛtasya cāruṇa ubhe dyāvā kāvyenā vi śaśrathe /
analyzed: sa bhakṣamāṇaḥ amṛtasya cāruṇaḥ ubhe dyāvā kāvyena vi śaśrathe
translated: He, enjoying the beautiful nectar, has with his wisdom divided the two worlds.

original: tejiṣṭhā apo maṃhanā pari vyata yadī devasya śravasā sado viduḥ / /
analyzed: tejiṣṭhāḥ apaḥ maṃhanā pari vyata yadī devasya śravasā sadaḥ viduḥ  /
translated: With his most brilliant splendour he has surrounded the waters, when they have found the abode of the god by his glory.

original: te asya santu ketavo 'mṛtyavo 'dābhyāso januṣī ubhe anu /
analyzed: te asya santu ketavaḥ mṛtyavaḥ dābhyāsaḥ januṣī ubhe anu
translated: Let these be his immortal banners, the two worlds, following the two generations, which are free from guile.

original: yebhirnṛmṇā ca devyā ca punata ādidrājānaṃ mananā agṛbhṇata / /
analyzed: yebhiḥ nṛmṇā ca devyā ca punate ādidrājānam mananāḥ agṛbhṇata
translated: By which (banners) they purify themselves for heroism and divinity, the thoughts have grasped the king from the beginning.

analyzed: abhi vāyum vītyarṣa gṛṇānaḥ bhi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ
translated: Flow onward, O Vâyu, purified, to Vâyu; flow to Mitra-Varuṇa, purified.

original: abhī naraṃ dhījavanaṃ ratheṣṭhāmabhīndraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vajrabāhum / /
analyzed: abhi naram dhī javanam ratheṣṭhām abhi indram vṛṣaṇam vajra bāhum  /
translated: To the man who delights in wisdom, the charioteer, to Indra, the strong one, with the thunderbolt in his arm,

original: abhi vastrā suvasanānyarṣābhi dhenūḥ sudughāḥ pūyamānaḥ /
analyzed: abhi vastrā su vasanāni arṣa abhi dhenūḥ su dughāḥ pūyamānaḥ
translated: Flow to the garments that are well-woven, flow to the milch-cows that yield much milk while being purified.

original: abhi candrā bharttave no hiraṇyābhyaśvānrathino deva soma / /
analyzed: abhi candrā bharttave naḥ hiraṇyā abhi aśvān rathinaḥ deva soma
translated: To the bright gold for us to enjoy, O god Soma, flow to the horses and chariots.

original: abhī no arṣa divyā vasūnyabhi viśvā pārthivā pūyamānaḥ /
analyzed: abhi naḥ arṣa divyā vasūni abhi viśvā pārthivā pūyamānaḥ
translated: Flow to us, purifying, the heavenly riches, and all the earthly ones,

original: abhi yena draviṇamaśnavāmābhyārṣeyaṃ jamadagnivannaḥ / /🔽yajjāyathā apūrvya maghavanvṛtrahatyāya /
analyzed: abhi yena draviṇam aśnavāma abhyārṣeyam jamadagni vat naḥ  yat jāyathāḥ apūrvya maghavan vṛtra hatyāya
translated: By which we may obtain wealth, and by which we may win the prize like Jamadagni.🔽When you were born, O you who are not to be surpassed, O magnanimous one, for the slaying of Vritra,

original: tatpṛthivīmaprathayastadastabhnā uto divam / /🔽tatte yajño ajāyata tadarka uta haskṛtiḥ /
analyzed: tat pṛthivīm aprathayaḥ tat astabhnāḥ uta u divam    tat te yajñaḥ ajāyata tat arkaḥ uta haskṛtiḥ
translated: You spread out the earth, you established the sky.🔽From that your sacrifice was born, that your praise and your exaltation.

original: tadviśvamabhibhūrasi yajjātaṃ yacca jantvam / /🔽āmāsu pakvamairaya ā sūryaṃ rohayo divi /
analyzed: tat viśvam abhibhūḥ asi yat jātam yat ca  āmāsu pakvam airayaḥ ā sūryam rohayaḥ divi
translated: By that you surpass all that is born and that is to be born.🔽You have brought the ripe into the unripe, you have raised the sun to the sky.

original: gharmaṃ na sāmaṃ tapatā suvṛktibhirjuṣṭaṃ girvaṇase bṛhat / /
analyzed: gharmam na sāmam tapata suvṛktibhiḥ juṣṭam girvaṇase bṛhat  /
translated: Like the hot-rayed one, with good hymns, you heat the much-desired one for the lover of song.

original: matsyapāyi te mahaḥ pātrasyeva harivo matsaro madaḥ /
analyzed: matsya pāyi te mahaḥ pātrasya iva harivas matsaraḥ madaḥ
translated: Your joy is like the drink of the fish, O you who are praised by the Maruts, like the drink of the one who possesses bay horses, the joy.

analyzed: vṛṣā te vṛṣṇaḥ induḥ vājī sahasra sātamaḥ
translated: Your bull, O bull, is the strong, the swift, the winner of a thousand (cows).

original: ā naste gantu matsaro vṛṣā mado vareṇyaḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ te gantu matsaraḥ vṛṣā madaḥ vareṇyaḥ
translated: Let thy dear juice come to us, O bull, the gladdening drink, most excellent,

analyzed: saha āvām indra sānasiḥ pṛtanaṣāh amartyaḥ
translated: Indra, victorious, conquering the foe, immortal.

original: tvaṃ hi śūraḥ sanitā codayo manuṣo ratham /
analyzed: tvam hi śūraḥ sanitā codayaḥ manuṣaḥ ratham
translated: For thou, O hero, art the impeller, thou sendest the chariot of men.

analyzed: roṣaḥ pātram na śociṣā
translated: Victorious, with the Dasyu's foe thou burnest the vessel with thy flame.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭha prapāṭhakaḥ tṛtīyaḥ ṛdhaḥ
translated: Sixth Prapaṭhaka. Third Ardham.

analyzed: pavasva vṛṣṭimā su naḥ pām ūrmim divaspari
translated: Flow on for rain to us, a wave of waters from the sky,

analyzed: ayakṣmāḥ bṛhatīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: Free from disease, with great food.

original: tayā pavasva dhārayā yayā gāva ihāgaman /
analyzed: tayā pavasva dhārayā yayā gāvaḥ iha agaman
translated: Flow with that stream wherewith the cows have come hither to us,

analyzed: ro janyāsaḥ upa naḥ gṛham
translated: The kinswomen, to our house.

analyzed: pavasva
translated: Flow with the stream of ghee, most worshipped by the gods in sacrifices,

analyzed: asmabhyam vṛṣṭim ā pava
translated: Flow for us rain-giving.

original: sa na ūrje pavitraṃ dhāva dhārayā /
analyzed: sa naḥ ūrje pavitram dhāva dhārayā
translated: Flow thou as a purifying stream for our strength,

analyzed: devāsaḥ śṛṇavan hi kam    pavamānaḥ asiṣyat adrakṣāṃsi apajaṅghanat
translated: Hearken to the call of the gods.🔽The Pavamana hath flowed, he hath smitten away the Raksases,

analyzed: pratna vat rocayan rucaḥ
translated: He hath caused the lights to shine as of old.

analyzed: prati asmai pipīṣate viśvāni viduṣe bhara
translated: Bring to him who longs for it all things to the wise one,
To the one who goes to the end of the path, to the one who goes to the end of the way, O men.

analyzed: ā īm enam pratyetana somebhiḥ soma pātamam
translated: Thus let them come to him with Soma-offerings, to him who drinks Soma,

analyzed: amatrebhiḥ ṛjīṣiṇam indram sutebhiḥ indubhiḥ
translated: To Indra, the impetuous one, in the cups, in the pressed juices.

analyzed: pratibhūṣatha
translated: If ye adorn yourselves with the drops, with the Soma juices,

original: vedā viśvasya medhiro dhṛṣattantamideṣate / /🔽asmāasmā idandhaso 'dhvaryo pra bharā sutam /
analyzed: veda viśvasya medhiraḥ  /    asmai asmai id andhasaḥ dhvaryo pra bhara sutam
translated: The wise one knows all the Vedas, and this one seeks the firm one.🔽O Adhvaryu, bring this pressed Soma to him, to him who is ready.

analyzed: kuvid samasya jenyasya śardhataḥ bhiśasteḥ avasvarat
translated: Will he not be the protector of this one, of the noble one, of the impetuous one, from the curse?

analyzed: babhrave nu svatavase ruṇāya divispṛśe
translated: To the brown one with self-power, to the red one who touches the sky,

analyzed: romāya gātham arcata
translated: Sing a song to Soma.

original: hastacyutebhiradribhiḥ sutaṃ somaṃ punītana /🔽madhāvā dhāvatā madhu / /
analyzed: hasta cyutebhiḥ adribhiḥ sutam somam punītana  ro dhāvata madhu
translated: Purify the Soma that is pressed with stones that move by hand,🔽O you who are sweet, run with sweetness.

analyzed: namasā id upa sīdata dadhnā id abhi śrīṇītana
translated: Sit down to the homage, place it, make it smooth,

analyzed: indum indre dadhātana
translated: Place the Soma in Indra.

original: amitrahā vicarṣaṇiḥ pavasva soma śaṃ gave /
analyzed: amitra hā vicarṣaṇiḥ pavasva soma śam gave
translated: O Soma, slayer of enemies, most active, flow for the welfare of the cow,
Doing what is pleasing to the gods.

original: indrāya soma pātave madāya pari ṣicyase /
analyzed: indrāya soma pātave madāya pari sicyase
translated: O Soma, you are sprinkled for Indra to drink, for his rapture,

analyzed: ro manas cit manasaspatiḥ
translated: The mind-born one, the lord of the mind.

original: pavamāna suvīryaṃ rayiṃ soma rirīhi naḥ /
analyzed: pavamāna su vīryam rayim soma rirīhi naḥ
translated: O Soma Pavamana, grant us wealth with good heroes,

analyzed: indo indreṇa naḥ yujā
translated: O Indu, together with Indra.

analyzed: ud ha id abhi śrutāmagham vṛṣamam narya apasam
translated: Lift up the famous one, the bull, the man who has good hands,

analyzed: astāram eṣi sūryaiḥ
translated: You go to the sun, the one who removes.

original: nava yo navatiṃ puro bibheda bāhvojasā /
analyzed: bibheda
translated: He who with the strength of his arms broke nine and ninety forts,

analyzed: ahim ca vṛtrahā avadhīt
translated: And the slayer of Vṛtra slew Ahi.

analyzed: sa naḥ indraḥ śivaḥ sakhā aśvāvat gomat yavamat
translated: That Indra is a gracious friend, bestowing horses, cattle, and barley,

analyzed: iva
translated: Like a cow with abundant milk.

analyzed: bṛhat pibatu somyam madhu āyuḥ dadhat yajñapatau avihrutam
translated: May the mighty, the vast one drink the Soma-nectar, bestowing life on the lord of sacrifice, unbroken.

original: vātajūto yo abhirakṣati tmanā prajāḥ piparti bahudhā vi rājati / /🔽vibhrāḍ bṛhatsubhṛtaṃ vājasātamaṃ dharmaṃ divo dharuṇe satyamarpitam /
analyzed: vāta jūtaḥ yaḥ abhirakṣati tmanā prajāḥ piparti bahudhā vi rājati    vibhrāj bṛhat su bhṛtam vāja sātamam dharmam divaḥ dharuṇe satyam arpitam
translated: He who, impelled by the wind, protects by himself, nourishes the people, shines forth in many ways.🔽The mighty, the vast one, well-filled, most victorious, the law of heaven, truth is placed in the support.

original: amitrahā vṛtrahā dasyuhantamaṃ jyotirjajñe asurahā sapatnahā / /
translated: The slayer of enemies, the slayer of Vṛtra, the best slayer of the Dasyus, the light, the slayer of demons, the slayer of foes is born.

original: idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ jyotiṣāṃ jyotiruttamaṃ viśvajiddhanajiducyate bṛhat /
analyzed: idam śreṣṭham jyotiṣām jyotiḥ uttamam viśvajit dhanajit ucyate bṛhat
translated: This is the best light, the light above all, called the all-conquering, the wealth-conquering, the vast one.

original: viśvabhrāḍ bhrājo mahi sūryo dṛśa uru paprathe saha ojo acyutam / /
translated: The all-embracing light, the great one, the sun to be seen, has extended its imperishable strength far and wide.

original: indra kratuṃ na ā bhara pitā putrebhyo yathā /
analyzed: indra kratum naḥ ā bhara pitā putrebhyaḥ yathā
translated: O Indra, bring us the power, as a father to his sons.

original: śikṣā ṇo asminpuruhūta yāmani jīva jyotiraśīmahi / /
analyzed: śikṣa naḥ asmin puruhūta yāmani jīva jyotiḥ aśīmahi
translated: Teach us, O much-invoked one, in this task, that we may live a long life, O living one.

original: mā no ajñātā vṛjanā māśivāso 'va kramuḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ ajñātā vṛjanā durādhyaḥ mā aśivāsaḥ va kramuḥ
translated: May the unknown, the ill-clad, not step over our paths.

original: tvayā vayaṃ pravataḥ śaśvatīrapo 'ti śūra tarāmasi / /
analyzed: tvayā vayam pravataḥ śaśvatīḥ apaḥ ti śūra tarāmasi  /
translated: With you, O hero, we shall cross over the far-reaching, eternal waters.

original: adyādyā śvaḥśva indra trāsva pare ca naḥ /
analyzed: adya adya śvas śvas indra trāsva pare ca naḥ
translated: Today, tomorrow, O Indra, and the day after, be thou our protector.

original: viśvā ca no jaritRīntsatpate ahā divā naktaṃ ca rakṣiṣaḥ / /
analyzed: viśvā ca naḥ jaritrīn satpate ahā divā naktam ca rakṣiṣaḥ  /
translated: And be thou, O Lord of the brave, our guardian day and night, O thou who art to be praised by all.

original: prabhaṅgī śūro maghavā tuvīmaghaḥ sammiślo viryāya kam /
analyzed: prabhaṅgī śūraḥ maghavā tuvīmaghaḥ sammiślaḥ viryāya kam
translated: The hero, the mighty, the lord of treasures, the most powerful, is united with strength for the sake of (his) hero (son).

original: ubhā te bāhū vṛṣaṇā śatakrato ni yā vajraṃ mimikṣatuḥ / /
analyzed: ubhā te bāhū vṛṣaṇā śatakrato ni yā vajram mimikṣatuḥ  /
translated: Both thy arms, O thou of a hundred powers, are mighty, in which thou hast mixed thy thunderbolt.

analyzed: janīyantaḥ nu agravaḥ putrīyantaḥ sudānavaḥ
translated: The sons of Agrya, the sons of Sudâna, are born again.

original: sarasvantaṃ havāmahe / /🔽uta naḥ priyā priyāsu saptasvasā sujuṣṭā /
analyzed: sarasvantam havāmahe  uta naḥ priyā priyāsu sapta svasā su juṣṭā
translated: We invoke Sarasvant.🔽And may she, the beloved of the beloved, the well-honoured, the seven-sistered (river),

analyzed: rocatī stomyā bhūt
translated: Sarasvatî, be worthy of our praise.

analyzed: tat savituḥ vareṇyam bhargaḥ devasya dhīmahi
translated: The excellent glory of Savitar the God, may we meditate.

analyzed: dhiyaḥ yaḥ naḥ pracodayāt
translated: May he stimulate our prayers.

analyzed: somānām svaraṇam kṛṇuhi brahmaṇaspate
translated: O Brahmanaspati, make thou the sound of the Soma-drops.

analyzed: kakṣīvantam yaḥ auśijaḥ
translated: Kakshîvân, who is the son of Auशिj.

original: agna āyūṃṣi pavase ā suvorjaṃ iṣaṃ ca naḥ /
analyzed: agne āyūṃṣi pavase ā suva ūrjam iṣam ca naḥ
translated: O Agni, thou purifiest our lives: bestow upon us strength and food.

analyzed: re bādhasva ducchunām
translated: Drive thou away our misery.

original: tā naḥ śaktaṃ pārthivasya maho rāyo divyasya /
analyzed: tā naḥ śaktam pārthivasya mahaḥ rāyaḥ divyasya
translated: Grant us that, the great wealth of the earthly king, and of the heavenly (king).

original: mahi vā kṣatraṃ deveṣu / /🔽ṛtamṛtena sapanteṣiraṃ dakṣamāśāte /
analyzed: mahi vā kṣatram deveṣu  ṛtam ṛtena sapantā iṣiram dakṣam āśāte
translated: Or the great lordship among the gods.🔽They, Rta and Ṛta, have obtained the strong, the mighty power.
The two gods, free from guile, increase.
The two who rain from heaven, the two who make the earth flow with water, the two who are the lords of the cloud-covered one,

original: bṛhantaṃ garttamāśāte / /🔽yuñjanti bradhnamaruṣaṃ carantaṃ pari tasthuṣaḥ /🔽rocante rocanā divi / /
analyzed: bṛhantam gartam āśāte  yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣam carantam pari tasthuṣaḥ  rocante rocanā divi
translated: They have attained the great and wide expanse.🔽They yoke the ruddy one, the moving one, the one who stands around the sky.🔽The lights shine in the sky.

analyzed: R yuñjanti asya kāmyau harī vipakṣasā rathe
translated: They yoke his two desirable bays, the two with wings on both sides, the chariot.

original: śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛvāhasā / /🔽ketuṃ kṛṇvannaketave peśo maryā apeśase /
analyzed: roṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛ vāhasā    ketum kṛṇvan a ketave peśaḥ maryāḥ a peśase
translated: The two red ones, the bold ones, the two who carry men.🔽Making a banner for the one without a banner, making a mark for the one without a mark,

original: samuṣadbhirajāyathāḥ / /🔽ayaṃ soma indra tubhyaṃ sunve tubhyaṃ pavate tvamasya pāhi /
analyzed: ro samuṣadbhiḥ ajāyathāḥ  ayam somaḥ indra tubhyam sunve tubhyam pavate tvam asya pāhi
translated: You were born with those who have settled down.🔽This Soma, O Indra, is pressed for you, it is purified for you. You must protect it.

original: tvaṃ ha yaṃ cakṛṣe tvaṃ vavṛṣa induṃ madāya yujyāya somam / /
analyzed: tvam ha yam cakṛṣe tvam vavṛṣe indum madāya yujyāya somam
translated: You are the one who has made it, you are the one who has poured it out. You must drink the Soma, the juice, for the sake of union and joy.

original: sa īṃ ratho na bhuriṣāḍayoji mahaḥ purūṇi sātaye vasūni /
analyzed: saḥ īm rathaḥ na mahaḥ purūṇi sātaye vasūni
translated: Like a chariot, he is yoked for the sake of many, for the sake of great wealth.

original: ādīṃ viśvā nahuṣyāṇi jātā svarṣātā vana ūrdhvā navanta / /🔽śuṣmī śardho na mārutaṃ pavasvānabhiśastā divyā yathā viṭ /
analyzed: viśvā nahuṣyāṇi jātā svarṣātā vane ūrdhvā navanta  / śuṣmī śardhaḥ na mārutam pavasva an abhiśastā divyā yathā viś
translated: He has overcome all the Nahuṣa people. The self-luminous one shines upwards in the forest.🔽Flow, O strong one, like the Marut host, not despised, like the heavenly people.

original: āpo na makṣū sumatirbhavā naḥ sahasrāpsāḥ pṛtanāṣāṇna yajñaḥ / /
analyzed: āpaḥ na makṣū sumatiḥ bhava naḥ sahasra apsāḥ pṛtanāṣāh na yajñaḥ
translated: Be like the waters, like good fortune to us, like the sacrifice with a thousand rewards, seeking the prize.

analyzed: tvam agne yajñānām hotā viśveṣām hitaḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are the priest of all sacrifices, appointed

analyzed: R devebhiḥ mānuṣe jane
translated: Among the gods and among men.

analyzed: sa naḥ mandrābhiḥ adhvare jihvābhiḥ yaja mahaḥ
translated: Do thou, with thy sweet tongues, worship the great one at our sacrifice.

translated: Since we worship the gods one by one, O Agni,

translated: Come, O tawny ones, yoked by prayer, carry the friendly one, the friend,

analyzed: indram gīrbhiḥ girvaṇasam
translated: Indra, the lover of praise, with praises.

analyzed: pātā vṛtrahā sutamā ghā gaman āre asmat
translated: The Vritra-slayer, the drinker, come to the pressed (Soma), to us, O hero,

analyzed: ni yamate śatamūtiḥ
translated: He who has a hundred aids, is ready.

analyzed: ā tvā viśantu indavaḥ samudram iva sindhavaḥ
translated: Let the drops enter into thee, as the rivers into the ocean,

analyzed: na tvām indra ati ricyate
translated: No one surpasses thee, O Indra.

analyzed: vivyaktha mahinā vṛṣan bhakṣam somasya jāgṛve
translated: Thou hast manifested the food of the Soma, O mighty one, to the watchful one,

analyzed: yaḥ indra jaṭhareṣu te

analyzed: R aram te indra kukṣaye somaḥ bhavatu vṛtrahan
translated: Let the Soma be easy for thee, O Indra, in thy belly, O Vr̥itra-slayer,

analyzed: aram dhāmabhyaḥ indavaḥ
translated: Let the drops be easy for thee in thy abodes.

analyzed: jarā bodhaiḥ tat viviḍḍhi viśeviśe yajñiyāya
translated: O thou who wakest with age, grant that to every worshipper,

analyzed: rudrāya dṛśīkam
translated: A fair hymn to Rudra.

original: sa no mahāṃ animāno dhūmaketuḥ puruścandraḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ mahān animānaḥ dhūmaketuḥ puru ścandraḥ
translated: He, the great one, the majestic, the smoke-bannered, the very glorious,

analyzed: dhiye vājāya hinvatu

analyzed: saḥ revāṃ iva viśpatiḥ daivyaḥ ketuḥ śṛṇotu naḥ
translated: Like a lord of men, like a lord of men, may the divine banner listen to us,

analyzed: ro agniḥ bṛhadbhānuḥ

analyzed: tat vaḥ gāya sute sacā puruhūtāya satvane
translated: Sing that to him, O friend, to the invoked, to the mighty one, when the Soma is pressed,

analyzed: ro yadgave na śākine
translated: As (we sing) for the strong one for the cow.

original: na ghā vasurni yamate dānaṃ vājasya gomataḥ /
analyzed: na ghā vasuḥ ni yamate dānam vājasya gomataḥ
