analyzed: R yat sīm upaśravat giraḥ    kuvitsasya pra hi vrajam gomantam dasyu hā gamat
translated: When his close-listening songs are heard.🔽May he, indeed, go to the cattle-filled abode of the Dasyu-slayer,

analyzed: śacībhiḥ apa naḥ varat
translated: And with his powers grant us choice boons.

original: idaṃ viṣṇurvi cakrame tredhā ni dadhe padam /
analyzed: idam viṣṇuḥ vi cakrame tredhā ni dadhe padam
translated: Vishnu strode through this (world): he set his foot in three places.

analyzed: R samūḍham asya pāṃsule
translated: He, the all-encompassing one, in the dust.

original: trīṇi padā vi cakrame viṣṇurgopā adābhyaḥ /
analyzed: trīṇi padā vi cakrame viṣṇuḥ gopāḥ adābhyaḥ
translated: Vishnu, the guardian, the infallible one, strode with three steps.
From there, upholding the laws.

original: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yato vratāni paspaśe /
analyzed: paśyata
translated: Behold the deeds of Vishnu, from whom the observances were seen,

analyzed: indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā
translated: The friend of Indra, fit to be yoked.

original: tadviṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padaṃ sadā paśyanti sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: sadā paśyanti
translated: That is the highest place of Vishnu, which the wise always behold,

analyzed: rocane iva cakṣuḥ ātatam    tad viprāsaḥ vipanyuvaḥ jāgṛvāṃsaḥ samindhate
translated: Like an eye stretched out in the sky.🔽The sages, the singers, the watchful ones, kindle that,

analyzed: R viṣṇoḥ yat paramam padam
translated: The highest place of Vishnu.

original: ato devā avantu no yato viṣṇurvicakrame /
analyzed: atas devāḥ avantu naḥ yatas viṣṇuḥ vicakrame
translated: From there may the gods protect us, from where Vishnu strode,

analyzed: ro adhi sānavi  mā u su tvā vāghataḥ ca na are asmat ni rīraman
translated: On the ridge of the earth.🔽Let not the enemies, O Agni, rejoice in our house, nor the evil-doers.

original: ārāttādva sadhamādaṃ na ā gahīha vā sannupa śrudhi / /
analyzed: ārāttāt vaḥ sadhamādam naḥ ā gahi iha vā san upa śrudhi
translated: Come to the feast from afar, or listen while thou art near.

analyzed: ime hi te brahma kṛtaḥ sute sacā madhau na makṣaḥ āsate
translated: For these, the makers of prayer, sit with the pressed Soma as with mead, as bees (sit) with the flower.

original: indre kāmaṃ jaritāro vasūyavo rathe na pādamā dadhuḥ / /🔽astāvi manma pūrvyaṃ brahmendrāya vocata /

translated: They have sung the lofty praises of ancient truth, the sage's thoughts have flowed forth.🔽Indra has shaken the great riches together, the two worlds, and the sun.🔽The pure, the bright, the milk-headed Soma juices have delighted Indra.

original: indrāya soma pātave vṛtraghne pari ṣicyase /
analyzed: indrāya soma pātave vṛtra ghne pari sicyase

We must win the one who smells of battle, we must win the one who gives us strength.

original: pari tyaṃ haryataṃ hariṃ babhruṃ punanti vāreṇa /
analyzed: pari tyam haryatam harim babhrum punanti vāreṇa
translated: They purify the tawny one, the golden one, the brown one, with the sieve,

original: yo devānviśvāṃ itpari madena saha gacchati / /
analyzed: yaḥ devān viśvān id pari madena saha gacchati
translated: Who goes around with the rapture to all the gods.

analyzed: kaḥ tam indra tvāvaso martyaḥ dadharṣati
translated: O Indra, who is that mortal, O thou of great wealth, who would dare to offend thee?

original: śraddhā ittemaghavan pārye divi vājī vājaṃ siṣāsati / /
analyzed: śraddhā itte maghavan pārye divi vājī vājam siṣāsati
translated: O bountiful one, the strong one thirsts for the booty on the day of the great feast.

original: maghonaḥ sma vṛtrahatyeṣu codaya ye dadati priyā vasu /
analyzed: sma
translated: Stir up the bountiful ones in the slaying of Vr̥itra, those who give dear treasures.

original: tava praṇītī haryaśva sūribhirviśvā tarema duritā / /
analyzed: tava praṇītī haryaśva sūribhiḥ viśvā tarema duritā
translated: By your guidance, O you with tawny steeds, with the princes, may we overcome all difficulties.

analyzed: ā idu madhoḥ madintaram siñca adhvaryo andhasaḥ
translated: Pour out, O Adhvaryu, the most exhilarating of the sweet juices.

original: evā hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ / /🔽indra sthātarharīṇāṃ na kiṣṭe pūrvyastutim /

translated: For you, O hero, are ever to be praised.🔽O Indra, Lord of the Bay Steeds, your ancient praise is not neglected.

analyzed: udānaṃśa śavasā na bhandanā
translated: Exalt the portion with might, not with flattery.

analyzed: tam vaḥ vājānām patim ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ
translated: We, the desirous of fame, have honored him, the lord of strength,

analyzed: aprāyubhiḥ jñebhiḥ vāvṛdhenyam
translated: The most worthy of worship with our most recent songs.

original: taṃ gūrdhayā svarṇaraṃ devāso devamaratiṃ dadhanvire /
analyzed: tam gūrdhayā svarṇaram devāsaḥ devam aratim dadhanvire
translated: The gods have made him, the golden-hued, the god's delight, the most worthy of worship among the gods.

analyzed: devatrā havyam ūhiṣe

analyzed: asya medhasya somyasya sobhare prema adhvarāya pūrvyam
translated: For this our Soma feast, for the delightful one, the ancient one, for the sacrifice.

analyzed: ā soma savānaḥ adribhiḥ tiras vārāṇi avyayā    janaḥ na puri camvoḥ viśat hariḥ sadaḥ vaneṣu dadhriṣe  /
translated: O Soma, pressed with the stones, through the woolen filters, through the unbreakable vessels,🔽Like a man in the bowls, with the tawny ones spread out, you are placed in the woods as a seat.

analyzed: sa māmṛje tiras aṇvāni meṣyaḥ mīḍvān saptiḥ na vājayuḥ
translated: He has been pressed, passing through the fine sieves, like a ram, like a swift one seeking booty,

analyzed: vayam enam idā hyo pīpema iha vajriṇam

analyzed: rocate pra vīryam

original: indrāgnī apasaspari upa pra yanti dhītayaḥ /
analyzed: indra agnī apasaspari upa pra yanti dhītayaḥ

analyzed: indra agnī taviṣāṇi vām sadhasthāni prayāṃsi ca

analyzed: na kim tvā ni yama dāḥ sute gamaḥ mahān carasi ojasā  /

analyzed: yaḥ ugraḥ sanna niṣṭṛtaḥ sthiraḥ raṇāya saṃskṛtaḥ

analyzed: pavamānāḥ asṛkṣata somāḥ śukrāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: The purifying Soma juices, the bright drops, have flowed forth,

analyzed: rocayati

analyzed: pavamānāḥ divaspari antarikṣāt asṛkṣata
translated: The purifying ones have flowed forth from the sky and from the atmosphere,

analyzed: ro adhi sānavi

analyzed: pavamānāsaḥ āśavaḥ śubhrāḥ asṛgram indavaḥ    ghnantaḥ viśvāḥ apa dviṣaḥ

analyzed: R indra agnī vāja sātamā

analyzed: pra vām arcanti ukthinaḥ nīthāvidaḥ jaritāraḥ

analyzed: indra agnī iṣaḥ ā vṛṇe

analyzed: indra agnī navatim puraḥ dāsa patnīḥ adhūnutam
translated: You two, O Indra and Agni, shook ninety forts of the Dasa-wife,

analyzed: ro sākam ekena karmaṇā  upa tvā raṇva sandṛśam prayasvantaḥ sahaskṛta

analyzed: yaḥ ugraḥ iva śaryahā tigma śṛṅgaḥ na vaṃsagaḥ
translated: You who are like a fierce archer, with a sharp horn like a wild boar,

analyzed: agne puraḥ rurojitha
translated: O Agni, you have shattered the forts.

analyzed: ṛtāvānam vaiśvānaram ṛtasya jyotiṣaspatim
translated: The one who is righteous, the all-consuming one, the lord of the light of truth,

analyzed: ajasram gharmam īmahe
translated: We constantly desire the heat.

analyzed: yaḥ idam pratipaprathe yajñasya svar uttiran
translated: He who spreads this out, passing over the essence of the sacrifice,

analyzed: R ṛtūn utsṛjate vaśī
translated: The powerful one releases the seasons.

original: agniḥ priyeṣu dhāmasu kāmo bhūtasya bhavyasya /
translated: Agni, in the beloved abodes, is the desire of the existent and the non-existent.

analyzed: rājati
translated: Alone, with his sister, he shines forth.

analyzed: āṣṭama prapāṭhakaḥ tṛtīyaḥ ṛdhaḥ
translated: The eighth section. The third part.

analyzed: rocate janmanā svām
translated: Agni by his ancient birth, his own.

analyzed: kaviḥ vipreṇa vavṛdhe
translated: The sage grew with the Brāhman.

analyzed: ūrjaḥ napātam ā huve gnim pāvaka śociṣam
translated: I invoke the son of strength, Agni, with purifying radiance,

analyzed: asmin yajñe su adhvare
translated: At this sacrifice, in our own abode.

analyzed: sa naḥ mitra mahaḥ tvam agne śukreṇa śociṣā
translated: You, O Agni, as our great friend, with your bright radiance,

analyzed: devaiḥ ā satsi barhiṣi
translated: Sit with the gods on the sacrificial grass.

analyzed: ud te śuṣmāsaḥ asthuḥ rakṣaḥ bhindantaḥ adrivas

analyzed: nudasva yāḥ parispṛdhaḥ
translated: Drive away those who contend against us.

analyzed: ayā nijaghniḥ ojasā ratha saṅge dhane hite
translated: He, the slayer, with his strength, in the chariot-encounter, when the prize is staked,

analyzed: rocayā a bibhyuṣā hṛdā
translated: You must praise with a fearless heart.

analyzed: asya vratāni na ādhṛṣe pavamānasya dūḍhyā
translated: The observances of this Pavamâna are not to be transgressed by deceit.

analyzed: ruja yaḥ tvā pṛtanyati
translated: Strike him who assails you.

analyzed: tam hinvanti mada cyutam harim nadīṣu vājinam

analyzed: mā tvā ke cit ni yemuḥ id na pāśinaḥ ti dhanva iva tām ihi
translated: Let none, O thou of mighty deeds, bind thee with fetters, as a bird with snares. Go beyond them, as beyond the desert.

analyzed: vṛtra khādaḥ valam rujaḥ purām darmaḥ apām ajaḥ
translated: The eater of Vritra, the breaker of forts, the crusher of the strong, the lord of the waters,

analyzed: sthātā rathasya haryoḥ abhisvaraḥ indraḥ dṛḍhā cit ārujaḥ  /   gambhīrām udadhīn iva kratum puṣyasi gāḥ iva
translated: The stay of the chariot, the companion of the two bay steeds, Indra, the breaker even of the firm.🔽As the deep oceans, thou increasest thy strength as one increaseth kine.

original: pra sugopā yavasaṃ dhenavo yathā hradaṃ kulyā ivāśata / /
analyzed: pra su gopāḥ yavasam dhenavaḥ yathā hradam kulyāḥ iva āśata  /

analyzed: yathā gauraḥ apā kṛtam
translated: As a thirsty bull goeth to the water that is free from foes,

original: āpitve naḥ prapitve tūyamā gahi kaṇveṣu su sacā piba / /
analyzed: āpitve naḥ prapitve tūyama gahi kaṇveṣu su sacā piba  /

analyzed: mandantu tvā maghavan indra indavaḥ rādhaḥ deyāya sunvate
translated: Let the drops of Soma gladden thee, O Indra, for the bestowal of gifts, for him who presses (the juice).

analyzed: āmuṣya somam apibaḥ camū sutam jyeṣṭham tat dadhiṣe sahaḥ  /
translated: Thou hast drunk the Soma this morning, pressed in the wooden vessel. Thou hast taken to thyself the highest might.

original: tvamaṅga pra śuṃsiṣo devaḥ śaviṣṭha martyam /

analyzed: mahe naḥ adya bodhaya uṣaḥ rāye divitmatī

analyzed: sā naḥ adya ābharat vasuḥ vyuccha duhitar divaḥ

analyzed: prati priyatamam ratham vṛśaṇam vasu vāhanam

analyzed: R atyāyātam aśvinā tiras viśvāḥ aham

analyzed: abodhi agniḥ samidhā janānām prati dhenum iva āyatīm uṣāsam

original: yahvā iva pra vayāmujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sasrate nākamaccha / /
analyzed: yahvāḥ iva pra vayām ujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sasrate nākam accha  /
translated: Like young ones, his flames have stretched out, rising up, have gone to the vault of the sky.

analyzed: samānaḥ adhvā svasroḥ anantaḥ tam anyā anyā carataḥ deva śiṣṭe
translated: The endless path of the two sisters, along which they move, directed by the gods,

original: na methete na tasthatuḥ sumeke naktoṣāsā samanasā virūpe / /
analyzed: na methete na tasthatuḥ sumeke naktoṣāsā samanasā virūpe  /
translated: They do not quarrel, they do not stand apart, the well-formed Night and Dawn, of one mind, of different forms.

translated: Coming in the evening, most to be desired in the day, most auspicious, turning to the worshipper.🔽And when you come at the morning twilight, at noon, at sunrise,

analyzed: divā naktam avasā śantamena na idānīm pītiḥ aśvinā tatāna  /

translated: The ruddy lights have sprung up in the sky, they have yoked the ruddy mares to their own chariot.🔽The dawns have made the shining light red, as in the beginning, the deeds.

analyzed: arcanti nārī rapasaḥ na viṣṭibhiḥ samānena yojanena ā parāvataḥ

analyzed: iṣam vahantīḥ su kṛte sudānave viśvedaha yajamānāya sunvate  /

analyzed: abodhi agniḥ jmaḥ udeti sūryaḥ arciṣā

analyzed: āyukṣātām aśvinā yātave ratham prāsāvīt devaḥ savitā jagant pṛthak
translated: The Asvins have yoked their chariot to go, the god Savitar has set the world apart.

analyzed: yat yuñjāthe vṛṣaṇam aśvinā ratham ghṛtena naḥ madhunā kṣatram ukṣatam
translated: If ye yoke your strong chariot, O ye Aśvins, anoint ye our dominion with ghee and mead.

analyzed: asmākam brahma pṛtanāsu jinvatam vayam dhanā śūrasātā bhajemahi  /

analyzed: arvān tri cakraḥ madhu vāhanaḥ rathaḥ jīra aśvaḥ aśvinoḥ yātu suṣṭutaḥ

analyzed: ro hariḥ tuñjānaḥ āyudhā

analyzed: sa marmṛjānaḥ āyubhiḥ ibhaḥ rājā iva suvrataḥ

analyzed: śyenaḥ na sīdati

analyzed: r sa naḥ viśvā divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ adhi
translated: He, bringing all good things from heaven and earth,

analyzed: prāsya dhārāḥ akṣaran vṛṣṇaḥ sutasya ojasā

analyzed: suṣahā soma tāni te punānāya prabhūvaso

analyzed: eṣa brahmā yaḥ ṛtviyaḥ indraḥ nāma śrutaḥ gṛṇe

translated: O thou of great strength, O thou of great prowess, by thy might, by all thy wisdom,

analyzed: sūraḥ na rurukvān śata ātmā

analyzed: hotā yajiṣṭhaḥ apām sadhasthe  /
translated: the Hotar, best at sacrifice, in the abode of the waters.

original: ayaṃ sa hotā yo dvijanmā viśvā dadhe vāryāṇi śravasyā /
analyzed: ayam sa hotā yaḥ dvi janmā viśvā dadhe vāryāṇi śravasyā
translated: This is the Hotar who, twice-born, bestows all valuable things, the desirable,

analyzed: martaḥ yaḥ asmai sutukaḥ dadāśa
translated: the mortal who has given to him with good intention.

original: agne tamadyāṣvaṃ na stomaiḥ kratuṃ na bhadraṃ hṛdispṛṣam /
analyzed: agne tam adyāṣvam na stomaiḥ kratum na bhadram hṛdispṛṣam
translated: O Agni, today with our praises, win thou the sacrifice, the good, the heart-pleasing,

analyzed: ṛdhyāma te ohaiḥ
translated: By means of our prayers.

analyzed: adha hi agne kratoḥ bhadrasya dakṣasya sādhoḥ
translated: For thou, O Agni, art the leader of the good, of the righteous, of the true,

original: rathīrṛtasya bṛhato babhūtha / /🔽ebhirno arkairbhavā no jyotiḥ /
analyzed: rathīḥ ṛtasya bṛhataḥ babhūtha  ebhiḥ naḥ arkaiḥ bhava naḥ jyotiḥ
translated: Of the great sacrifice.🔽Be thou with these hymns our light,

original: agne viśvebhiḥ sumanā anīkaiḥ / /🔽agne vivasvaduṣasaścitraṃ rādho amartya /🔽ā dāśuṣe jātavedo vahā tvamadyā devāṃ uṣarbudhaḥ / /
analyzed: agne viśvebhiḥ sumanāḥ anīkaiḥ  agne vivasvat uṣasaḥ citram rādhaḥ amartyaiḥ  ā dāśuṣe jātavedaḥ vaha tvam adyā devān uṣarbudhaḥ  /
translated: O Agni, with all thy bright forms.🔽O Agni, O immortal one, bring to the worshipper, O all-knower, wonderful bounty,🔽And today, rising early, bring the gods.

original: juṣṭo hi dūto asi havyavāhano 'gne rathīradhvarāṇām /
analyzed: juṣṭaḥ hi dūtaḥ asi havya vāhanaḥ gne rathīḥ adhvarāṇām
translated: For thou art a welcome messenger, O Agni, a bearer of oblations, a charioteer of sacrifices.

analyzed: sajūs aśvibhyām uṣasā su vīryam asme dhehi śravaḥ bṛhat
translated: In union with the two Ashvins, bestow on us heroic strength and high glory.

original: vidhuṃ dadrāṇaṃ samane bahūnāṃ yuvānaṃ santaṃ palito jagāra /
analyzed: vidhum dadrāṇam samane bahūnām yuvānam santam palitaḥ jagāra
translated: The ruddy one, the swift one, the young one, though dwelling with many, is seized by the hoary one.

original: devasya paśya kāvyaṃ mahitvādyā mamāra sa hyaḥ samāna / /
analyzed: devasya paśya kāvyam mahi tvāt yā mamāra sa hyas samāna
translated: Behold the greatness of the god's wisdom. Today he dies, the swift one, the same.

original: śākmanā śāko aruṇaḥ suparṇa ā yo mahaḥ śūraḥ sanādanīḍaḥ /
analyzed: śākmanā śākaḥ aruṇaḥ suparṇaḥ ā yaḥ mahaḥ śūraḥ sanāda nīḍaḥ
translated: The strong one, the ruddy one, the good bird, the great hero, the ancient one without a nest,

original: yacciketa satyamittanna moghaṃ vasu spārhamuta jetota dātā / /
analyzed: yat ciketa satyam id tat na mogham vasu spārham uta jetā uta dātā  /
translated: What he has known is true, not false. He bestows wealth, he conquers, he gives.

analyzed: ā ebhiḥ dade vṛṣṇyā pauṃsyāni yebhiḥ aukṣat vṛtra hatyāya vajrī
translated: By these he has gained manly powers, by which the wielder of the thunderbolt waxed strong for the slaying of Vr̥itra.

original: ye karmaṇaḥ kriyamāṇasya mahna ṛtekarmamudajāyanta devāḥ / /
analyzed: ye karmaṇaḥ kriyamāṇasya mahnaḥ ṛtekarmam udajāyanta devāḥ
translated: Those who were born before the work of creation, the great Gods, who were the first to come into being,

original: asti somo ayaṃ sutaḥ pibantyasya marutaḥ /
analyzed: asti somaḥ ayam sutaḥ pibanti asya marutaḥ
translated: Here is this Soma pressed: the Maruts drink thereof,

analyzed: rājaḥ aśvinā
translated: And the two Asvins, independent Rulers.

original: pibanti mitro aryamā tanā pūtasya varuṇaḥ /
analyzed: pibanti mitraḥ aryamā tanā pūtasya varuṇaḥ
translated: Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa drink of the purified juice,

analyzed: rocataḥ
translated: Of him who hath his seat in three stations, who is strong.

original: uto nvasya joṣamā indraḥ sutasya gomataḥ /
analyzed: uta u nu asya joṣamā indraḥ sutasya gomataḥ
translated: And Indra, too, is pleased with the favour of this Soma-drinker rich in kine,

analyzed: rotā iva matsati
translated: As he is pleased with the morning's Soma.

original: baṇmahāṃ asi sūrya baḍāditya mahāṃ asi /
analyzed: baṭ mahān asi sūrya baṭ āditya mahān asi
translated: Thou art great, O Sûrya, thou art great, O Âditya.

original: mahaste sato mahimā paniṣtama mahnā deva mahāṃ asi / /🔽baṭ sūrya śravasā mahāṃ asi satrā deva mahāṃ asi /
analyzed: mahaḥ te sataḥ mahimā paniṣtama mahnā deva mahān asi  /    baṭ sūrya śravasā mahān asi satrā deva mahān asi
translated: Great is thy greatness, O most mighty God. By greatness, O God, thou art great.🔽Thou, O Sûrya, art great by glory. Thou, O God, art great for ever.

original: mahnā devānāmasuryaḥ purohito vibhu jyotiradābhyam / /🔽upa no haribhiḥ sutaṃ yāhi madānāṃ pate /
analyzed: mahnā devānām asuryaḥ purohitaḥ vibhu jyotiḥ adābhyam  / upa naḥ haribhiḥ sutam yāhi madānām pate
translated: By greatness thou art the God's God, the Priest of the Gods, the all-pervading light that none deceiveth.🔽Come, Lord of gladdening drinks, to what we offer with our bay steeds.

analyzed: upa naḥ haribhiḥ sutam
translated: Come to what we offer with our bay steeds.

original: dvitā yo vṛtrahantamo vida indraḥ śatakratuḥ /🔽upa no haribhiḥ sutam / /
analyzed: dvitā yaḥ vṛtra hantamaḥ vide indraḥ śatakratuḥ  upa naḥ haribhiḥ sutam
translated: He who is best of Vritra-slayers, he who is Indra, he who hath a hundred powers,🔽Come to what we offer with our bay steeds.

analyzed: tvam hi vṛtrahan eṣām pātā somānām asi
translated: For thou, O Vr̥itra-slayer, art the guardian of these drops of Soma.

analyzed: upa naḥ haribhiḥ sutam
translated: Come to us with thy bay steeds to the juice that is pressed.

original: pra vo mahe mahevṛdhe bharadhvaṃ pracetase pra sumatiṃ kṛṇudhvam /
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahe mahevṛdhe bharadhvam pracetase pra sumatim kṛṇudhvam
translated: Bring to you the great one, to the great increaser, make ready your good will to the wise one.

analyzed: viśaḥ pūrvīḥ pra cara carṣaṇi prāḥ
translated: Let the many tribes of men go forth, the leader of men.

original: uruvyacase mahine suvṛktimindrāya brahma janayanta viprāḥ /
analyzed: uru vyacase mahine suvṛktim indrāya brahma janayanta viprāḥ
translated: For the wide-ruling, the great hymn, the wise ones generate the prayer for Indra.

analyzed: tasya vratāni na minanti dhīrāḥ
translated: The wise ones do not violate his ordinances.

original: indraṃ vāṇīranuttamanyumeva satrā rājānaṃ dadhire sahadhyai /
analyzed: indram vāṇīḥ anutta manyum eva satrā rājānam dadhire sahadhyai
translated: The bards have always made Indra, whose wrath is unsurpassed, the king for the winning of wealth.
To the one with the bay steeds, to the great one, the all-inclusive one.

analyzed: yat indra yāvataḥ tvam etāvat aham īśīya
translated: If, O Indra, I were as mighty as thou art,

analyzed: stotāram id dadhiṣe radāvaso na pāpatvāya raṃsiṣam  /
translated: I would choose thee as my praiser, O bountiful one, I would not delight in evil.

analyzed: śikṣeyam id mahayate dive dive rāyaḥ ā kuhacid vide
translated: I would learn to be great day by day, to find wealth somewhere.

original: na hi tvadanyanmaghavanna āpyaṃ vasyo asti pitā ca na / /
analyzed: na hi tvat anyat maghavan naḥ āpyam vasyaḥ asti pitā ca na
translated: For there is no better, O Maghavan, than thee, no father.

analyzed: śrudhi havam vipipānasya adreḥ bodha viprasya arcataḥ manīṣām
translated: Hear the call of the thirsty one, of the mountain, understand the thought of the singing sage.

analyzed: kṛṣva duvāṃsi antamā sacā imā
translated: Make ready the stalls for these that come to thee.

original: na te giro api mṛṣye turasya na suṣṭutimasuryasya vidvān /
analyzed: na te giraḥ api mṛṣye turasya na suṣṭutim asuryasya vidvān
translated: I will not endure thy words, O strong one, nor thy praise, O godless one, O wise one.
I always proclaim thy name, O one with good fame.

original: bhūri hi te savanā mānuṣeṣu bhūri manīṣī havate tvāmit /🔽māre asmanmaghavañjyokkaḥ / /
analyzed: bhūri hi te savanā mānuṣeṣu bhūri manīṣī havate tvām id    mā āre asmat maghavan jyokkaḥ
translated: For many are the libations to thee among men, and many a thoughtful one invokes thee.🔽Drive away from us, O Maghavan, the foe, and give us room to breathe.

analyzed: pra u su asmai puroratham indrāya śūṣam arcata
translated: Sing forth to him the hymn of praise, to Indra, the strong chariot-steed.

analyzed: abhīke cit u loka kṛt saṅge samatsu vṛtraha
translated: Even in the conflict, the maker of room, in the battles, the slayer of Vrtra.

original: asmākaṃ bodhi coditā nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu / /
analyzed: asmākam bodhi coditā nabhantām anyakeṣām jyākāḥ adhi dhanvasu  /
translated: Be thou our helper, O thou that art to be invoked. Let the bowstrings of others break upon their bows.

original: tvaṃ sindhūṃravāsṛjo 'dharāco ahannahim /🔽aśatrurindra jajñiṣe viśvaṃ puṣyasi vāryam /
analyzed: tvam sindhūṃrava asṛjaḥ dharācaḥ ahan ahim    a śatruḥ indra jajñiṣe viśvam puṣyasi vāryam
translated: Thou hast let loose the rivers, thou hast slain the dragon of the deep.🔽Thou art born, O Indra, without a rival. Thou prosperest all good things.

original: taṃ tvā pari ṣvajāmahe nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu / /
analyzed: tam tvā pari svajāmahe nabhantām anyakeṣām jyākāḥ adhi dhanvasu  /
translated: We embrace thee on every side. Let the bowstrings of others break upon their bows.

original: vi ṣu viśvā arātayo 'ryo naśanta no dhiyaḥ /
analyzed: vi su viśvāḥ arātayaḥ ryaḥ naśanta naḥ dhiyaḥ
translated: Drive away all our enemies, all the evil thoughts of the foe.

original: astāsi śatrave vadhaṃ yo na indra jighāṃsati /
analyzed: astāsi śatrave vadham yaḥ naḥ indra jighāṃsati
translated: Thou art the death of the foe, O Indra, who would injure us.

original: yā te rātirdadivasu nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu / /
analyzed: yā te rātiḥ dadivasu nabhantām anyakeṣām jyākāḥ adhi dhanvasu
translated: Thy bounty, O thou that givest freely, let the bowstrings of others break upon their bows.

analyzed: revān id revataḥ stotā syāt tvāvataḥ maghonaḥ
translated: The singer should be dear to thee, O thou that hast abundant wealth, O Indra, the liberal.

analyzed: predu harivas sutasya
translated: Go forward, O son of Hridiva, to the draught.

original: ukthaṃ ca na śasyamānaṃ nāgo rayirā ciketa /
analyzed: uktham ca na śasyamānam nāgaḥ rayirā ciketa
translated: The hymn and the praise have been sung, the dragon of wealth has been thought of.

analyzed: ro na gāyatram gīyamānam
translated: The Gâyatrî has been sung.

original: mā na indra pīyatnave mā śardhate parā dāḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ indra pīyatnave mā śardhate parā dāḥ
translated: Do not, O Indra, give up to the one who delights in toil, or to the impetuous one,

analyzed: śikṣa śacīvas śacībhiḥ
translated: O mighty one, with your mighty powers.

analyzed: ā indra yāhi haribhiḥ upa kaṇvasya suṣṭutim
translated: O Indra, come with your tawny (horses) to Kaṇva's eulogy,

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso / /
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the rule of this very sky, O you who shine in the day, go to the sky.

original: atrā vi nemireṣāmurāṃ na dhūnute vṛkaḥ /
analyzed: atrā vi nemiḥ eṣām urām na dhūnute vṛkaḥ
translated: Here the wheel of these (enemies) is broken, the wolf shakes their fortress,

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso / /
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the rule of this very sky, O you who shine in the day, go to the sky.

original: ā tvā grāvā vadanīha somī ghoṣeṇa vakṣatu /
analyzed: ā tvā grāvā vadanī iha somī ghoṣeṇa vakṣatu
translated: May the stone, accompanied by Soma, speak to you here with its voice,

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso / /
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the rule of this very sky, O you who shine in the day, go to the sky.

analyzed: pavasva soma mandayan indrāya madhumattamaḥ
translated: Flow on, O Soma, gladdening, most rich in sweetness for Indra.

analyzed: te sutāsaḥ vipaścitaḥ śukrāḥ vāyum asṛkṣata  /
translated: Those pressed juices, the wise ones, the bright ones, have flowed to Vayu.

analyzed: asṛgram deva vītaye vājayantaḥ rathāḥ iva
translated: They have flowed for the feast of the gods, like chariots urged on for strength.

original: agniṃ hotāraṃ manye dāsvantaṃ vasoḥ sūnuṃ sahaso jātavedasaṃ vipraṃ na jātavedasam /
analyzed: agnim hotāram manye dāsvantam vasoḥ sūnum sahasaḥ jātavedasam vipram na jātavedasam
translated: I think of Agni as the priest, the bountiful son of strength, the all-knowing god, the sage, the all-knowing one.

original: ya ūrdhvaro svadhvaro devo devācyā kṛpā /
analyzed: yaḥ su adhvaraḥ devaḥ devācyā kṛpā
translated: He who rises straight up, following his own path, the god who looks towards the gods,

analyzed: ghṛtasya vibhrāṣṭim anu śukra śociṣaḥ ājuhvānasya sarpiṣaḥ
translated: Along the path of ghee, of bright shining, invoked with clarified butter.

original: yajiṣṭhaṃ tvā yajamānā huvema jyeṣṭhamaṅgirasāṃ vipra manmabhirviprebhiḥ śukramanmabhiḥ /🔽parijmānamiva dyāṃ hotāraṃ carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: yajiṣṭham tvā yajamānāḥ huvema jyeṣṭham aṅgirasām vipra manmabhiḥ viprebhiḥ śukra manmabhiḥ    parijmānam iva dyām hotāram carṣaṇīnām
translated: O Agni, we will invoke thee, best worshipper, as the most excellent of the Angirases, with our thoughts, with the thoughts of the wise, with the pure thoughts.🔽Shining like the sky, the priest of men,

original: śociṣkeśaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ yamimā viśaḥ prāvantu jūtaye viśaḥ / /🔽sa hi purū cidojasā virukmatā dīdyāno bhavati druhantaraḥ paraśurna druhantaraḥ /🔽vīḍu cidyasya samṛtau śruvadvaneva yatsthiram /
analyzed: śociṣkeśam vṛṣaṇam yam imāḥ viśaḥ prāvantu jūtaye viśaḥ     sa hi purū cit ojasā virukmatā dīdyānaḥ bhavati druhantaraḥ paraśuḥ na druhantaraḥ    vīḍu cit yasya samṛtau śruvat vanā iva yat sthiram
translated: The red-haired bull, whom these people have chosen for the sacrifice, let the people choose for the sacrifice.🔽For he, with his great might, with his variegated splendour, shines forth, the destroyer of foes, like an axe, the destroyer of foes.🔽Even the firm, which is in his agreement, as if it were moving, when it is firm.

analyzed: niṣṣahamāṇaḥ yamate nāyate dhanvāsahāḥ nāyate
translated: Overcoming, he rules, he leads, he conquers the desert, he conquers the wilderness.

analyzed: navama prapāṭhakaḥ dvitīyaḥ ṛdhaḥ
translated: The ninth prapathaka. The second half.

original: agne tava śravo vayo mahi bhrājante arcayo vibhāvaso /
analyzed: R agne tava śravaḥ vayaḥ mahi bhrājante arcayaḥ vibhāvaso
translated: O Agni, your fame and strength are great, your rays shine, O you of bright splendor.

analyzed: bṛhadbhāno śavasā dadhāsi dāśuṣe kave
translated: O you of great light, you bestow strength upon the generous sage.
With pure radiance, bright radiance, and perfect radiance, you rise with your light.

original: putro mātarā vicarannupāvasi pṛṇakṣi rodasī ubhe / /
analyzed: putraḥ mātarā vicaran upāvasi pṛṇakṣi rodasī ubhe
translated: Wandering between the two mothers, you support, you fill both the heaven and the earth.

analyzed: ūrjaḥ napāt jātavedaḥ su śastibhiḥ mandasva dhītibhiḥ hitaḥ
translated: O son of strength, O all-knower, rejoice in our good praises, be pleased with our thoughts.

analyzed: tve iṣaḥ sam bhūri varpasaḥ citra ūtayaḥ vāma jātāḥ
translated: In thee they have placed the food, O thou of abundant power, the wondrous streams born of the good.

analyzed: irajyan agne prathayasva jantubhiḥ asme rāyaḥ amartya
translated: Rule, O Agni, extend thyself among the people, with riches, O immortal one.

original: sa darśatasya vapuṣo vi rājasi pṛṇakṣi darśataṃ kratum / /
analyzed: sa darśatasya vapuṣaḥ vi rājasi pṛṇakṣi darśatam kratum
translated: Thou shinest forth with the form of the wondrous one, thou fillest the wondrous power.

analyzed: iṣkarttāram adhvarasya pracetasam kṣayantam rādhasaḥ mahaḥ
translated: The creator of the sacrifice, the wise one, the lord of great wealth,

original: rātiṃ vāmasya subhagāṃ mahīmiṣaṃ dadhāsi sānasiṃ rayim / /
analyzed: rātim vāmasya subhagām mahīm iṣam dadhāsi sānasim rayim  /
translated: Thou placest the bountiful gift of good things, the abundant food, the unfailing wealth.

original: ṛtāvānaṃ mahiṣaṃ viśvadarśatamagniṃ sumnāya dadhire puro janāḥ /
analyzed: ṛtāvānam mahiṣam viśva darśatam agnim sumnāya dadhire puras janāḥ
translated: The people have placed in the front the truthful one, the mighty one, the all-seeing Agni, for happiness.

original: śrutkarṇaṃ saprathastamaṃ tvā girā daivyaṃ mānuṣā yugā / /
analyzed: śrutkarṇam saprathastamam tvā girā daivyam mānuṣāḥ yugā
translated: We have come to thee, O divine one, with the song, O thou whose ears are quick to hear, O most widely renowned one.

original: pra so agne tavotibhiḥ suvirābhistarati vājakarmabhiḥ /
analyzed: pra saḥ agne tava ūtibhiḥ suvirābhiḥ tarati vāja karmabhiḥ
translated: He, O Agni, with thy aids, with thy wondrous powers, with thy deeds of strength,

analyzed: yasya tvam sakhyam āvitha
translated: passes over, in whose friendship thou hast taken delight.

original: tava drapso nīlavānvāśa ṛtviya indhānaḥ siṣṇavā dade /
analyzed: tava drapsaḥ nīlavān vāśaḥ ṛtviyaḥ indhānaḥ siṣṇavā dade
translated: Thy drop, O Agni, the blue one, the proper one, kindling thee, the strong one, has given.

original: tvaṃ mahīnāmuṣasāmasi priyaḥ kṣapo vastuṣu rājasi / /
analyzed: tvam mahīnām uṣasām asi priyaḥ kṣapaḥ vastuṣu rājasi  /
translated: Thou art dear to the great ones, to the dawns, thou presidest over the nights, over the abodes.

original: tamoṣadhīrdadhire garbhamṛtviyaṃ tamāpo agniṃ janayanta mātaraḥ /
analyzed: tam oṣadhīḥ dadhire garbham ṛtviyam tam āpaḥ agnim janayanta mātaraḥ
translated: The plants have received thee, the proper one, as the embryo, the waters, the mothers, have generated Agni.

original: tamitsamānaṃ vaninaśca vīrudho 'ntarvatīśca suvate ca viśvahā / /
analyzed: tam id samānam vaninaḥ ca vīrudhaḥ ntarvatīḥ ca suvate ca viśvahā
translated: Him, the same, the trees and the creepers, the enclosed and the open, all the time.

original: agnirindrāya pavate divi śukro vi rājati /
analyzed: agniḥ indrāya pavate divi śukraḥ vi rājati
translated: Agni flows for Indra, bright in the sky, he shines forth.

analyzed: mahiṣī iva vi jāyate
translated: Like a great bull, he is born anew.

original: yo jāgāra tamṛcaḥ kāmayante yo jāgāra tamu sāmāni yanti /
analyzed: yaḥ jāgāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante yaḥ jāgāra tam u sāmāni yanti
translated: He who has been awake, the Ṛc verses desire him. He who has been awake, the Sāman chants approach him.

original: yo jāgāra tamayaṃ soma āha tavāhamasmi sakhye nyokāḥ / /
analyzed: yaḥ jāgāra tam ayam somaḥ āha tava aham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ
translated: He who has been awake, this Soma says to him: I am yours in friendship, I am not another.

original: agnirjāgāra tamṛcaḥ kāmayantegnirjāgāra tamu sāmāni yanti /
analyzed: agniḥ jāgāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante igniḥ jāgāra tam u sāmāni yanti
translated: Agni has been awake, the Ṛc verses desire him. Agni has been awake, the Sāman chants approach him.

original: agnirjāgāra tamayaṃ soma āha tavāhamasmi sakhye nyokāḥ / /
analyzed: agniḥ jāgāra tam ayam somaḥ āha tava aham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ
translated: Agni has been awake, this Soma says to him: I am yours in friendship, I am not another.

original: namaḥ sakhibhyaḥ pūrvasadbhyo namaḥ sākanniṣebhyaḥ /🔽yuñje vācaṃ śatapadīm / /
analyzed: yuñje vācam śatapadīm
translated: Homage to the friends who sit in the east, homage to those who sit together.🔽I yoke the speech with a hundred feet.
I yoke the speech with a hundred feet, I sing with a thousand-fold reward.

analyzed: gāyatram traiṣṭubham jagat
translated: The Gāyatrī, the Triṣṭubh, the Jagatī.

analyzed: gāyatram traiṣṭubham jagat viśvā rūpāṇi sambhṛtā
translated: The Gāyatrī, the Triṣṭubh, the Jagatī, all forms are gathered together.

analyzed: devāḥ okāṃsi cakrire
translated: The gods have made their abodes.
Agni is the light, the light is Agni. Indra is the light, the light is Indra.
The sun is the light, the light is the sun.

analyzed: punar ūrjā ni vartasva punar agne iṣā āyuṣā
translated: Return with strength, return, O Agni, with food and life.

analyzed: punar naḥ pāhi aṃhasaḥ
translated: Again protect us from distress.

original: saha rayyā ni vartasvāgne pinvasva dhārayā /
analyzed: saha rayyā ni vartasva agne pinvasva dhārayā
translated: O Agni, return with wealth, swell with thy stream,

analyzed: ro
translated: With all-nourishing (stream), from every side.

original: yadindrāhaṃ yathā tvamīśīya vasva eka it /
analyzed: yat indra aham yathā tvam īśīya vasvaḥ ekaḥ id
translated: If, O Indra, I were like thee, the sole lord of wealth,

analyzed: ro stotā me go sakhā syāt
translated: My praiser would be a friend of mine in obtaining cows.

analyzed: śikṣeyam asmai ditseyam śacīpate manīṣiṇe
translated: I would learn, I would give to the wise one, O lord of might,

analyzed: yat aham gopatiḥ syām
translated: If I were to be the lord of cows.

analyzed: dhenuṣṭaḥ indra sūnṛtāḥ yajamānāya sunvate
translated: The cow, O Indra, the good will, to the sacrificer who presses (Soma),

analyzed: gām aśvam pipyuṣī duhe
translated: The nourishing one milks out a cow and a horse.

original: āpo hi ṣṭhā mayobhuvastā na ūrje dadhātana /
analyzed: āpaḥ hi stha mayobhuvaḥ tāḥ naḥ ūrje dadhātana
translated: The waters are indeed beneficent; place that for our strength,

analyzed: raṇāya cakṣase
translated: For the sake of great joy, for the sake of seeing.

original: yo vaḥ śivatamo rasastasya bhājayateha naḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ śivatamaḥ rasaḥ tasya bhājayata iha naḥ
translated: Of that most auspicious juice of yours, bestow here to us,

analyzed: rocatīḥ iva mātaraḥ
translated: Like eager mothers.

original: tasmā araṃ gamāma vo yasya kṣayāya jinvatha /
analyzed: tasmai aram gamāma vaḥ yasya kṣayāya jinvatha
translated: To him we go for favour, for whose enjoyment you quicken,

analyzed: āpaḥ janayatha ca naḥ
translated: O waters, generate also for us.

original: vāta ā vātu beṣajaṃ śambhu mayobhu no hṛde /
analyzed: vātaḥ ā vātu beṣajam śambhu mayobhu naḥ hṛde
translated: O Vata, let the remedy blow, auspicious and beneficent, to our heart,

analyzed: pra na ayūṃṣi tāriṣat
translated: May it prolong our lives.

original: uta vāta pitāsi na uta bhrātota naḥ sakhā /
analyzed: uta vātaiḥ pitā asi naḥ uta bhrātā uta naḥ sakhiḥ
translated: O Vata, you are our father, you are our brother, you are our friend,

analyzed: ro naḥ jīvātave kṛdhi
translated: Make us live.

analyzed: yat adaḥ vāta te gṛhe mṛtam nihitam guhā
translated: O Vata, whatever immortal essence of yours is hidden away,

analyzed: tasya u naḥ dehi jīvase
translated: Give that to us for life.

original: abhi vājī viśvarūpo janitraṃ hiraṇyayaṃ bibhradatkaṃ suparṇaḥ /
analyzed: abhi vājī viśva rūpaḥ janitram hiraṇyayam bibhrat atkam suparṇaḥ
translated: The strong one of all forms, bearing the golden womb, the well-winged bird,

original: sūryasya bhānumṛtuthā vasānaḥ pari svayaṃ medhamṛjro jajāna / /
analyzed: sūryasya bhānum ṛtuthā vasānaḥ pari svayam medham ṛjraḥ jajāna  /
translated: Clothing himself in the light of the sun in due season, the swift one has produced his own wisdom.

original: apsu retaḥ śiśriye viśvarūpaṃ tejaḥ pṛthivyāmadhi yatsambabhūva /
analyzed: apsu retaḥ śiśriye viśva rūpam tejaḥ pṛthivyām adhi yat sambabhūva
translated: The seed of all forms has been deposited in the waters, the radiance that has arisen on the earth,

original: antarikṣe svaṃ mahimānaṃ mimānaḥ kanikranti vṛṣṇo aśvasya retaḥ / /🔽ayaṃ sahasrā pari yuktā vasānaḥ sūryasya bhānuṃ yajño dādhāra /
analyzed: antarikṣe svam mahimānam mimānaḥ kanikranti vṛṣṇaḥ aśvasya retaḥ  / ayam sahasrā pari yuktā vasānaḥ sūryasya bhānum yajñaḥ dādhāra
translated: Measuring his own greatness in the atmosphere, he moves about, the seed of the strong horse.🔽This sacrifice, clothed in a thousand, has attained the light of the sun.

original: sahasradāḥ śatadā bhūridāvā dharttā divo bhuvanasya viśpatiḥ / /
translated: The giver of a thousand, the giver of a hundred, the giver of much, the supporter of the sky, the lord of the world.

original: nāke suparṇamupa yatpatantaṃ hṛdā venanto abhyacakṣata tvā /
analyzed: nāke suparṇam upa yat patantam hṛdā venantaḥ abhyacakṣata tvā
translated: When they saw you with their hearts, looking up at the bird flying in the sky,

original: hiraṇyapakṣaṃ varuṇasya dūtaṃ yamasya yonau śakunaṃ bhuraṇyum / /
analyzed: hiraṇya pakṣam varuṇasya dūtam yamasya yonau śakunam bhuraṇyum
translated: The golden-winged messenger of Varuna, the busy bird in the womb of Yama.

original: ūrdhvo gandharvo adhi nāke asthātpratyañcitrā bibhradasyāyudhāni /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ gandharvaḥ adhi nāke asthāt pratyañc citrā bibhrat asya āyudhāni
translated: The Gandharva stands erect in the sky, holding his variegated weapons.

original: vasāno atkaṃ surabhiṃ dṛśe kaṃ nāma janata priyāṇi / /
analyzed: vasānaḥ atkam surabhim dṛśe kam nāma janata priyāṇi
translated: Wearing a fragrant garment, looking at the people, what is his dear name?

original: drapsaḥ samudramabhi yajjigāti paśyangṛdhrasya cakṣasā vidharman /
analyzed: drapsaḥ samudram abhi yat jigāti paśyan gṛdhrasya cakṣasā vidharman
translated: When the drop moves towards the ocean, seeing with the eagle's eye, O righteous one,

original: bhānuḥ śukreṇa śociṣā cakānastṛtīye cakre rajasi priyāṇi / /
analyzed: bhānuḥ śukreṇa śociṣā cakānaḥ tṛtīye cakre rajasi priyāṇi
translated: The sun, shining with the light of Venus, in the third heaven, delights in the region of the stars.

analyzed: navama prapāṭhakaḥ tṛtīyaḥ ṛdhaḥ
translated: The ninth section. The third part.

original: āśuḥ śiśāno vṛṣabho na bhīmo ghanāghanaḥ kṣobhaṇaścarṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: āśuḥ śiśānaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ na bhīmaḥ ghanāghanaḥ kṣobhaṇaḥ carṣaṇīnām
translated: Swift, sharpened, terrible as a bull, the crusher of the strong, the agitator of men,

analyzed: saṅkrandanaḥ nimiṣaḥ eka vīraḥ śatam senāḥ ajayat sākam indraḥ
translated: The roaring, unblinking, single hero, Indra conquered a hundred armies at once.

analyzed: saṅkrandanena animiṣeṇa jiṣṇunā yutkāreṇa duścyavanena dhṛṣṇunā
translated: With the roaring, unblinking, victorious, fighting, hard-to-move, bold one,

original: tadindreṇa jayata tatsahadhvaṃ yudho nara iṣuhastena vṛṣṇā / /
analyzed: tat indreṇa jayata tat sahadhvam yudhaḥ naraḥ iṣu hastena vṛṣṇā  /
translated: With that, O Indra, conquer, be victorious together, in battle, O men, with the mighty one with the arrows in his hand.

original: sa iṣuhastaiḥ sa niṣaṅgibhirvaśī saṃsraṣṭā sa yudha indro gaṇena /
analyzed: saḥ iṣu hastaiḥ sa niṣaṅgibhiḥ vaśī saṃsraṣṭā sa yudhaḥ indraḥ gaṇena
translated: He, the powerful one, with the arrow-bearers, with the quiver-bearers, the gatherer, Indra with the troop,

original: saṃ sṛṣṭajitsomapā pratihitābhirastā / /🔽bṛhaspate pari dīyā rathena rakṣohāmitrāṃ apabādhamānaḥ /
analyzed: sam sṛṣṭajit soma pā pratihitā abhirastā    bṛhaspate pari dīya rathena rakṣaḥ hā amitrān apabādhamānaḥ
translated: The gatherer of the conquered, the drinker of Soma, with the thrown weapons, is victorious.🔽O Brihaspati, go around with your chariot, the slayer of demons, repelling the enemies,

analyzed: prabhañjan senāḥ pramṛṇaḥ yudhā jayan asmākam edhya vitā rathānām
translated: Crushing the armies, destroying in battle, victorious, be the protector of our chariots.

original: balavijñāyaḥ sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvānvājī sahamāna ugraḥ /
analyzed: bala vijñāyaḥ sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamānaḥ ugraḥ
translated: The knower of strength, the elder, the chief, the enduring, the strong, the conquering, the fierce,

original: abhivīro abhisatvā sahojā jaitramindra rathamā tiṣṭha govit / /
analyzed: abhivīraḥ abhisatvā sahaḥ jāḥ jaitram indra rathamā tiṣṭha go vid
translated: The hero over the heroes, the strong over the strong, born of strength, O Indra, mount the victorious chariot, finding the cattle.

analyzed: gotrabhidam go vidam vajra bāhum jayantam ajma pramṛṇantam ojasā
translated: The breaker of the cow-pen, the finder of the cow, the wielder of the thunderbolt, victorious, crushing the foe with might,

original: imaṃ sajātā anu vīrayadhvamindraṃ sakhāyo anu saṃ rabhadhvam / /
analyzed: imam sajātāḥ anu vīrayadhvam indram sakhāyaḥ anu sam rabhadhvam  /
translated: Exert yourselves, O kinsmen, for this Indra; O friends, be ye eager for him.

original: abhi gotrāṇi sahasā gāhamāno 'dayo vīraḥ śatamanyurindraḥ /
analyzed: abhi gotrāṇi sahasā gāhamānaḥ dayaḥ vīraḥ śatamanyuḥ indraḥ
translated: Indra, the hero, the irresistible, the hundred-hatred, plunging with violence into the cow-pens,

analyzed: duścyavanaḥ pṛtanāṣāh ayudhyaḥ smākam senāḥ avatu pra yutsu  /
translated: May he, invincible, protect our army in the battles.

original: indra āsāṃ netā bṛhaspatirdakṣiṇā yajñaḥ pura etu somaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ āsām netā bṛhaspatiḥ dakṣiṇā yajñaḥ puras etu somaḥ
translated: Indra be their leader, Brihaspati their right hand, the sacrifice go before them, Soma.

analyzed: deva senānām abhibhañjatīnām jayantīnām marutaḥ yantu agram  /
translated: May the Maruts go in front of the victorious, conquering hosts of the gods.

original: indrasya vṛṣṇo varuṇasya rājña ādityānāṃ marutāṃ śardha ugram /
analyzed: indrasya vṛṣṇaḥ varuṇasya rājñaḥ ādityānām marutām śardhaḥ ugram
translated: The mighty host of Indra the mighty, of Varuna the king, of the Adityas, of the Maruts,

original: mahāmanasāṃ bhuvanacyavānāṃ ghoṣo devānāṃ jayatāmudasthāt / /🔽uddharṣaya maghavannāyudhānyutsatvanāṃ māmakānāṃ manāṃsi /🔽udvṛtrahanvājināṃ vājinānyudrathānāṃ jayatāṃ yantu ghoṣāḥ / /
analyzed: mahāmanasām bhuvanacyavānām ghoṣaḥ devānām jayatām udasthāt  ud harṣaya maghavan āyudhāni utsatvanām māmakānām manāṃsi  ud vṛtrahan vājinām vājināni udrathānām jayatām yantu ghoṣāḥ  /
translated: The shout of the victorious gods hath arisen, of those of great spirit, of those who overthrow the worlds.🔽Excite, O bountiful one, the weapons, the spirits of my heroic men.🔽Let the shouts of my victorious chariots, of my swift horses, rise up.

original: asmākamindraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣvasmākaṃ yā iṣavastā jayantu /
analyzed: asmākam indraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣu asmākam yāḥ iṣavaḥ tāḥ jayantu
translated: May Indra be with us when our banners are victorious, may our arrows be victorious.

original: asmākaṃ vīrā uttare bhavantvasmāṃ u devā avatā haveṣu / /🔽asau yā senā marutaḥ pareṣāmabhyeti na ojasā spardhamānā /
analyzed: naḥ vīrāḥ uttare bhavantu asmān u devāḥ avata haveṣu  asau yā senā marutaḥ pareṣām abhyeti naḥ ojasā spardhamānā
translated: Let our heroes be on the right, let the gods help us in our invocations.🔽That army of the enemies, O Maruts, which advances against us, challenging us with its might,

original: tāṃ gūhata tamasāpavratena yathaiteṣāmanyo anyaṃ na jānāt / /🔽amīṣāṃ cittaṃ pratilobhayantī gṛhāṇāṅgānyapve parehi /
analyzed: tām gūhata tamasā apavratena yathā eteṣām anyaḥ anyam na jānāt  / amīṣām cittam pratilobhayantī gṛhāṇa aṅgāni apve parehi
translated: Hide it with darkness and with sin, so that one of them may not know another.🔽Confusing the minds of these, seize their limbs and depart in peace.

original: abhi prehi nirdaha hṛtsu śokairandhenāmitrāstamasā sacantām / /
analyzed: abhi prehi nirdaha hṛtsu śokaiḥ andhena amitrāḥ tamasā sacantām  /
translated: Go forth, burn them in their hearts; let the enemies sit in the darkness of blindness.

original: pretā jayatā nara indro vaḥ śarma yacchatu /
analyzed: pra ita jayata naraḥ indraḥ vaḥ śarma yacchatu
translated: Go forth, O victorious men; may Indra grant you protection.

analyzed: ugrāḥ vaḥ santu bāhavaḥ na adhṛṣyāḥ yathā asatha
translated: Let your arms be strong, as ye are invincible.

analyzed: avasṛṣṭā parā pata śaravye brahma saṃśite
translated: Discharged, fly away, O arrow, sharpened by Brahman, to the mark.

original: gacchāmitrānpra padyasva māmīṣāṃ kaṃ ca nocchiṣaḥ / /🔽kaṅkāḥ suparṇā anu yantvenāngṛdhrāṇāmannamasāvastu senā /
analyzed: gaccha amitrān pra padyasva mā amīṣām kam ca na ucchiṣaḥ  kaṅkāḥ suparṇāḥ anu yantu enān gṛdhrāṇām annam asau astu senā
translated: Go to the enemies, fall upon them; spare not one of them.🔽Let the herons and the vultures follow them. Let this army be the food of the vultures.

original: maiṣāṃ mocyaghahāraśca nendra vayāṃsyenānanusaṃyantu sarvān / /🔽amitrasenāṃ maghavannasmāñchatruyatīmabhi /
analyzed: mā eṣām mocī agha hāraḥ ca na indra vayāṃsi enān anusaṃyantu sarvān  amitra senām maghavan asmān śatruyatīm abhi
translated: Let not the destroyer of life be set free. Let the birds of prey follow them all.🔽O Indra, the hostile army, which is advancing against us, which is coming to fight with us,

analyzed: ubhau tām indra vṛtrahan agniḥ ca dahatam prati
translated: Let both of them, O Indra, the slayer of Vritra, and Agni, burn it back.

original: yatra bāṇāḥ sampatanti kumārā viśikhā iva /
analyzed: yatra bāṇāḥ sampatanti kumārāḥ viśikhāḥ iva
translated: Where arrows fly like young men's shafts,

original: tatrā no brahmaṇaspatiraditiḥ śarma yacchatu viśvāhā śarma yacchatu / /🔽vi rakṣo vi mṛdho jahi vi vṛtrasya hanū ruja /
analyzed: tatra naḥ brahmaṇaspatiḥ aditiḥ śarma yacchatu viśvāhā śarma yacchatu  vi rakṣaḥ vi mṛdhaḥ jahi vi vṛtrasya hanū ruja
translated: there may Brahmanaspati and Aditi grant us protection, may they grant us protection for all time.🔽Drive away the Raksases, drive away the Mṛdhas, break the jaws of Vritra.

original: vi manyumindra vṛtrahannamitrasyābhidāsataḥ / /🔽vi na indra mṛdho jahi nīcā yaccha pṛtanyataḥ /
analyzed: vi manyum indra vṛtrahan amitrasya abhidāsataḥ  vi naḥ indra mṛdhaḥ jahi nīcā yaccha pṛtanyataḥ
translated: Drive away the anger, O Indra, slayer of Vrtra, of the foe who threatens us.🔽Drive away our enemies, O Indra, cast down those who fight against us.

analyzed: yaḥ asmān abhidāsati adharam gamaya tamaḥ
translated: Whomsoever hateth us, him, O Indra, cast down into the lowest darkness.

analyzed: indrasya bāhū sthavirau yuvānau anādhṛṣyau su pratīkau asahyau
translated: The two arms of Indra are strong, youthful, unassailable, well-formed, and invincible.

original: tau yuñjīta prathamau yoga āgate yābhyāṃ jitamasurāṇāṃ saho mahat / /
analyzed: tau yuñjīta prathamau yoge āgate yābhyām jitam asurāṇām sahaḥ mahat  /
translated: Let them, the first, be yoked when the battle begins, by which Indra has conquered the great strength of the Asuras.

original: marmāṇi te varmaṇā cchādayāmi somastvā rājāmṛtenānu vastām /
analyzed: marmāṇi te varmaṇā chādayāmi somaḥ tvā rājā amṛtena anu vastām
translated: I cover your vital parts with armor. Let King Soma anoint you with nectar.

original: urorvarīyo varuṇaste kṛṇotu jayantaṃ tvānu devā madantu / /
analyzed: uroḥ varīyaḥ varuṇaḥ te kṛṇotu jayantam tvā anu devāḥ madantu  /
translated: May Varuna make your chest wider. Let the gods rejoice in you as you conquer.

analyzed: andhāḥ amitrāḥ bhavata a śīrṣāṇaḥ hayaḥ iva
translated: Let your enemies be blind, let them be headless like snakes.

analyzed: teṣām vaḥ agni nunnānām indraḥ hantu varaṃvaram
translated: Among them, whom Agni has driven away, let Indra slay the best of the best.

original: yo naḥ svo 'raṇo yaśca niṣṭyo jighāṃsati /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ svaḥ raṇaḥ yaḥ ca niṣṭyaḥ jighāṃsati
translated: He who from his own people or from the neighboring people seeks to kill us,

original: devāstaṃ sarve dhūrvantu brahma varma mamāntaraṃ śarma varma mamāntaram / /
analyzed: devāḥ tam sarve dhūrvantu brahma varma mama antaram śarma varma mama antaram
translated: May all the gods protect him. May the Brahman armor be my inner protection. May the peace armor be my inner protection.

original: mṛgo na bhīmaḥ kucaro giriṣṭhāḥ parāvata ā jaganthā parasyāḥ /
analyzed: mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ kucaraḥ giriṣṭhāḥ parāvataḥ ā jagantha parasyāḥ
translated: Like a terrible deer roaming the mountains, come from the farthest end of the farthest region.

original: sṛkaṃ saṃśāya pavimindra tigmaṃ vi śatrūṃ tāḍhi vi mṛdho nudasva / /
analyzed: sṛkam saṃśāya pavim indra tigmam vi śatrūm tāḍhi vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva  /
translated: Sharpening your spear and thunderbolt, O Indra, destroy the enemies and drive away the foes.

original: bhadraṃ karṇebhiḥ śṛṇuyāma devā bhadraṃ paśyemākṣabhiryajatrāḥ /
analyzed: bhadram karṇebhiḥ śṛṇuyāma devāḥ bhadram paśyema akṣabhiḥ yajatrāḥ
translated: May we hear auspicious things with our ears, O gods. May we see auspicious things with our eyes, O worshipful ones.

analyzed: sthiraiḥ aṅgaiḥ tuṣṭuvām saḥ tanūbhiḥ vyaśemahi deva hitam yat āyuḥ
translated: With firm limbs and bodies, may we enjoy the life that is beneficial to the gods.

original: svasti na indro vṛddhaśravāḥ svasti naḥ pūṣā viśvavedāḥ /
analyzed: svasti naḥ indraḥ vṛddha śravāḥ svasti naḥ pūṣā viśva vedāḥ
translated: May Indra of great fame be auspicious to us. May the all-knowing Pushan be auspicious to us.

original: svasti nastārkṣyo ariṣṭanemiḥ svasti no bṛhaspatirdadhātu / /
analyzed: svasti naḥ tārkṣyaḥ ariṣṭa nemiḥ svasti naḥ bṛhaspatiḥ dadhātu
translated: May Tarkshya with unbroken wheels be auspicious to us. May Brihaspati grant us auspiciousness.

analyzed: om svasti naḥ bṛhaspatiḥ dadhātu
translated: Om. May Brihaspati grant us auspiciousness.

analyzed: iti uttara ārcikaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Uttara-Archika.

analyzed: iti sāmaveda saṃhitā samāptā
translated: Thus ends the Sama Veda Samhita.
